original: de lta bas na gzhan nyid yin na yang phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan nyid yin na yang phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, even if they were different, contact would be untenable.

original: smras pa / gzhan du gyur pa gnyis gcig tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan du gyur pa gnyis gcig tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Objection: The two that are different become one.

original: dper na 'o ma dang chu gnyis phrad pa de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na 'o ma dang chu gnyis phrad pa de bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as milk and water come into contact, so too other and other come into contact.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid gnas bzhin te //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid gnas bzhin te //
translated: In that regard, they remain just as they are.

original: gang gi tshe re zhig 'o ma dang chu tha dad par gyur na de'i tshe na phrad pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe re zhig 'o ma dang chu tha dad par gyur na de'i tshe na phrad pa med do //
translated: When milk and water are different, at that time they do not come into contact.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different.

original: gang gi tshe gcig nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe na yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe na yang /
translated: When they become one, at that time

original: phrad pa med de /
analyzed: phrad pa med de /
translated: they do not come into contact.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because they are one.

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe gcig nyid du gyur pa nyid phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe gcig nyid du gyur pa nyid phrad pa yin no //
translated: Objection: When they become one, they come into contact.

original: bshad pa / gal te gcig pa nyid yin yang phrad par 'gyur na ni ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma bshad dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te gcig pa nyid yin yang phrad par 'gyur na ni ci yang mi phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes ma bshad dam /
translated: But isn’t it said that if they were to meet even though they are the same, then nothing would not meet?

original: de lta bas na de yang bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore that is not good.

original: smras pa / gzhan du gyur pa dag phrad bzhin pa ni phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan du gyur pa dag phrad bzhin pa ni phrad pa yin no //
translated: Objection: Those that have become different meet while meeting.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid gnas bzhin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid gnas bzhin te /
translated: In that regard, that is just the same.

original: gal te phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag gcig yod par gyur na de la yang 'di ni gzhan no //
analyzed: gal te phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po dag gcig yod par gyur na de la yang 'di ni gzhan no //
translated: If things called “meeting while meeting” exist as one, then in that regard, this is different.

original: 'di yang gzhan no zhes gzhan yin pa'i phyir phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan no zhes gzhan yin pa'i phyir phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: And this is different. Therefore it is untenable that they meet because they are different.

original: ci ste phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gcig pa nyid du brjod pa yin na ni phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ci ste phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gcig pa nyid du brjod pa yin na ni phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad do //
translated: But if that which is called “meeting while meeting” is said to be the same, then the expression “meeting while meeting” is untenable.

original: gcig pa nyid ni ji @223b ltar phrad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni ji @223b ltar phrad par 'gyur /
translated: How could the same meet?

original: smras pa / phyed phrad pa'i dngos po dag phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba de dag la phrad pa yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / phyed phrad pa'i dngos po dag phrad bzhin pa zhes bya ba de dag la phrad pa yod do //
translated: Objection: Those things that are half met meet while meeting. Meeting exists for them.

original: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid yod do //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid yod do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: But it exists in that which is in the process of coming together.

original: gal te re zhig de dag phyed phrad pa na phyogs gcig phrad pas bdag nyid thams cad phrad do zhes bya bar brtags na ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te re zhig de dag phyed phrad pa na phyogs gcig phrad pas bdag nyid thams cad phrad do zhes bya bar brtags na ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: If you imagine that when they are in the process of coming together, they come together with one part, then they come together with their entire nature, but it is untenable that they come together because they are identical.

original: ci ste phyogs gcig phrad kyang bdag nyid tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur na ni tha dad pa'i phyir phrad par ga la 'gyur /🔽gal te de dag cung zad cig ni phrad cung zad /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gcig phrad kyang bdag nyid tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur na ni tha dad pa'i phyir phrad par ga la 'gyur / gal te de dag cung zad cig ni phrad cung zad /
translated: But if they come together with one part, they would be different in nature. But how could they come together because they are different?🔽If they come together with one part and do not come together with another part,

original: cig ni ma phrad pa yin na ni bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te ;
analyzed: cig ni ma phrad pa yin na ni bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te ;
translated: they would have two natures.

original: de dag gi phrad pa gang yin pa de la ni gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phrad pa gang yin pa de la ni gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa med pa'o //
translated: But that which comes together with one part does not come together because it is not identical.

original: de dag gi ma phrad pa gang yin pa de la yang gzhan pa'i phyir phrad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gi ma phrad pa gang yin pa de la yang gzhan pa'i phyir phrad pa med do //
translated: And that which does not come together with another part does not come together because it is different.

original: smras pa / phrad bzhin pa med kyang sla ste /
analyzed: smras pa / phrad bzhin pa med kyang sla ste /
translated: Objection: It is easy to say that that which is in the process of coming together does not exist.

original: re zhig phrad pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: re zhig phrad pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
translated: But that which comes together exists.

original: phrad pa yod na phrad pa yod pas phrad pa yang rab tu grub po //
analyzed: phrad pa yod na phrad pa yod pas phrad pa yang rab tu grub po //
translated: If contact exists, then contact exists. Thus contact is fully established.

original: bshad pa / kye ma re ba ko re che //🔽gang la phrad bzhin pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / kye ma re ba ko re che // gang la phrad bzhin pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Alas! You have great hope!🔽For one for whom that being in the process of contact is not tenable,

original: phrad par rtsom pa yang mi 'thad pa de la phrad pa 'thad bar 'gyur re skan /
analyzed: phrad par rtsom pa yang mi 'thad pa de la phrad pa 'thad bar 'gyur re skan /
translated: how could contact be tenable?

original: gang gi tshe gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de'i tshe gcig yin na phrad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de'i tshe gcig yin na phrad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When you say “it becomes one,” then if it is one, how could it make contact?

original: ci ste phrad kyang gcig ma yin na ni de lta na yang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ma phrad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste phrad kyang gcig ma yin na ni de lta na yang gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ma phrad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if, although it makes contact, it is not one, then in that case, because it is not different, it does not make contact.

original: smras pa / phrad pa med kyang sla ste re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi snga rol na gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yin ba yod pa de ni phrad pa po ste re zhig yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / phrad pa med kyang sla ste re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi snga rol na gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yin ba yod pa de ni phrad pa po ste re zhig yod do //
translated: Objection: Even if contact does not exist, it is easy to show that the one who makes contact exists prior to contact.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod ma ning la phrag dog za'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod ma ning la phrag dog za'am /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Are you jealous of eunuchs?

original: khyod phrad pa med par phrad pa po yod pa nyid du 'dod ko //
analyzed: khyod phrad pa med par phrad pa po yod pa nyid du 'dod ko //
translated: You assert that the one who makes contact exists without contact.

original: 'di la phrad par byed pas phrad pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni phrad pa po yin na phrad pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di la phrad par byed pas phrad pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni phrad pa po yin na phrad pa de yang rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad do //
translated: Here, if the one who causes contact is the one who comes into contact, then contact is not tenable in any way.

original: de med na phrad par byed ba med pa phrad pa po yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na phrad par byed ba med pa phrad pa po yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then how could the one who causes contact exist without contact?

original: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na /
translated: Therefore, in this way, having first applied reasoning and having analyzed things as they are,

original: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
translated: That now being contacted, contact, and the one who contacts do not exist.

original: de dag med na khyod kyi phrad pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'grub par ga la 'gyur phrad pa brtags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag med na khyod kyi phrad pa bstan pa'i gtan tshigs las byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid 'grub par ga la 'gyur phrad pa brtags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If they do not exist, then how could the intrinsic reality of things that arises from the reason of contact that you have presented come to be established?

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter, called “The Examination of Contact.”

original: // / @224a * //  smras pa / khyod dngos po yod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa yin par sems shing /
analyzed: // / @224a * //  smras pa / khyod dngos po yod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dngos po 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa yin par sems shing /
translated: Objection: You think that because things do not exist, these things are essenceless.

original: dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya bar yang yod la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par yang smra na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya bar yang yod la dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par yang smra na /
translated: Things are said to be dependently arisen and also things are said to be essenceless.

original: ji ltar dngos po byung ba yang yin la ;🔽ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po byung ba yang yin la ; ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could things be arisen and also essenceless?

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams las dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kho na mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams las dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kho na mi 'byung na /
translated: If the essence of things does not arise from causes and conditions,

original: de las gzhan ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de las gzhan ci zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: then what else could arise from them?

original: gal te rgyu spun dag las snam bu'i ngo bo nyid kho na mi 'byung na ci rgyu spun gyi ngo bo nyid dag kho na 'byung ngam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu spun dag las snam bu'i ngo bo nyid kho na mi 'byung na ci rgyu spun gyi ngo bo nyid dag kho na 'byung ngam /
translated: If the essence of cloth does not arise from the causes and conditions, the threads, then does the essence of the causes and conditions, the threads, arise?

original: ci ste ci yang mi 'byung na ni 'byung zhes kyang ji skad du brjod //
analyzed: ci ste ci yang mi 'byung na ni 'byung zhes kyang ji skad du brjod //
translated: But if nothing arises, then how could it be said that it arises?

original: bshad pa / ci khyod rta la zhon bzhin nyid du rta ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod rta la zhon bzhin nyid du rta ma mthong ngam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Are you not seeing the horse while you are riding it?🔽You say that things are dependently arisen,

original: khyod dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang smra la /
analyzed: khyod dngos po rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes kyang smra la /
translated: and you also say that things are essenceless.

original: de dag gang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang ma mthong ko //
analyzed: de dag gang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang ma mthong ko //
translated: But they do not see the absence of intrinsic reality of those.

original: de ni re zhig blo rtsing ba rnams kyis kyang bde blag tu shes par 'gyur te /🔽ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
analyzed: de ni re zhig blo rtsing ba rnams kyis kyang bde blag tu shes par 'gyur te / ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
translated: That is something that even those with a coarse intellect can understand easily.🔽It is not tenable that intrinsic reality

original: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: arises from causes and conditions.

original: 'di la bdag gi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Here, “intrinsic reality” is called “intrinsic nature.”

original: bdag gi dngos po yod pa ni yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yod pa ni yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that something that exists by its own intrinsic nature arises again from causes and conditions.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang bya ba ci yod bya ba med na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang bya ba ci yod bya ba med na rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ci bya /
translated: In that case, what activity would there be with respect to that which exists? If there is no activity, what would causes and conditions do?

original: ci ste de rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung na /
analyzed: ci ste de rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung na /
translated: But if it arises from causes and conditions,

original: de lta na /🔽rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: de lta na / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: then in that case,🔽the intrinsic reality that arises from causes and conditions

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
translated: would be produced.

original: de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But that is untenable.

original: smras pa / ngo bo nyid ni byas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ngo bo nyid ni byas pa kho na yin no //
translated: Objection: Intrinsic reality is just produced.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar snam bu'i dngos po sngon ma byung ba phyis byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar snam bu'i dngos po sngon ma byung ba phyis byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity of the cloth is not previously existent and is later produced.🔽Nāgārjuna responds: How could it be tenable

original: bshad pa // ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //🔽ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa // ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes // ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
translated: That an intrinsic reality is produced?

original: ngo bo nyid byas pa zhes bya bar ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid byas pa zhes bya bar ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te //
translated: How could it be tenable that an intrinsic reality is produced?

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe don de dag dgag pa mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe don de dag dgag pa mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Objection: When those objects are refuted, they are not compatible.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na ni byas pa ma yin la ci ste byas pa yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na ni byas pa ma yin la ci ste byas pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is an intrinsic reality, then it is not produced. But if it is produced,

original: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyang yin la byas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid kyang yin la byas pa yang yin no //
translated: then it is not an intrinsic reality. At that time, how could it be both an intrinsic reality and produced?

original: zhes sems dang bcas pa su zhig de ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes sems dang bcas pa su zhig de ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: What sensible person would grasp it in that way?

original: smras pa / khyod ngo bo nyid rigs pa gang dang ldan par sems //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod ngo bo nyid rigs pa gang dang ldan par sems //
translated: Objection: What kind of logic do you think is appropriate for an intrinsic reality?🔽Nāgārjuna responds: An intrinsic reality is not fabricated

original: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin /
analyzed: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin /
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: @224b gang bya bas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen la yang ltos par mi 'gyur ba rang nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bar 'jug pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: @224b gang bya bas bsgrub par mi 'gyur ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen la yang ltos par mi 'gyur ba rang nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bar 'jug pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis rigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is not established by action and does not depend on causes and conditions, and which is not engaged by a transformation of its own intrinsic reality, is intrinsically reasonable.

original: gang byas pas bsgrub par 'gyur ba dang rgyu dang rkyen la yang ltos par 'gyur ba de ni gzhan la rag las bas gzhan la ltos pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis rab tu ma grub pa yin pas ngo bo nyid ces bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur
analyzed: gang byas pas bsgrub par 'gyur ba dang rgyu dang rkyen la yang ltos par 'gyur ba de ni gzhan la rag las bas gzhan la ltos pa rang gi bdag nyid kyis rab tu ma grub pa yin pas ngo bo nyid ces bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur
translated: That which is established by action and depends on causes and conditions is dependent on another, and since it is not established by itself, how could it be tenable to call it “intrinsic reality”?

original: // smras pa /
analyzed: // smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gang la ltos nas de dngos por 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po ni re zhig yod do //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas de dngos por 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po ni re zhig yod do //
translated: The intrinsic reality of that which becomes an entity in dependence on another exists.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po rab tu grub na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po rab tu grub na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of another is established,

original: ngo bo nyid kyang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang rab tu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then intrinsic reality is also established.

original: bshad pa ; gnyen po la brten nas kyang ngo bo nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa ; gnyen po la brten nas kyang ngo bo nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains: Intrinsic reality is untenable even in dependence on an antidote.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because the existence of another is untenable.

original: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
translated: If essence does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How could there be existence of another?

original: gal te ngo bo nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na de'i gnyen po gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod par 'gyur pa zhig na ;
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid rab tu grub par gyur na ni des na de'i gnyen po gzhan gyi dngos po yang yod par 'gyur pa zhig na ;
translated: If essence were to exist, then the existence of another, which is the antithesis of that, would also exist.

original: / ngo bo nyid mi 'thad de ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid mi 'thad de ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod //
translated: But essence is not tenable. If essence does not exist, how could the existence of another exist?

original: de gzhan gyi dngos po med na de'i gnyen po ngo bo nyid 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de gzhan gyi dngos po med na de'i gnyen po ngo bo nyid 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the existence of another does not exist, how could the antithesis of that, essence, be tenable?

original: yang gzhan yang //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang //
translated: Moreover:

original: ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Essence is not one thing and the existence of another something else.🔽Why is this?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The essence of the existence of another

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
translated: Is said to be the existence of another.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, that which is the essence of the existence of another is said to be the existence of another.

original: de'i phyir gal te gzhan gyi dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin na gang gis de yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzhan gyi dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin na gang gis de yod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if the reality of the other is only essencelessness, then by what is it existent?

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan la gzhan gyi dngos po yang gzhan zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that essence is one thing and the reality of the other is another.

original: de lta na gnyen po nyid med de /
analyzed: de lta na gnyen po nyid med de /
translated: In that case, there would be no antidote,

original: gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would be identical.

original: gnyen po med na ji ltar gnyen po la brten nas 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyen po med na ji ltar gnyen po la brten nas 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If there were no antidote, how could one be established in dependence on an antidote?

original: smras pa / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod do //🔽med do // zhes bya ba 'dis ;
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod do // med do // zhes bya ba 'dis ;
translated: Objection: The reality of things exists.🔽Reply: What can I do about this?

original: kho bo la ci byar yod re zhig dngos po yod do //
analyzed: kho bo la ci byar yod re zhig dngos po yod do //
translated: First, things exist.

original: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: bshad pa / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Apart from essence and the reality of the other, how could there be things?

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: If essence and the reality of the other exist, things would be established.

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If any things existed,

original: ngo bo nyid dang @225a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang @225a * //
translated: they would be either essentially existent

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhig yin grang ste /
translated: or existent in the reality of the other.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality exist, then things would be established.

original: gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngo bo nyid kyang med la /
translated: But when intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rang dang gzhan du ma gyur pa 'ba' zhig pa de yod par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa de'i tshe ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rang dang gzhan du ma gyur pa 'ba' zhig pa de yod par gal 'gyur /
translated: and extrinsic reality also does not exist, then how could a thing that is not expressed, that is not intrinsic and not extrinsic, exist?

original: smras pa / de lta na dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med pa yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / de lta na dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med pa yod de /
translated: Objection: In that case, the nonexistence of things exists.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma ltos par byed pas gang gi phyir dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po yang yod de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma ltos par byed pas gang gi phyir dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po yang yod de /
translated: Since it is made without relying on anything, therefore things that become nonexistent also exist.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de lta na yang dngos po rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / de lta na yang dngos po rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: Even so, it is untenable that things are established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po med pa rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because nonthings are not established.🔽How could a thing exist

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: Without intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality?

original: ces smras zin to //
analyzed: ces smras zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: If things are not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: non-things are not established.

original: gal te dngos po nyid 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub na dngos po med pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes smras pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid 'ga' yang rab tu ma grub na dngos po med pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes smras pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If things themselves are not established at all, then non-things are not established, isn’t this what you said?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Why is this?🔽People say that the transformation of a thing

original: dngos med yin par skye bo smra //🔽'di ltar dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos med yin par skye bo smra // 'di ltar dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: Is a non-thing.

original: zhes skye bo dag smra na /
analyzed: zhes skye bo dag smra na /
translated: In this way, people say that the transformation of a thing is a non-thing.

original: dngos po de yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po de yang med de /
translated: But that thing does not exist.

original: de med na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na dngos po med pa de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it does not exist, then what is that non-thing?

original: dngos po med pa na khyod kyi de'i gnyen po dngos po 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa na khyod kyi de'i gnyen po dngos po 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If a thing does not exist, how could its antidote, a non-thing, be tenable for you?

original: smras pa / 'di la de kho na mthong bas thar par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la de kho na mthong bas thar par 'gyur ro // zhes bya zhing /
translated: Objection: Here, one is liberated by seeing reality.

original: de kho na zhes bya ba yang de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba yang de'i dngos po ni de kho na ste /
translated: And that which is called “reality” is the thing that is reality.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “nature of things” is the same.

original: de la gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na de lta na khyod la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na de lta na khyod la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If you say that the nature of things does not exist, then would it not be untenable for you to see reality?

original: de kho na mthong ba med na thar pa 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba med na thar pa 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you do not see reality, how could liberation be tenable?

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bar lta ba de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya bar lta ba de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the view that things lack entityness is not good.🔽Nāgārjuna responds: Do not hold that view!🔽Those who view entityness, otherness,

original: bshad pa / log par ma 'dzin cig / gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //🔽de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: bshad pa / log par ma 'dzin cig / gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Entity, and nonentity🔽Do not see

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha’s teaching of reality.

original: gang dag de ltar @225b ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid lta ba de dag ni 'di ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mchog tu zab pa la de kho na mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar @225b ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid lta ba de dag ni 'di ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mchog tu zab pa la de kho na mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Those who view entityness, otherness, entity, and nonentity do not see reality in the Buddha’s teaching, which is supreme and profound.

original: kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nyi ma shar bas snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo cag nyid la de kho na mthong ba yod
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nyi ma shar bas snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas de'i phyir kho bo cag nyid la de kho na mthong ba yod
translated: We see the lack of intrinsic reality of things that are illuminated by the rising sun of dependent origination just as it is. Therefore we alone see reality.

original: pas kho bo cag kho na la thar pa yang 'thad do //
analyzed: pas kho bo cag kho na la thar pa yang 'thad do //
translated: Therefore liberation is tenable for us alone.

original: gal te de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: Because the Bhagavān, the teacher,

original: ston pas ka ta ya na yi //
analyzed: ston pas ka ta ya na yi //
translated: in the instruction to Kātyāyana,

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag pa mdzad //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyi ga 'ang dgag pa mdzad //
translated: refuted both existence and nonexistence.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das don dam pa'i de kho na la mkhas pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rab tu ston pas ka ta ya na'i gdams ngag ces bya ba'i mdo las yod pa zhes bya ba dang med pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das don dam pa'i de kho na la mkhas pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rab tu ston pas ka ta ya na'i gdams ngag ces bya ba'i mdo las yod pa zhes bya ba dang med pa zhes bya ba gnyi ga yang
translated: Because the Bhagavān, who is skilled in ultimate reality, in the sūtra called the Instruction to Kātyāyana, refuted both existence and nonexistence by teaching things and nonthings,

original: dgag pa mdzad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa mdzad pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore he refuted both.

original: gang dag dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba de dag gis de kho na mi mthong bas de dag nyid la yang thar pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du rjes su lta ba de dag gis de kho na mi mthong bas de dag nyid la yang thar pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Since those who view things as existent or nonexistent do not see reality, liberation is not tenable for them.

original: kho bo cag yod pa nyid med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par tha snyad byed pa dag la ni mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag yod pa nyid med pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med par tha snyad byed pa dag la ni mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: But for us, who make assertions without adhering to existence or nonexistence, there is no untenability.

original: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba de kho na mthong ba yin na ni de kho na la ma mthong ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur bas de ni kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba de kho na mthong ba yin na ni de kho na la ma mthong ba 'ga' yang med par 'gyur bas de ni kho na ma yin no //
translated: If seeing things as existent or nonexistent were seeing reality, then since there would be no one who did not see reality, it would not be reality.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni de kho na yin la de mthong ba kho nas thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni de kho na yin la de mthong ba kho nas thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the absence of intrinsic reality of things is reality, and through seeing just that, one is liberated.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence;

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: Objects are its object-field.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the selflessness of objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of existence ceases.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: So it is said.

original: de ni de ltar nges pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nges pa kho nar shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood with certainty.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
translated: if things existed inherently,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not become nonexistent.

original: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin par gyur na yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin par gyur na yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If things existed inherently, that existence would not become nonexistent later.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Because it is never tenable

original: 'di ltar / rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //🔽nam yang 'thad par mi @226a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni // nam yang 'thad par mi @226a * //
translated: that an essence changes into something else.

original: 'gyur ro // 'di ltar 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur rtag pa yin pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'di ltar 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur rtag pa yin pa'i rigs na /
translated: Since an essence is the antidote to change, therefore it is reasonable that an essence is unchanging and permanent.

original: dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba snang bas de'i phyir de dag la ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba snang bas de'i phyir de dag la ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: But since it is seen that things change, therefore it is not tenable that they exist inherently.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te dngos po med par mthong ba las dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par khong du chud pas na re zhig dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med par mthong ba las dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par khong du chud pas na re zhig dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med par gyur pa yin no //
translated: If you understand that the nature of things does not exist because of seeing their nonexistence, then the nonexistence of things would be established.

original: bshad pa / rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bshad pa / rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If essential nature does not exist,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: What is it that transforms into something else?

original: gang gi tshe dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis med do zhes smras pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid rang bzhin gyis med do zhes smras pa de'i tshe /
translated: When you say that existence does not exist through its essential nature,

original: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba de nyid de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na gzhan du 'gyur ba de nyid de gang gi yin par 'gyur /
translated: then if the existence of things does not exist through its essential nature, what is it that transforms into something else?

original: smras pa / gal te dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med pa snang la rang bzhin yang yod pa ma yin na dngos po med pa mi 'thad de gang gi dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gdon mi za bar yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dngos po rnams kyi dngos po med pa snang la rang bzhin yang yod pa ma yin na dngos po med pa mi 'thad de gang gi dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gdon mi za bar yod pa nyid do //
translated: Objection: If the nonexistence of things appears and essential nature does not exist, then nonexistence is not tenable. Without a doubt, the essential nature of things that would become nonexistent must exist.

original: bshad pa / rang bzhin yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: bshad pa / rang bzhin yod pa yin na yang //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If essential nature exists,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ji ltar rung //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be tenable that it transforms into something else?🔽Previously, it was said:

original: sngar yang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: sngar yang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The transformation of an essence

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Is never tenable.

original: 'di ltar 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur bar rtag par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur ba'i gnyen po ni rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur bar rtag par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: Since the antidote to transformation is essence, therefore it is reasonable that essence is unchanging and permanent.

original: zhes ma bshad dam /
analyzed: zhes ma bshad dam /
translated: Was this not explained?

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi med pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi med pa nyid kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore the nonexistence of things is also untenable.

original: dngos po rnams la yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta ba la skyon gzhan 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta ba la skyon gzhan 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Another error that ensues from the view that things exist or do not exist is as follows:

original: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
translated: To say “it exists” is to apprehend permanence,

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta //🔽de phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta // de phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: To say “it does not exist” is to view it as annihilated.🔽Therefore the wise do not maintain

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: That things exist or do not exist.

original: dngos po yod do zhes dngos por lta ba de la ni rtag par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po yod do zhes dngos por lta ba de la ni rtag par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: To say “things exist” is to view things as existent, and that entails the error of apprehending them as permanent.

original: dngos po med do zhes med par lta ba de la ni chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dngos po med do zhes med par lta ba de la ni chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: To say “things do not exist” is to view things as nonexistent, and that entails the error of viewing them as annihilated.

original: de gnyi ga yang don med pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang don med pa dang gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Both of these are meaningless and harmful.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa nyid du lta na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, if one views things as existent or nonexistent, the errors of eternalism and nihilism would ensue.

original: de yang don med pa dang gnod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de yang don med pa dang gnod par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since that is meaningless and harmful,

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa de kho na rtogs par 'dod pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa @226b las rgal bar 'dod pas yod pa nyid dang med pa gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa de kho na rtogs par 'dod pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa @226b las rgal bar 'dod pas yod pa nyid dang med pa gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: therefore, the wise who desire to understand reality and who desire to cross the desert of cyclic existence should not dwell on existence or nonexistence.

original: smras pa / yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta na ji ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta na ji ltar rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Objection: If one views things as existent or nonexistent, how does the error of eternalism or nihilism ensue?🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
translated: That which exists by its own intrinsic reality🔽Is permanent because it would not become nonexistent.

original: de ni med pa min pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa //
analyzed: de ni med pa min pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa //
translated: If it is said that what previously arose does not exist now,

original: des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Then it follows that it is annihilated.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa de ni phyis med pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: In this way, it is untenable that what exists by its own intrinsic reality becomes nonexistent later.

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir yod pa nyid du lta ba las rtag par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir yod pa nyid du lta ba las rtag par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since its nature is unchanging, therefore, from the view of its existence, it becomes the view of permanence.

original: dngos po de sngon du byung ba la da ltar med do zhes dngos po yod pa la 'jig par lta ba des na chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po de sngon du byung ba la da ltar med do zhes dngos po yod pa la 'jig par lta ba des na chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the view of the existence of things is that things that previously arose do not exist now, from that view of the destruction of existent things, it becomes the view of annihilation.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta ba skyon du mar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni de kho na mthong ba ste dbu ma'i lam yin la de
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir dngos po rnams la yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du lta ba skyon du mar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba de ni de kho na mthong ba ste dbu ma'i lam yin la de
translated: Thus, because the view of the existence and nonexistence of things has many faults, therefore, the statement “Things are essenceless” is seeing the way things really are, the middle way, and

original: nyid don dam pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid don dam pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: that itself is the establishment of the ultimate.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'o /🔽// / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'o / // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter, called the Critique of Existence and Nonexistence.

original: bam po drug pa /
analyzed: bam po drug pa /
translated: Buddhapālita’s Commentary on the Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba med pa gang la 'ga' yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcing ba dang thar par mi 'thad par de ji ltar de kho na yin /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba med pa gang la 'ga' yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcing ba dang thar par mi 'thad par de ji ltar de kho na yin /
translated: But how could that which is not seen as either an existent or a nonexistent thing be reality, since it is untenable that anything cycles in samsara or attains nirvana or is bound or liberated?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba yod na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba yod na /
translated: If one sees things as existent or nonexistent,

original: de dag thams cad 'thad pas dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'thad pas dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin no //
translated: then all of that is tenable. Therefore, seeing things as existent or nonexistent is seeing reality.

original: bshad pa / gang la dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba de la de dag thams cad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang la dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba de la de dag thams cad mi 'thad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: For those who see things as existent or nonexistent, all of that is untenable.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di la dngos por smra ba dag dngos po dag tu yongs su rtog pa na 'du byed rnams dang sems can la dngos por yongs su rtog grang na /🔽de dag la dngos por yongs su rtog pa na rtag pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la dngos por smra ba dag dngos po dag tu yongs su rtog pa na 'du byed rnams dang sems can la dngos por yongs su rtog grang na / de dag la dngos por yongs su rtog pa na rtag pa'am /
translated: Here, if proponents of things conceive of things, they conceive of compounded phenomena and sentient beings as things.

original: mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they conceive of them as things, it follows that they are either permanent or impermanent.

original: de la / gal te 'du byed 'khor zhe na //
analyzed: de la / gal te 'du byed 'khor zhe na //
translated: In that regard: If you think compounded phenomena cycle,

original: de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
analyzed: de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
translated: If they are permanent, they do not cycle.

original: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
translated: If they are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
analyzed: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
translated: This same principle applies to sentient beings.

original: de la gal te re zhig 'du byed rnams 'khor bar yongs su rtog na de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la gal te re zhig 'du byed rnams 'khor bar yongs su rtog na de mi 'thad de /
translated: If you think that formations cycle, that is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
translated: Why?🔽If they are permanent, they do not cycle.

original: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //🔽re zhig 'du @227a * //
analyzed: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur // re zhig 'du @227a * //
translated: If they are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: byed rnams rtag na mi 'khor te /
analyzed: byed rnams rtag na mi 'khor te /
translated: First, if formations are permanent, they do not cycle.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa dag ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dag ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the permanent does not change.

original: 'di la gang rgyud kyi rgyun gyis de dang der skye ba dang 'gag pa de ni 'khor ba zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: 'di la gang rgyud kyi rgyun gyis de dang der skye ba dang 'gag pa de ni 'khor ba zhes bya ba na /
translated: Here, that which arises and ceases in this and that state through the continuum of the stream is called “cycling.”

original: 'du byed rtag pa mi 'gyur ba rnams ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du mi 'thad pas /🔽de'i phyir 'du byed rnams mi rtag na mi 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rtag pa mi 'gyur ba rnams ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du mi 'thad pas / de'i phyir 'du byed rnams mi rtag na mi 'khor ro //
translated: But it is untenable that permanent, unchanging formations have the quality of arising and disintegrating.🔽Therefore, if formations are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa na yang mi 'khor te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa na yang mi 'khor te /
translated: Also, if formations are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: 'di ltar 'di na 'du byed gang kho na dag 'gag pa de dag kho na yang gzhan du mi skye bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na 'du byed gang kho na dag 'gag pa de dag kho na yang gzhan du mi skye bas /
translated: As such, since those formations that cease do not arise elsewhere,

original: de'i phyir gtan du 'gags pa rnams la 'khor ba mi 'thad pas de'i phyir 'du byed rnams mi rtag na yang mi 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan du 'gags pa rnams la 'khor ba mi 'thad pas de'i phyir 'du byed rnams mi rtag na yang mi 'khor te /
translated: they are permanently ceased. Therefore, since samsara is untenable for those permanently ceased, therefore, even though formations are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: de ltar re zhig 'du byed kyi ming can gyi dngos po rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'du byed kyi ming can gyi dngos po rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, in this way, it is untenable that permanent or impermanent things called formations cycle.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'du byed rnams ni mi 'khor gyi sems can ni 'khor bar sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'du byed rnams ni mi 'khor gyi sems can ni 'khor bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that formations do not cycle but sentient beings cycle,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
analyzed: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
translated: This same process applies to sentient beings.

original: 'du byed rnams la'ang 'khor ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de nyid sems can la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la'ang 'khor ba mi 'thad par bstan pa'i rim pa gang yin pa de nyid sems can la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This same process that demonstrates the untenability of the cycling of formations applies to sentient beings as well.

original: 'di ltar sems can yang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can yang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig 'khor bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, is a permanent or impermanent sentient being one who cycles?

original: de'i phyir de la yang rtag pa la ni 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang rtag pa la ni 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, cycling is untenable for a permanent sentient being.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not change.

original: mi rtag pa la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad de bsgrim mi dgos par gtan du 'gags pa'i phir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad de bsgrim mi dgos par gtan du 'gags pa'i phir ro //
translated: Also, it is untenable that the impermanent cycles, because it definitely ceases without the need for exertion.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: rim pa de ni sems can 'khor ba la mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim pa de ni sems can 'khor ba la mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: That process is not the same for sentient beings cycling.

original: 'di ltar sems can ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Because sentient beings are not to be described as the same as or different from the aggregates, bases, and elements, and they are also not to be described as permanent or impermanent.

original: de'i phyir sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i skyon dang bral ba 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i skyon dang bral ba 'khor ro //
translated: Therefore, sentient beings cycle free from the errors of permanence and impermanence.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na //🔽phung po skye mched khams rnams la //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na // phung po skye mched khams rnams la //
translated: If you think the person cycles,🔽It is sought in the aggregates, bases, and elements

original: de ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
translated: In five ways.

original: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, what cycles?

original: gal te 'di ltar gang zag 'khor bar sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar gang zag 'khor bar sems na /
translated: If you think that the person cycles in that way,

original: de ni ches shin tu mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni ches shin tu mi 'thad de /
translated: that is utterly untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams la de rnam pa lngas btsal na med pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams la de rnam pa lngas btsal na med pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because when the person is sought in the fivefold way in the aggregates, bases, and constituents, it is not found.

original: khyod kyi rang dga' gang zag dgos pa med pa ri dvags @227b bcos ma lta bu yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams la rnams pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med de /
analyzed: khyod kyi rang dga' gang zag dgos pa med pa ri dvags @227b bcos ma lta bu yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de ni phung po dang skye mched dang khams la rnams pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med de /
translated: The person you assert to exist by its own nature, which is a useless fabrication like a fake deer, is not observed when sought in the fivefold way in the aggregates, bases, and constituents.

original: gang rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med pa de rnams gzhan gang gis yod par bzung ste /
analyzed: gang rnam pa lngas btsal na dmigs su med pa de rnams gzhan gang gis yod par bzung ste /
translated: What is not observed when sought in the fivefold way, how can it be apprehended as existent by any other means?

original: de'i phyir de ni med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore it is nonexistent.

original: de med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'khor ba de smros shig /
analyzed: de med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'khor ba de smros shig /
translated: If it does not exist, then tell us, what is it that cycles in samsara?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
analyzed: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
translated: If it cycles from appropriation to appropriation,

original: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
translated: existence would be nonexistent.

original: srid med nye bar len med na //
analyzed: srid med nye bar len med na //
translated: If existence and appropriation do not exist,

original: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: what is it that cycles?

original: gal te gang zag 'khor ro zhes brtags na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag 'khor ro zhes brtags na /
translated: If you impute that the person cycles,

original: de lta na de nye bar len pa nas /
analyzed: de lta na de nye bar len pa nas /
translated: then in that case, it would cycle from appropriation to appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa gzhan du 'khor ba na srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa gzhan du 'khor ba na srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to cycle to another appropriation, then existence would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i dbang gis srid par gdags pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i dbang gis srid par gdags pa yin na /
translated: Because existence is imputed due to the power of appropriation.

original: de'i nye bar len pa de yang nye bar len pa'i bar skabs su 'jug pa la de med na gang gis srid par gdags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa de yang nye bar len pa'i bar skabs su 'jug pa la de med na gang gis srid par gdags par 'gyur te /
translated: If that appropriation were to cease in the interim, then since it would not exist, due to what would existence be imputed?

original: de'i phyir de la nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la nye bar len pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it would not have appropriation,

original: srid pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that existence would not exist.

original: gang srid pa med pa nye bar len pa med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa tha snyad gdags pa med pa de gang yin zhing nye bar len pa gang du 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang srid pa med pa nye bar len pa med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa tha snyad gdags pa med pa de gang yin zhing nye bar len pa gang du 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: What is it that is without existence, without appropriation, without manifestation, and without designation? To what appropriation would one cycle?

original: gang gi tshe ma blangs pa la nye bar len pa nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma blangs pa la nye bar len pa nyid kyang med do //
translated: When it is not appropriated, it is not even appropriation.

original: smras pa / de ni bar ma do'i srid pas nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni bar ma do'i srid pas nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Objection: Since it has appropriation, it is an intermediate existence.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho nas srid pa gzhan len pas srid pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa kho nas srid pa gzhan len pas srid pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since only one who possesses appropriation takes up another existence, existence would not be nonexistent.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gang nye bar len pa 'di bor nas bar mdo'i srid pa'i nye bar len pas 'pho ba dang bar mdo'i srid pa'i nye bar len pa yang bor nas de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len par 'pho ba de la yang de'i bar skabs na srid pa med pa
analyzed: bshad pa / gang nye bar len pa 'di bor nas bar mdo'i srid pa'i nye bar len pas 'pho ba dang bar mdo'i srid pa'i nye bar len pa yang bor nas de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len par 'pho ba de la yang de'i bar skabs na srid pa med pa
translated: That which abandons this appropriation and transfers to the intermediate existence’s appropriation and that which abandons the intermediate existence’s appropriation and transfers to another appropriation, in that case, in the interim, there would be🔽neither existence nor appropriation.

original: dang / nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba de nyid so na gnas bzhin nas /
analyzed: dang / nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba de nyid so na gnas bzhin nas /
translated: Since that is just the way things are,

original: de'i phyir sems can yang 'khor bar mi 'thad do //🔽de ni / 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can yang 'khor bar mi 'thad do // de ni / 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
translated: it is also untenable that sentient beings cycle.

original: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is untenable in any way🔽that formations attain nirvana.

original: 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar ni ji lta bur yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar ni ji lta bur yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is untenable in any way that formations attain nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that they would be permanent or impermanent.

original: de la re zhig gal te 'du byed rnams rtag par yongs su brtags na 'du byed @228a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te 'du byed rnams rtag par yongs su brtags na 'du byed @228a * //
translated: First, if you imagine that compounded phenomena are permanent, then since🔽they would not disintegrate, they would not be conditions.

original: rnams rtag par mi 'gyur ba rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas ci zhig khyad par du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnams rtag par mi 'gyur ba rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas ci zhig khyad par du byed par 'gyur /
translated: First, if you imagine that compounded phenomena are permanent, then what difference would be made by attaining nirvana for those compounded phenomena that are not impermanent?

original: ci ste byed na ni 'gyur pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste byed na ni 'gyur pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that a difference is made, then because they would change, they would be impermanent.

original: ci ste 'du byed rnams mi rtag na ni de lta na yang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gags shing med pa rnams la mya ngan las 'da' bar gang gi yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste 'du byed rnams mi rtag na ni de lta na yang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gags shing med pa rnams la mya ngan las 'da' bar gang gi yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if compounded phenomena are impermanent, then in that case, since they would be subject to destruction, what would nirvana be for those that have ceased and do not exist?

original: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also not tenable that compounded phenomena attain nirvana.

original: de la 'di snyam du sems can mya ngan las 'da'o snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sems can mya ngan las 'da'o snyam na /
translated: But if you think that a sentient being attains nirvana,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar //🔽ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar // ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽How could a sentient being🔽Attain nirvana in any way?

original: sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar yang ji lta bur yang 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar yang ji lta bur yang 'thad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could a sentient being attain nirvana in any way?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the errors of permanence and impermanence would follow.

original: de la re zhig gal te sems can rtag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te sems can rtag par 'gyur na /
translated: In that regard, if sentient beings were permanent,

original: rtag par mi 'gyur ba rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas ci yang byar med pa dang / skyon du mar thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag par mi 'gyur ba rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas ci yang byar med pa dang / skyon du mar thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be nothing to do to attain nirvana for those who are permanent, and many errors would follow.

original: ci ste sems can mi rtag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste sems can mi rtag par 'gyur na /
translated: But if sentient beings were impermanent,

original: de lta na yang mi rtag pa bsgrim mi dgos par 'gags pa la mya ngan las 'das pas yang ci zhig bya zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gis yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi rtag pa bsgrim mi dgos par 'gags pa la mya ngan las 'das pas yang ci zhig bya zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gis yin par 'gyur /
translated: then what would be the point of nirvana, since the impermanent cease without effort, and by what nirvana would one be liberated?

original: de la 'di snyam du sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa mya ngan las 'das par 'thad par sems na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa mya ngan las 'das par 'thad par sems na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: If you think that it is tenable that sentient beings who are neither permanent nor impermanent attain nirvana, that also is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid la 'thad kyi nye bar len pa med pa la ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid la 'thad kyi nye bar len pa med pa la ni mi 'thad do //
translated: That which is not described as permanent or impermanent is tenable in relation to that which possesses appropriation, but it is not tenable in relation to that which lacks appropriation.

original: sems can nye bar len pa med pa mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin na nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can nye bar len pa med pa mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin na nye bar len pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: If a sentient being who lacks appropriation is to be liberated, then why is that which is devoid of appropriation alone not described as permanent or impermanent?

original: de la 'di snyam du nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no snyam na de la bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no snyam na de la bshad par bya ste //
translated: But if you think that which lacks appropriation is not described as existent or nonexistent, then this should be explained.

original: gang yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de la ji ltar mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de la ji ltar mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod par bya /
translated: How could that which is not described as existent or nonexistent be said to attain nirvana?

original: smras pa / nye bar len pa med pa gang yin pa de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par @228b 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / nye bar len pa med pa gang yin pa de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par @228b 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: That which is without appropriation cannot be said to exist or not exist.

original: ji ltar nye bar len pa dang bcas pa yod na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar len pa dang bcas pa yod na de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as that which possesses appropriation cannot be said to be the same or different.

original: bshad pa / gang nye bar len pa med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa de la yod pa nyid du gang gis shes par bya /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang nye bar len pa med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa de la yod pa nyid du gang gis shes par bya /
translated: Response: That which is without appropriation and is not manifest cannot be known to exist by anyone.

original: ci ste yod na ni gang gis de yod ces shes par bya ba de nyid de'i nye bar len pa yin pas /
analyzed: ci ste yod na ni gang gis de yod ces shes par bya ba de nyid de'i nye bar len pa yin pas /
translated: But if it does exist, then that by which it is known to exist is itself its appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de la ni thar pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa de la ni thar pa mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, liberation is untenable for that which possesses appropriation.

original: de la 'di snyam du gang gi tshe nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gang gi tshe nye bar len pa med pa ni yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, if you think that that which is without appropriation cannot be said to exist,

original: zhes pa de'i tshe gang gis de yod par shes par bya /
analyzed: zhes pa de'i tshe gang gis de yod par shes par bya /
translated: then at that time, by what is it known to exist?

original: zhes rgol ba de ji ltar rung snyam na /
analyzed: zhes rgol ba de ji ltar rung snyam na /
translated: How could that objection be tenable?

original: bshad pa / brjod par bya ba yang gzhan la rnam par shes par bya ba yang gzhan yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar shes par bya zhes smras kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / brjod par bya ba yang gzhan la rnam par shes par bya ba yang gzhan yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar shes par bya zhes smras kyi /
translated: Since the object of expression is one thing and the object of consciousness is another, therefore we say, “How can it be known?”

original: ji skad brjod par bya zhes ni ma smras te /
analyzed: ji skad brjod par bya zhes ni ma smras te /
translated: But we do not say, “How can it be expressed?”

original: ri bong gi rva med pa la ni khyod kyi brjod par bya ba dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pas /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med pa la ni khyod kyi brjod par bya ba dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pas /
translated: Since you do not think that the horns of a rabbit exist or do not exist,

original: de'i phyir blos de yod par bzung nas tshig gi skyon spang ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes smra grang /
analyzed: de'i phyir blos de yod par bzung nas tshig gi skyon spang ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes smra grang /
translated: then why do you say, “It is not an object of expression” because you apprehend it to exist and you want to avoid the fault of saying it is an object of expression?

original: ci ste khyod kyi blos kyang de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du ma nges na ni /
analyzed: ci ste khyod kyi blos kyang de yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du ma nges na ni /
translated: But if your mind does not ascertain that it exists or does not exist,

original: ci'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes smra /🔽drang po kho nar rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes smra / drang po kho nar rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: then why do you say, “It is not an object of expression”?

original: zhes brjod par bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: It would be correct to say, “It is not an object of consciousness.”

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: thar la gal te bdag yod rtag / gal te med na mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: thar la gal te bdag yod rtag / gal te med na mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: If the self exists, it is permanent; if it does not exist, it is impermanent.

original: skyes bu brjod par bya min yang //🔽mkhas pas shes par bya min min //
analyzed: skyes bu brjod par bya min yang // mkhas pas shes par bya min min //
translated: The person is not described as being either.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: But the wise do not say that it is not to be known.

original: de lta bas na sems can yang ji ltar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can yang ji ltar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that any sentient being whatsoever attains nirvana.

original: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
translated: Conditioned things, which have the property of arising and ceasing,

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not bound and are not liberated.

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'ching bar yang mi 'thad la thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'ching bar yang mi 'thad la thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that conditioned things are bound or liberated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'du byed skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can skad cig ma re re la skye zhing rang gi dang gis 'gag pa nges par mi gnas pa rnams ji ltar yang 'ching pa dang thar par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can skad cig ma re re la skye zhing rang gi dang gis 'gag pa nges par mi gnas pa rnams ji ltar yang 'ching pa dang thar par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that conditioned things, which have the property of arising and ceasing, are bound or liberated, since they arise and cease moment by moment, and definitely do not remain.

original: smras pa // 'du byed rgyun la 'ching ba dang thar pa yod do //
analyzed: smras pa // 'du byed rgyun la 'ching ba dang thar pa yod do //
translated: Objection: Bondage and liberation exist for the continuum of conditioned things.

original: bshad pa / gal te 'du byed kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni khyod 'dod pa ltar 'ching ba @229a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'du byed kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na ni khyod 'dod pa ltar 'ching ba @229a * //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If a thing called the continuum of formations existed, then, as you assert, it would be bound.🔽

original: 'am ; thar par yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'am ; thar par yang 'gyur grang na /
