translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If a thing called the continuum of formations existed, then, as you assert, there would be bondage or there would be liberation.

original: gang gi tshe 'du byed skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyu nyid la rgyun zhes bya ba de'i tshe de la ci zhig 'ching zhing ci zhig thar par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'du byed skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rgyu nyid la rgyun zhes bya ba de'i tshe de la ci zhig 'ching zhing ci zhig thar par 'gyur /
translated: But when the cause of the arising and ceasing of formations is called a continuum, then what is bound and what is liberated?

original: ci ste rgyun gyi dngos po zhig yod par gyur na yang /
analyzed: ci ste rgyun gyi dngos po zhig yod par gyur na yang /
translated: Even if a thing called a continuum existed,

original: de lta na yang 'du byed yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir de la bcings pa dang thar pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'du byed yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir de la bcings pa dang thar pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: how could bondage and liberation be tenable in relation to it, because it is a formation, because it has the property of arising and disintegrating, and because it definitely does not endure?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'du byed rnams ni 'ching bar yang mi 'gyur thar par yang mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'du byed rnams ni 'ching bar yang mi 'gyur thar par yang mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think that formations are neither bound nor liberated,

original: sems can ni 'ching ba dang thar par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: sems can ni 'ching ba dang thar par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: but sentient beings are bound and liberated,

original: de la bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste ;
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
translated: Just as before, a sentient being

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽sems can yang 'ching bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur ro // sems can yang 'ching bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Is neither bound nor liberated.

original: thar par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A sentient being is neither bound nor liberated.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: snga ma bzhin du ste /🔽ji ltar sngar sems can rtag pa la yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ste / ji ltar sngar sems can rtag pa la yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad la /
translated: just as before,🔽just as previously it was shown that cyclic existence and nirvana are untenable for a permanent sentient being, and also untenable for an impermanent sentient being,

original: mi rtag pa la yang mi 'thad par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sems can rtag par mi 'gyur ba yin na yang 'ching ba mi 'thad cing thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la yang mi 'thad par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sems can rtag par mi 'gyur ba yin na yang 'ching ba mi 'thad cing thar pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: so too here, if a sentient being were not permanent, then bondage would be untenable and liberation would be untenable.

original: ci ste 'ching ba dang thar bar gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'ching ba dang thar bar gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if bondage and liberation were to occur, then because of change, it would be impermanent.

original: sems can mi rtag pa la 'gog pa'i chos can nges par mi gnas pa yang bcing ba dang thar bar byar mi nus te /
analyzed: sems can mi rtag pa la 'gog pa'i chos can nges par mi gnas pa yang bcing ba dang thar bar byar mi nus te /
translated: Also, a sentient being that is impermanent, a phenomenon that is ceased, and that does not definitely endure cannot be bound or liberated.

original: 'di ltar 'gags shing med pa la ci zhig bcing zhing thar bar byar yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gags shing med pa la ci zhig bcing zhing thar bar byar yod do //
translated: In that case, what bound and liberated is there in that which has ceased and does not exist?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: sems can gyi nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni 'ching ba zhes bya la nye bar len pa gtan du nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de ni thar ba zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: sems can gyi nye bar len pa gang yin pa de ni 'ching ba zhes bya la nye bar len pa gtan du nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de ni thar ba zhes bya zhing /
translated: That appropriated by sentient beings is called “bondage,” and the complete pacification of appropriation is called “liberation.”

original: sems can yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de'i phyir sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i skyon dang bral ba la bcings pa dang thar pa 'thad do //
analyzed: sems can yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas de'i phyir sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i skyon dang bral ba la bcings pa dang thar pa 'thad do //
translated: Since sentient beings are not described as permanent or impermanent, therefore bondage and liberation are tenable for sentient beings who are free from the errors of permanence and impermanence.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / gal te nye bar len 'ching na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te nye bar len 'ching na //
translated: If appropriation is bondage,

original: nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: One who has appropriation is not bound.

original: gal te nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin na de lta na mi zhig sems can nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin na de lta na mi zhig sems can nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If appropriation is bondage, then in that case a person who has appropriation is not bound.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcings zin pa kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcings zin pa kho na'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is already bound.

original: 'di ltar bcings zin na yang bcing bar bya ci dgos /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcings zin na yang bcing bar bya ci dgos /
translated: But if it is already bound, of what use is it to be bound again?

original: de yang 'di snyam du nye bar len pa med pa kho na 'ching bar 'gyur @229b ro snyam na /
analyzed: de yang 'di snyam du nye bar len pa med pa kho na 'ching bar 'gyur @229b ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that one who does not possess appropriation is bound,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: nye bar len med mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: nye bar len med mi 'ching ste /
translated: One who does not possess appropriation is not bound.

original: nye bar len pa med na yang de la 'ching ba mi 'thad de //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med na yang de la 'ching ba mi 'thad de //
translated: If one does not possess appropriation, it is untenable that one is bound.

original: 'di ltar yang nye bar len pa med pa gang gdags su med pa tha snyad gdags su med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa de ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang nye bar len pa med pa gang gdags su med pa tha snyad gdags su med pa gsal bar byed pa med pa de ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could one who does not possess appropriation, who cannot be designated, who cannot be conventionally expressed, and who cannot be clarified exist?

original: gang med pa de ji ltar nye bar len pas 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang med pa de ji ltar nye bar len pas 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not exist be bound by appropriation?

original: de'i phyir sems can nye bar len pa med pa yang nye bar len pas 'ching bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can nye bar len pa med pa yang nye bar len pas 'ching bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is untenable that a sentient being who does not possess appropriation is bound by appropriation.🔽But now tell us, at what point in time is your sentient being bound?

original: 'o na da khyod kyi sems can gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur ba de da smros shig /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na da khyod kyi sems can gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur ba de da smros shig /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here you say:

original: nye bar len pa 'ching ba ni re zhig gsal bar yod de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'ching ba ni re zhig gsal bar yod de /
translated: The appropriator who is bound exists clearly.

original: 'dis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'ching bar byed pas na 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it binds, it is called “binding.”

original: de ltar 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir gang des bcing bar bya ba yang yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir gang des bcing bar bya ba yang yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, because binding exists, that which is bound also exists.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te bcings ba'i snga rol na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te bcings ba'i snga rol na //
translated: If prior to being bound🔽The bound one exists, then he would be bound by that.

original: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de /
analyzed: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de /
translated: But that does not exist.

original: gal te bcings pa de bas snga rol na nye bar len pa 'ching ba de yod par gyur na ni khyod 'dod pa ltar nye bar len pas 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur la rag na /
analyzed: gal te bcings pa de bas snga rol na nye bar len pa 'ching ba de yod par gyur na ni khyod 'dod pa ltar nye bar len pas 'ching bas 'ching bar 'gyur la rag na /
translated: If prior to the bound one, the appropriated aggregates that are the binding existed, then, as you assert, he would be bound by the binding of appropriation.

original: bcings pa'i snga rol na de yang med de /
analyzed: bcings pa'i snga rol na de yang med de /
translated: But that does not exist prior to the bound one.

original: 'di ltar nye bar ma blangs pa ji ltar nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar ma blangs pa ji ltar nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could that which is not appropriated become appropriation?

original: bcings pa'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa des ji ltar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcings pa'i snga rol na med pa gang yin pa des ji ltar 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which does not exist prior to being bound bind?

original: de lta bas na nye bar len pa yang 'ching ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar len pa yang 'ching ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore appropriation is not binding.

original: lhag ma ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni /
translated: The remainder

original: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan /
analyzed: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan /
translated: Is taught by “gone,” “not gone,” and “that being gone over.”

original: 'ching ba mi 'thad pa'i lhag ma gang dag yin pa de dag ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag gis bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba mi 'thad pa'i lhag ma gang dag yin pa de dag ni song ba dang ma song ba dang bgom pa dag gis bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The remainder of the refutation of bondage should be understood through the analysis of where one has gone, where one has not gone, and where one goes.

original: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med pa dang ma song ba la yang med bgom pa la yang med pa de bzhin du /🔽bcings pa yang mi 'ching ma bcings pa yang mi 'ching /
analyzed: ji ltar song ba la 'gro ba med pa dang ma song ba la yang med bgom pa la yang med pa de bzhin du / bcings pa yang mi 'ching ma bcings pa yang mi 'ching /
translated: Just as going does not exist where one has gone, where one has not gone, and on that being gone over,🔽so too

original: 'ching bzhin pa yang mi 'ching ngo //
analyzed: 'ching bzhin pa yang mi 'ching ngo //
translated: Bondage does not exist where one is bound, where one is not bound, and where one is being bound.🔽Just as the beginning of going does not exist where one has gone, where one has not gone, and on that being gone over,

original: ji ltar song ba la yang 'gro ba'i rtsom pa mi 'thad ma song ba la yang mi 'thad bgom pa la yang mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /🔽bcings pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa mi 'thad ma bcings pa la yang mi 'thad /
analyzed: ji ltar song ba la yang 'gro ba'i rtsom pa mi 'thad ma song ba la yang mi 'thad bgom pa la yang mi 'thad pa de bzhin du / bcings pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa mi 'thad ma bcings pa la yang mi 'thad /
translated: so too🔽The beginning of bondage does not exist where one is bound, where one is not bound, and where one is being bound.

original: 'ching ba zhig pa la yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'ching ba zhig pa la yang mi 'thad do //
translated: The beginning of bondage does not exist where one is bound, where one is not bound, and where one is being bound.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: re zhig thar pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste 'gro ba rnam par thar par bya @230a * //
analyzed: re zhig thar pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa ste 'gro ba rnam par thar par bya @230a * //
translated: First, liberation is presented from the perspective of the teaching of the Bhagavān.

original: ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung bas /
analyzed: ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung bas /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata appears in the world.

original: de'i phyir re zhig thar pa ni yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig thar pa ni yod do //
translated: Therefore, first, liberation exists.

original: ma bcings pa la yang thar pa med pas bcings pa yang yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma bcings pa la yang thar pa med pas bcings pa yang yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: And since there is no liberation for one who is not bound, bondage certainly exists.

original: bshad pa gal te /
analyzed: bshad pa gal te /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: thar pa nyid 'thad na ni bcings pa yang yod par 'gyur grang na /🔽thar pa mi 'thad pas bcings pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: thar pa nyid 'thad na ni bcings pa yang yod par 'gyur grang na / thar pa mi 'thad pas bcings pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If liberation were tenable, then bondage would exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But since liberation is untenable, how could bondage be tenable?🔽How so?

original: gang gi phyir /🔽re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol te //
translated: Because🔽First, the bound are not liberated.

original: 'di la re zhig bcings pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: 'di la re zhig bcings pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'grol lo //
translated: First, that which is bound is not liberated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bcings pa gang bcings pa'i gnas nyid la 'dug pa de ji ltar grol bar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcings pa gang bcings pa'i gnas nyid la 'dug pa de ji ltar grol bar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: Because how could that which is bound, abiding in the state of being bound, be liberated?

original: ci ste bcings pa nyid 'grol bar 'gyur na ni de lta na 'ga' yang ma grol bar mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci ste bcings pa nyid 'grol bar 'gyur na ni de lta na 'ga' yang ma grol bar mi 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But if that which is bound were liberated, then no one would be unliberated. But that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol lo //
translated: Therefore, first, the bound are not liberated.

original: smras pa / bcings pa 'ching ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de grol ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / bcings pa 'ching ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de grol ba yin no //
translated: Objection: That which is bound is liberated from being bound.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid de bcings pa la ni 'ching ba dang bral ba mi 'thad de bcings pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la yang de nyid de bcings pa la ni 'ching ba dang bral ba mi 'thad de bcings pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, it is not tenable that that which is bound is liberated from being bound because it is bound.

original: smras pa / 'o na 'ching ba dang bral ba ni grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'o na 'ching ba dang bral ba ni grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Objection: But it is said that that which is liberated from being bound is liberated.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / ma bcings pa yang 'grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma bcings pa yang 'grol mi 'gyur //
translated: That which is not bound is not liberated.

original: 'di ltar 'ching ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni ma bcings pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ching ba dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni ma bcings pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus that which is liberated from being bound is just not bound.

original: grang ma bcings pa de ni grol ba nyid yin pas de la yang grol bar 'gyur bas ci bya ste /
analyzed: grang ma bcings pa de ni grol ba nyid yin pas de la yang grol bar 'gyur bas ci bya ste /
translated: Since that which is not bound is just liberated, what use is there in saying that it is liberated?

original: de bas na ma bcings pa yang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ma bcings pa yang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore that which is not bound is not liberated.

original: smras pa / bcings pa ni 'grol te 'di ltar bcings pa grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / bcings pa ni 'grol te 'di ltar bcings pa grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: That which is bound is liberated, for it is said, “Thus that which is bound is liberated.”

original: zhes bya ba de ni 'jig rten na grags pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni 'jig rten na grags pa yin no //
translated: This is well known in the world.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de na 'jig rten na grags pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / de na 'jig rten na grags pa yin no //
translated: That is well known in the world.

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni legs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni legs par smras pa yin te /
translated: That which you have said is well said.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'jig rten na grags pa yin pa de'i phyir don dam pa bsam pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'jig rten na grags pa yin pa de'i phyir don dam pa bsam pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is renowned in the world, therefore it does not engage in reflection on the ultimate.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: bcings pa grol bzhin yin gyur na //
analyzed: bcings pa grol bzhin yin gyur na //
translated: If the bound one were liberated,

original: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
translated: then bondage and liberation would occur simultaneously.

original: gal te bcings pa 'grol bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bcings pa 'grol bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the bound one were liberated,

original: de ltar 'ching ba gang dang ldan pas bcings pa zhes bya ba dang thar pa gang dang ldan pas grol ba zhes bya ba'i bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis dus gcig par thal bar 'gyur te /🔽bcings pa dang grol ba mi @230b mthun pa gnyis gcig la gnas par mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bcings pa grol lo //
analyzed: de ltar 'ching ba gang dang ldan pas bcings pa zhes bya ba dang thar pa gang dang ldan pas grol ba zhes bya ba'i bcings pa dang grol ba gnyis dus gcig par thal bar 'gyur te / bcings pa dang grol ba mi @230b mthun pa gnyis gcig la gnas par mi 'thad pas de'i phyir bcings pa grol lo //
translated: then the two, bondage and liberation, would occur simultaneously. That is, the bound one would be called “bound” because he possesses bondage, and he would be called “liberated” because he possesses liberation.

original: zhes bya ba de ni 'brel ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni 'brel ba med pa yin no //
translated: But since it is untenable that two incompatible states, bondage and liberation, exist simultaneously in one thing, therefore to say “The bound one is liberated” is meaningless.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te de ltar thar pa nyid mi 'thad pa yin na 'khor bas 'jigs pa rnams kyi ma yin la bsam pa nam zhig na bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhig gu /
analyzed: gal te de ltar thar pa nyid mi 'thad pa yin na 'khor bas 'jigs pa rnams kyi ma yin la bsam pa nam zhig na bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur zhig gu /
translated: But if liberation itself is untenable, then for those who fear cyclic existence, the thought “When will I attain nirvana without appropriation?”

original: nam zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i gdams ngag gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bskyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: nam zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i gdams ngag gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bskyod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
translated: and “When will I attain nirvana?” and the instructions for attaining nirvana and the effort to attain nirvana would all be pointless, wouldn’t they?

original: bshad pa / thabs ma yin pas don du gnyer ba dang / gdams ngag ston pa dang rtsom pa dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
analyzed: bshad pa / thabs ma yin pas don du gnyer ba dang / gdams ngag ston pa dang rtsom pa dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: There is no doubt that striving for a goal through an incorrect method, the instructions taught, and the composition are pointless.

original: 'di ltar bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa dag ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa dag ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how could those who think, “I will attain nirvana without appropriation” or “Nirvana will be mine” attain nirvana?

original: gang gi tshe /🔽bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: gang gi tshe / bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
translated: When they think,🔽“I will attain nirvana without appropriation”

original: myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces //🔽gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi //
analyzed: myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces // gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi //
translated: or “Nirvana will be mine,”

original: nyer len legs par zin ma yin //
analyzed: nyer len legs par zin ma yin //
translated: their appropriation is not well understood.

original: 'di la nye bar len pa gtan du nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di la nye bar len pa gtan du nye bar zhi ba gang yin pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya na /
translated: In this regard, nirvana is said to be the complete pacification of appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin pas /
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yin pas /
translated: Since the root of all appropriation is the view of “I” and “mine,”

original: gang dag bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag bdag nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: those who think, “I will attain nirvana without appropriation”🔽or “Nirvana will be mine”🔽have not well understood appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir gyur cig snyam du rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su bzung ste nges par gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir gyur cig snyam du rlom sems su byed pa de dag ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yongs su bzung ste nges par gnas pa yin pas /
translated: They are attached to the self and mine, and they definitely abide in the view of the transitory collection.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de nyid nye bar len pa legs par ma zin pa yin no //🔽nye bar len pa dang bcas pa la thar pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa de nyid nye bar len pa legs par ma zin pa yin no // nye bar len pa dang bcas pa la thar pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, their self and mine are not properly grasped.🔽How could liberation be tenable for those who possess appropriation?

original: nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de gang yin zhing yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gi yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de gang yin zhing yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang gi yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Who would attain nirvana without appropriation? Whose would it be?

original: de dag thams cad ni de'i srid pa dang ma rig pas bskyed pa yin no /🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni de'i srid pa dang ma rig pas bskyed pa yin no / 'dir smras pa /
translated: All of these are generated by their existence and ignorance.

original: re zhig @231a * //
analyzed: re zhig @231a * //
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ni yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ni yang yod pa yin te /
translated: First, samsara and nirvana exist.

original: de dag kyang 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin gyi ci yang med pa'i ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin gyi ci yang med pa'i ma yin pas /
translated: But since they are not nonexistent,🔽the one who cycles and the one who attains nirvana exist.

original: 'khor ba po dang mya ngan las 'da' ba po yang yod de kho bo la ni de tsam gyis chog go //
analyzed: 'khor ba po dang mya ngan las 'da' ba po yang yod de kho bo la ni de tsam gyis chog go //
translated: Just that much is sufficient for me.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / ci khyod snod stong pa srung bar byed dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod snod stong pa srung bar byed dam /
translated: Do you defend an empty vessel?

original: khyod bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'thad pa dag la /
analyzed: khyod bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'thad pa dag la /
translated: You assert that for whom bondage and liberation are untenable,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba yod pa 'dod ko //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba yod pa 'dod ko //
translated: cyclic existence and nirvana exist.

original: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
analyzed: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
translated: For whom nirvana is not generated

original: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
translated: And cyclic existence is not removed,

original: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
translated: What is cyclic existence for him?🔽What is nirvana?

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ci zhig brtag /'di ltar 'khor ba gang la sems can dang 'du byed bcings pa rnams 'khor ba las bsal cing spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ci zhig brtag /'di ltar 'khor ba gang la sems can dang 'du byed bcings pa rnams 'khor ba las bsal cing spang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, for whom cyclic existence is not generated, and for whom cyclic existence is not removed, what is cyclic existence for him? What is nirvana?

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba la bskyed cing 'dzud par mi byed pa de la 'khor ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par brtag / gang las 'ga' yang bsal ba ma byas la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba la bskyed cing 'dzud par mi byed pa de la 'khor ba zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par brtag / gang las 'ga' yang bsal ba ma byas la /
translated: What is called “samsara” should be investigated: what is it that does not generate and does not cause entry into nirvana?

original: gang la 'ga' yang bskyed pa ma byas pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa de yang ci zhig yin par brtag / yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: gang la 'ga' yang bskyed pa ma byas pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa de yang ci zhig yin par brtag / yang na 'di ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: What is called “nirvana” should be investigated: what is it that does not remove anything at all and does not generate anything at all?🔽Or, this is the meaning:

original: 'di ltar gang la 'khor ba yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'ga' thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang 'khor ba bsal zhing spang bar mi byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la 'khor ba yongs su zad par bya ba'i phyir dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'ga' thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa dang ldan pas kyang 'khor ba bsal zhing spang bar mi byed la /
translated: Since samsara is not removed or abandoned by one who strives to completely eliminate samsara and to attain nirvana,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bskyed cing 'phel bar mi byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kho nar 'gyur ba de la 'khor ba zhes ci zhig rnam par brtag cing mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang ci
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang bskyed cing 'phel bar mi byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kho nar 'gyur ba de la 'khor ba zhes ci zhig rnam par brtag cing mya ngan las 'das pa zhes kyang ci
translated: and since nirvana is not generated or increased, it is only free from conceptualization. What is called “samsara” should be investigated and what is called “nirvana” should be investigated.

original: zhig rnam par bshad /
analyzed: zhig rnam par bshad /
translated: Refutation of the essential existence of cyclic existence and nirvana

original: de lta bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba dag ni rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par mthong ba dag ni rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad kyi /
translated: Therefore, since it would follow that those who see things and nonthings would have views of eternalism and nihilism, cyclic existence, nirvana, bondage, and liberation would not be tenable for them.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba nyid la ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya ba dag 'grub bo //🔽bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa bzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba nyid la ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya ba dag 'grub bo // bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa bzhes bya ba ste /
translated: But for those who propound dependent origination, cyclic existence, nirvana, bondage, and liberation are established.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter, called the Critique of Bondage and Liberation.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par lta na 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par lta na 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
translated: “It is not tenable that cyclic existence exists for those who see things and nonthings,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the errors of eternalism and nihilism would follow.”

original: zhes gang bshad pa de mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de mi rung ste /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Because of the connection between action and effect.

original: @231b las gang zhe na /
analyzed: @231b las gang zhe na /
translated: What is action?

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //🔽de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang // de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
translated: It is the restraint of oneself, the helpfulness to others, and the attitude of loving kindness.

original: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin //🔽bdag nyid legs par sdom pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin // bdag nyid legs par sdom pa ni //
translated: It is the seed of the fruits in this life and the next.

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom par byed pa'o //
translated: The restraint of oneself is the restraint of one’s own person.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The helpfulness to others is the helpfulness to others.

original: byams pa ni mdza' bshes la 'byung ba ste gcugs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byams pa ni mdza' bshes la 'byung ba ste gcugs pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Loving kindness is the attitude of loving kindness toward friends.

original: yang na byams pa ni byams pa nyid de sems snum pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang na byams pa ni byams pa nyid de sems snum pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Or, loving kindness is the very loving kindness itself, the attitude of loving kindness.

original: de ni bdag gi don gyi rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi don gyi rkyen yin no //
translated: This is the condition for one’s own aim.

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom par byed pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / byams pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni chos yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom par byed pa dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang / byams pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni chos yin no //
translated: The restraint of oneself, the helpfulness to others, and the attitude of loving kindness are the Dharma.

original: de nyid 'bras bu dag gi sa bon te 'di dang gzhan dag tu 'bras bu dag gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu dag gi sa bon te 'di dang gzhan dag tu 'bras bu dag gi rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the seed of the effects, because it is the cause of the effects in this life and in other lives.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byams pa bsgoms pa na phan yon brgyad yod de ;
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byams pa bsgoms pa na phan yon brgyad yod de ;
translated: Thus the Lord has said: “When one cultivates loving-kindness, there are eight benefits:

original: mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
analyzed: mi rnams dga' bar 'gyur ro // zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
translated: one becomes dear to humans;🔽one is born in the Brahma world.”

original: las rnam pa gsum car yang chos kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum car yang chos kyi phyir ro //
translated: The three kinds of action are for the sake of the Dharma.

original: sems pa ni sa bon du bstan te lus dang ngag gnyis de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa ni sa bon du bstan te lus dang ngag gnyis de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Intention is taught to be the seed, because body and speech depend on it.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang //
translated: Thus the Lord has said:

original: yid ni chos kyi sngon du 'gro //🔽zhes tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: yid ni chos kyi sngon du 'gro // zhes tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal to //
translated: “The mind goes before the Dharma,🔽and the mind leads the Dharma.🔽The mind is swift,🔽and the mind is subtle.”

original: drang srong mchog gi las rnams ni //
analyzed: drang srong mchog gi las rnams ni //
translated: The actions of the supreme sage

original: sems pa dang ni bsam par gsungs //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni bsam par gsungs //
translated: are said to be intention and the intentional.

original: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
analyzed: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
translated: The distinctions of those actions

original: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags /
translated: are proclaimed in many ways.

original: drang srong mchog sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis las rnams ni 'di ltar mdor bsdu ba las rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te //
analyzed: drang srong mchog sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis las rnams ni 'di ltar mdor bsdu ba las rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te //
translated: The supreme sage, the Blessed Buddha, has stated that actions are summarized as two types:

original: sems pa sa bon du gyur pa dang / bsam pa dus phyi ma la rtsom par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa sa bon du gyur pa dang / bsam pa dus phyi ma la rtsom par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: intention, which is the seed, and that which is begun after the intention, in the future.

original: las rnam pa gnyis po de dag gi bye brag kyang rnam pa du ma yod par bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der de ltar rnam pa mang por yongs su bsgrags shing bstan no //
analyzed: las rnam pa gnyis po de dag gi bye brag kyang rnam pa du ma yod par bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der de ltar rnam pa mang por yongs su bsgrags shing bstan no //
translated: The Blessed One has taught and proclaimed in various ways the many different types of these two kinds of actions.

original: de la las gang sems pa zhes //🔽gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod /
analyzed: de la las gang sems pa zhes // gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod /
translated: Among them, the action that is called intention🔽is considered to be mental.

original: bsam pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
translated: That which is called that which is begun after the intention

original: de ni lus dang ngag gi yin //
analyzed: de ni lus dang ngag gi yin //
translated: is bodily and verbal.

original: de la las gang sems pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yid kyi yin par 'dod do //🔽las gang bsams pa zhes gsungs pa blos 'di bya'o snyam du gsungs @232a * //
analyzed: de la las gang sems pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yid kyi yin par 'dod do //🔽las gang bsams pa zhes gsungs pa blos 'di bya'o snyam du gsungs @232a * //
translated: Among them, the action that is called intention is considered to be mental.🔽That which is called that which is begun after the intention is bodily and verbal.

original: nas lus sam ngag gi byed pa de ni lus dang ngag gi yin te gang ma bsams par byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nas lus sam ngag gi byed pa de ni lus dang ngag gi yin te gang ma bsams par byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The action of body and speech is of body and speech, not of that which is not thought.

original: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
analyzed: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
translated: The unmanifest action of speech and movement,🔽and that which is not abstention,

original: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //🔽spong ba'i rnam rig byed min pa //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang // spong ba'i rnam rig byed min pa //
translated: is called non-manifest action.

original: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
translated: Abstention is also considered to be non-manifest action.

original: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
analyzed: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
translated: Merit and demerit arise from enjoyment,

original: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
translated: and from thought, just as they do from the seven things.

original: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
translated: These are considered to be action.

original: de la ngag ces bya ba ni yi ge gsal bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag ces bya ba ni yi ge gsal bar brjod pa'o //
translated: Speech is the clear enunciation of syllables.

original: bskyod pa ni lus g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: bskyod pa ni lus g-yo ba ste /
translated: Movement is the motion of the body.

original: de gnyi ga yang las kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir las kyi lam du gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang las kyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir las kyi lam du gtogs pa ste /
translated: Both of these are included in the path of action because they are done by the power of action.

original: 'dir yang las su bgrang ba yin par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang las su bgrang ba yin par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the enumeration of action should be understood.

original: mi spang ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las 'di zhes bya ba lus sam ngag gis bya'o snyam du mi dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs pa de tshun chad nas mi dge ba de lus sam ngag gang dag
analyzed: mi spang ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las 'di zhes bya ba lus sam ngag gis bya'o snyam du mi dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs pa de tshun chad nas mi dge ba de lus sam ngag gang dag
translated: Nonindicative states that are not abandoned are nonvirtuous karma.🔽From the time of taking up the mind that thinks, I will do this nonvirtuous karma by body or speech, nonvirtuous karma arises in body or speech that is derived from the cause of taking up the mind that thinks, I will do this nonvirtuous karma by body or speech.

original: gis mi byed du zin kyang mi dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'i mi dge ba dag skye bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: gis mi byed du zin kyang mi dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'i mi dge ba dag skye bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: Even though one does not engage in nonvirtuous karma, nonvirtuous karma arises that is derived from the cause of taking up the mind that thinks, I will do this nonvirtuous karma by body or speech.

original: de dag ni mi spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag ni mi spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: They obtain the name nonindicative states that are not abandoned.

original: spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du 'dod de /🔽dge ba'i las 'di zhes bya ba lus sam ngag gis bya'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du 'dod de / dge ba'i las 'di zhes bya ba lus sam ngag gis bya'o //
translated: Other nonindicative states that are abandoned are asserted to be similar.

original: snyam du dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs ba de tshun chad nas /
analyzed: snyam du dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs ba de tshun chad nas /
translated: From the time of taking up the mind that thinks, I will do this virtuous karma by body or speech,

original: dge ba de lus sam ngag gang dag gis mi byed du zin kyang dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'i dge ba dag skye bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba de lus sam ngag gang dag gis mi byed du zin kyang dge ba'i sems yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'i dge ba dag skye bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: Even though virtue is not performed by body or speech, virtue arises from the cause of taking up virtue in the mind.

original: de dag ni spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag ni spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: That is called the nonindicative aspect of abandoning.

original: longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las bsod nams byung ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ni yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las bsod nams byung ba ste /
translated: Merit arising from enjoyment is merit that arises from the cause of enjoyment.

original: rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Arising from the cause means

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su 'brel ba dang rgyun 'phel ba ste bsod nams nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su 'brel ba dang rgyun 'phel ba ste bsod nams nyid do //
translated: that merit arises from the cause of enjoyment, it is continuous, it is related to that cause and it is merit.

original: longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin no //
translated: Nonmerit arising from enjoyment is similar to that.

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Intention is the mental formation of the mind.

original: de ltar las rnam pa du ma de dag kyang dag la sogs pa'i chos rnams @232b su 'dus pas de nyid kyi phyir ngag la sogs pa chos bdun po de dag ni las su mngon pa dang las kyi ming can dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar las rnam pa du ma de dag kyang dag la sogs pa'i chos rnams @232b su 'dus pas de nyid kyi phyir ngag la sogs pa chos bdun po de dag ni las su mngon pa dang las kyi ming can dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since these many types of karma are included in the phenomena of virtue and so on, therefore these seven phenomena, such as speech, are asserted to be karma, to be called karma, and to have the characteristics of karma.

original: de ltar las rnam pa bdun po de dag 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'khor ba yang 'thad la /
analyzed: de ltar las rnam pa bdun po de dag 'bras bu dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'khor ba yang 'thad la /
translated: Thus, since these seven types of karma are related to effects, samsara is tenable.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not occur.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / gal te las nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur na ni de yang skyon du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te las nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur na ni de yang skyon du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not follow from karma itself, then those errors would not occur.

original: skyon du ni 'gyur bas de'i phyir las rnams nyid kyang mi 'thad pa las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skyon du ni 'gyur bas de'i phyir las rnams nyid kyang mi 'thad pa las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But since those errors do occur, therefore karma itself is untenable, and the relation between karma and effects is untenable.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te smin pa'i dus bar du /
analyzed: gal te smin pa'i dus bar du /
translated: If it endures until the time of ripening,

original: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
translated: that karma would be permanent.

original: re zhig gal te las smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa de bzhin du dus gzhan du yang gnas par 'gyur bas rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig gal te las smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa de bzhin du dus gzhan du yang gnas par 'gyur bas rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If karma endures until the time of its ripening, then like that it would endure in other times as well, and thus it would be permanent.

original: rtag pa ni 'thad pa de ji ltar rnam par smin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag pa ni 'thad pa de ji ltar rnam par smin par 'gyur /
translated: But how could a permanent entity yield a ripening?

original: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas las ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas las ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: If you think, “It is illogical for that error to occur,” then karma is momentary.

original: skad cig ma'i phyir 'gags pa'o snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyir 'gags pa'o snyam na /
translated: Because it is momentary, it ceases.

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: In response to that, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: If it ceases, then having ceased,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: how could it generate a result?

original: gal te las skad cig ma'i phyir 'gags shing zhig pa yin na des ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te las skad cig ma'i phyir 'gags shing zhig pa yin na des ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur /
translated: If karma is momentary, it ceases and is destroyed. How could it generate a result?

original: ci ste las med pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na ni shing pa ta'i me tog gis kyang gos la dri bsung bsgo bar 'gyur ba zhig na med pa'i phyir bsgo bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: ci ste las med pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na ni shing pa ta'i me tog gis kyang gos la dri bsung bsgo bar 'gyur ba zhig na med pa'i phyir bsgo bar mi byed pas /
translated: If a result were generated by karma that does not exist, then even the flower of the pāṭala tree would perfume cloth. But because it does not exist, it does not perfume cloth.

original: de lta na las 'gags pa dag gis kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na las 'gags pa dag gis kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, even ceased actions would not generate effects.

original: de lta bas na las rnams rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de lta bas na las rnams rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, because the errors of eternalism and nihilism would ensue,

original: las rnams nyid kyang mi 'thad na /
analyzed: las rnams nyid kyang mi 'thad na /
translated: actions are untenable.

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ltar 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ltar 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the connection between actions and effects be tenable?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin te /
translated: The connection between actions and effects is tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyud kyi rgyun la 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun la 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because effects are established in the continuum of the person.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
translated: The continuum of the sprout

original: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: manifests from the seed.

original: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
translated: From that, the effect, the seed,

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: does not arise if the seed does not exist.🔽Because the continuum arises from the seed

original: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the seed precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'di la sa bon ni myu @233a * //
analyzed: 'di la sa bon ni myu @233a * //
translated: Here, the seed is the cause of the sprout.🔽

original: gu'i rgyu bskyed nas 'gag go //
analyzed: gu'i rgyu bskyed nas 'gag go //
translated: Here, the seed ceases after producing the sprout as its effect.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni sa bon las mngon par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni sa bon las mngon par 'byung zhing /
translated: The continuum of the sprout, etc. arises from the seed.

original: rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: The effect arises from that continuum.

original: sa bon med na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon med na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seed did not exist, that continuum of the sprout, etc. would not arise.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la rgyu las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la rgyu las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because the continuum arises from the seed and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: and because the seed precedes the effect, there is neither annihilation nor permanence.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon rnam pa thams cad du chad nas rgyun du 'byung ba ma yin gyi rgyun rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon rnam pa thams cad du chad nas rgyun du 'byung ba ma yin gyi rgyun rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the seed does not arise as a continuum after being completely annihilated, but rather the continuum continues, there is no annihilation.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because the seed ceases and definitely does not endure, there is no permanence.

original: de ji lta ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: de ji lta ba de bzhin du //
translated: Just as it is with the seed,

original: sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //🔽sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa // sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: The continuum of mind is from intention.

original: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
translated: From that, the effect arises.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If there is no intention, that also does not occur.

original: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: Because the continuum arises from intention, and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the action precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sems pa las brjod pa gang yin pa 'gag bzhin pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyu de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sems pa las brjod pa gang yin pa 'gag bzhin pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyu de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: The continuum of mind is from intention, which is said to be the continuum of mind. It arises from that which is ceasing. From that cause, the effect arises.

original: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de la yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de la yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no intention, that continuum of mind also does not occur.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa las su brjod pa las sems kyi rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa las su brjod pa las sems kyi rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
translated: Because the continuum of mind arises from intention, which is said to be action.

original: sems kyi rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing las de ni 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing las de ni 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the effect arises from the continuum of the mind, and that karma precedes the effect, there is no annihilation and no eternalism.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag bzhin pa las sems kyi rgyun 'byung gi sems pa rnam pa thams cad du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag bzhin pa las sems kyi rgyun 'byung gi sems pa rnam pa thams cad du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the continuum of the mind arises from the mind that is ceasing, and because the mind does not cease in every way, there is no annihilation.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because the mind ceases and definitely does not endure, there is no eternalism.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rgyun gyis 'bras bu 'grub pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rgyun gyis 'bras bu 'grub pas na /
translated: Therefore, in this way, because the effect is established through the continuum,

original: 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: samsara is tenable and the errors of eternalism and annihilationism do not ensue.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: chos sgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni //
analyzed: chos sgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni //
translated: the methods for accomplishing the Dharma

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi lam bcu ste //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi lam bcu ste //
translated: are the ten paths of the virtuous side.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
translated: The effect of the Dharma is

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
translated: the five sense objects in other lives.

original: 'di la @233b bcom ldan 'das kyis chos sgrub pa'i thabs ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin par bstan la /
analyzed: 'di la @233b bcom ldan 'das kyis chos sgrub pa'i thabs ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin par bstan la /
translated: The Lord has taught that the means of accomplishing Dharma is the tenfold path of virtuous action.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang 'di dang gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang 'di dang gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag yin par bstan to //
translated: And he has taught that its result is the five sense pleasures in this life and the next.

original: de la gal te las rnams dang 'bras bur 'brel ba med par gyur na chos sgrub pa'i thabs bstan par yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de la gal te las rnams dang 'bras bur 'brel ba med par gyur na chos sgrub pa'i thabs bstan par yang mi 'thad la /
translated: If there were no connection between actions and their results, then it would be untenable to teach the means of accomplishing Dharma,

original: chos kyi 'bras bu bstan par yang mi 'thad pa zhig na /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu bstan par yang mi 'thad pa zhig na /
translated: and it would be untenable to teach the result of Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyi ga yang bstan pas de'i phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gnyi ga yang bstan pas de'i phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But since the Lord has taught both of these, therefore the connection between actions and their results definitely exists.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gal te rtag pa der gyur na //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa der gyur na //
translated: If it were permanent,

original: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
translated: many great errors would ensue.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa de //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa de //
translated: Therefore permanence

original: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: is untenable here.

original: gal te sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun 'brel ba bzhin du las dang 'bras bur 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun 'brel ba bzhin du las dang 'bras bur 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If karma and its result are related in the same way that the seed and the sprout are related, then karma would be permanent.

original: zhes khyod kyis rtag pa de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis rtag pa de ltar gyur na /
translated: If karma were permanent,

original: de lta na nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then many great faults would ensue.

original: de la ji snyed cig kyang smra bar nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de la ji snyed cig kyang smra bar nus mod kyi /
translated: Although I could say much more,

original: dpe tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dpe tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will offer just an analogy.

original: 'di la sa bon dang rigs mthun pa'i myu gu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di la sa bon dang rigs mthun pa'i myu gu'i rgyun 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: In the world, a sprout arises from a seed that is of a similar type.

original: de lta na shing aa mra'i sa bon las aa mra nyid skye'i shing nim pa mi skye la /
analyzed: de lta na shing aa mra'i sa bon las aa mra nyid skye'i shing nim pa mi skye la /
translated: In that case, a mango tree arises from a mango seed, but a neem tree does not arise from a mango seed.

original: shing nim pa'i sa bon las kyang nim pa nyid skye'i shing aa mra mi skye ste /🔽de'i phyir shing aa mra las kyang /🔽aa mra'i 'bras bu nyid skye zhing shing nim pa'i 'bras bu mi skye la /
analyzed: shing nim pa'i sa bon las kyang nim pa nyid skye'i shing aa mra mi skye ste / de'i phyir shing aa mra las kyang / aa mra'i 'bras bu nyid skye zhing shing nim pa'i 'bras bu mi skye la /
translated: And a neem tree arises from a neem seed, but a mango tree does not arise from a neem seed.🔽Therefore, a mango fruit arises from a mango tree, but a neem fruit does not arise from a mango tree.

original: shing nim pa las kyang nim pa'i 'bras bu nyid skye zhing /
analyzed: shing nim pa las kyang nim pa'i 'bras bu nyid skye zhing /
translated: And a neem fruit arises from a neem tree, but a mango fruit does not arise from a neem tree.

original: shing aa mra'i 'bras bu mi skye bas de lta na sa bon dang 'dra ba'i rgyun 'byung gi mi 'dra ba mi 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: shing aa mra'i 'bras bu mi skye bas de lta na sa bon dang 'dra ba'i rgyun 'byung gi mi 'dra ba mi 'byung ngo ;
translated: Since the fruit of the mango tree does not arise from the seed of the rose apple tree, a continuum similar to the seed does not arise.

original: / gal te sems kyi rgyun 'brel pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: / gal te sems kyi rgyun 'brel pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the effect arises from the connection of the continuum of mind, then

original: mi'i sems las kyang mi'i rgyun kho na 'byung la /
analyzed: mi'i sems las kyang mi'i rgyun kho na 'byung la /
translated: the continuum of a human would arise from the mind of a human,

original: lha'i sems las kyang lha'i rgyu na kho na 'byung /
analyzed: lha'i sems las kyang lha'i rgyu na kho na 'byung /
translated: the continuum of a god would arise from the mind of a god,

original: dud 'gro'i sems las kyang dud 'gro'i rgyun kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i sems las kyang dud 'gro'i rgyun kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the continuum of an animal would arise from the mind of an animal.

original: de ltar gyur na 'gro ba 'khrug pa med pas rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na 'gro ba 'khrug pa med pas rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, since there would be no mixing of reincarnating beings, all endeavor would be pointless.

original: de la nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de la nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: Since many great faults would arise in that case, that is unacceptable.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag las sems sna tshogs @234a * //🔽nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag las sems sna tshogs @234a * //🔽nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: The mind is various due to the distinctions of virtue, nonvirtue, obscured, and unobscured neutral states.

original: sems sna tshogs nyid las rgyun sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs nyid las rgyun sna tshogs nyid du 'gyur /
translated: From the diversity of minds, the diversity of continua arises.

original: rgyun sna tshogs nyid las las sna tshogs nyid dang / las sna tshogs nyid las 'gro ba dang rigs dang rus dang yul dang lus dang dbang po dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang stobs dang blo la sogs pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: rgyun sna tshogs nyid las las sna tshogs nyid dang / las sna tshogs nyid las 'gro ba dang rigs dang rus dang yul dang lus dang dbang po dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang stobs dang blo la sogs pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: From the diversity of continua, the diversity of actions arises. From the diversity of actions, the diversity of reincarnating beings arises, such as different castes, families, countries, bodies, faculties, colors, shapes, strengths, and mental abilities.

original: de yang rtag pa 'dis mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa 'dis mi 'thad pas /
translated: But that is not tenable if the self is permanent.

original: de'i phyir skyon chen po mang po du mar thal bar 'gyur bas rtag pa de ni 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon chen po mang po du mar thal bar 'gyur bas rtag pa de ni 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because many great errors would ensue, permanence is not tenable here.

original: 'o na ji lta bur 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bur 'thad ce na /
translated: Well then, what is tenable?🔽The permanence taught by the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gsungs pa yi //
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, and the śrāvakas

original: rtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
analyzed: rtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
translated: is what is tenable here.

original: de ni rab tu brjod par bya //
analyzed: de ni rab tu brjod par bya //
translated: That will now be explained.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: ji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
translated: Just as a promissory note and a seal🔽are the causes of the arising of something else,

original: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
analyzed: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
translated: so too karma and its nonexpiration.

original: 'di la las ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: 'di la las ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: Here karma is momentary.

original: las skad cig ma de'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba skad cig ma ma yin pa'i chos skye ste /
analyzed: las skad cig ma de'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba skad cig ma ma yin pa'i chos skye ste /
translated: The nonexpiration of karma is a phenomenon that is not momentary, which arises from that momentary karma.

original: bu lon ji lta ba de ltar ni las blta bar bya la /
analyzed: bu lon ji lta ba de ltar ni las blta bar bya la /
translated: Karma should be viewed in the same way as a debt.

original: dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar ni chud mi za ba de blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar ni chud mi za ba de blta bar bya'o //
translated: The nonexpiration of karma should be viewed in the same way as a promissory note.

original: de la dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag de'i nor chud mi za zhing nor skyed dang bcas te 'ong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag de'i nor chud mi za zhing nor skyed dang bcas te 'ong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, even though the money of a debtor is spent, the money is not lost to the creditor because of the promissory note, and the money comes back with interest.

original: las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang /
analyzed: las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, even though the momentary karma ceases,

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za'i chos skye ba de yod pas byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za'i chos skye ba de yod pas byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the nonexpiration of karma arises from its cause, and the result of the karma of the agent is not lost and comes back.

original: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir bkug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir bkug ste /
translated: For example, even though the money of a debtor is spent,

original: 'bras bu spyad zin na dpang rgya yod kyang yang dang yang du nor 'da' bar mi nus pa de ltar /
analyzed: 'bras bu spyad zin na dpang rgya yod kyang yang dang yang du nor 'da' bar mi nus pa de ltar /
translated: the creditor cannot repeatedly demand the money once the result of the debt has been used, even though the promissory note exists.

original: byed pa pos 'bras bu myong zin na chud mi za bas kyang yang dang yang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te /🔽de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi /
analyzed: byed pa pos 'bras bu myong zin na chud mi za bas kyang yang dang yang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te / de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi /
translated: If the agent has already experienced the result, then the nonexpiration of action would not be able to produce the result again and again.🔽The dharmas of nonexpiration are of four types.

original: chur mi za ba'i chos de ni khams las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: chur mi za ba'i chos de ni khams las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The dharmas of nonexpiration are of four types:

original: 'dod pa gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: those belonging to the realm of desire, those belonging to the realm of form, those belonging to the formless realm, and those that are pure.

original: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
translated: They are morally neutral by nature.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang mi dge bar lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang mi dge bar lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are not declared to be either virtuous or nonvirtuous by nature.

original: spong bas spang pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spong bas spang pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not abandoned by the path of insight.

original: bsgom pas spang pa nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang pa nyid kyang yin //
translated: They are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam @234b mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam @234b mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not abandoned by the path of insight that abandons the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de ni 'bras bu gzhan du 'pho ba na bsgom pas spang par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gzhan du 'pho ba na bsgom pas spang par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not abandoned by the path of cultivation when one passes to another result.

original: de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
analyzed: de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
translated: Therefore, the Vaibhāṣikas say, the nonexpiration of action is not declared to be either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: las kyi 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: Karma generates its result.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang spong pas spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu thob zin na yang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang spong pas spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu thob zin na yang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because karma is not abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, etc., nor by the path of relinquishment, therefore, even when the result has been obtained, karma generates its result because it does not expire.🔽If karma were relinquished by relinquishment

original: gal te spong bas spang ba dang // las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na //🔽de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gal te spong bas spang ba dang // las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na // de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
translated: and if karma were transferred to a homogeneous class,🔽then the errors of the destruction of karma, etc.,

original: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would ensue.

original: gal te de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba dang las 'pho ba dang ris mthun pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba dang las 'pho ba dang ris mthun pa yin par gyur na /
translated: If karma were relinquished by relinquishing the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, etc., and if karma were transferred to a homogeneous class,

original: de lta na sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin nam las bzhin du de yang spong bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin nam las bzhin du de yang spong bar 'gyur bas /
translated: then like the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, etc., and like karma, it would also be relinquished.

original: de las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the errors of the destruction of karma, etc., would ensue.

original: 'di ltar so so'i skye bos sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas dag spangs pa na so so'i skye bo'i las gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag kyang spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar so so'i skye bos sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas dag spangs pa na so so'i skye bo'i las gzhan gang dag yin pa de dag kyang spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when ordinary beings abandon the negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and so on, they also abandon any other actions of ordinary beings.

original: gzhan du na mthong ba thob pa yang so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mthong ba thob pa yang so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, one who obtains the path of seeing would possess the actions of an ordinary being.

original: mthong ba thob pa so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de /🔽de la da ni las de dag spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su bzung ste gnas pas de'i phyir mthong ba thob pa so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba thob pa so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi 'dod de / de la da ni las de dag spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las de dag gi rnam par smin pa yongs su bzung ste gnas pas de'i phyir mthong ba thob pa so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: But it is unacceptable that one who obtains the path of seeing possesses the actions of an ordinary being.🔽Even though one abandons those actions, one still possesses the karma of those actions because they are not wasted.

original: las rnams chud za ba de nyid du yang mi 'gyur te rnam par smin par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnams chud za ba de nyid du yang mi 'gyur te rnam par smin par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not the case that those actions are wasted because they ripen.

original: de lta bas na de'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba las bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba las bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing that abandons objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing such as the suffering of the desire realm.

original: 'bras bu gzhan du 'phos na ni spong bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan du 'phos na ni spong bar 'gyur ro//
translated: It is abandoned when one passes beyond the result.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i chud mi za ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i chud mi za ba ni /
translated: Nonexpiration belonging to the desire realm

original: 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong la /
translated: is abandoned by passing beyond the desire realm.
