original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa dag kyang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong ngo //🔽khams mtshungs las @235a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa dag kyang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong ngo // khams mtshungs las @235a * //
translated: That belonging to the form and formless realms is abandoned by passing beyond the form and formless realms.🔽All homogeneous

original: ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi //🔽de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
analyzed: ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi // de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
translated: and heterogeneous actions🔽are produced

original: gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur //
translated: only at the time of linking.

original: khams mtshungs pa'i las cha mtshungs pa dang cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi chud mi za ba de'i tshe 'di la re re las skyes pa dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe de dag thams cad 'gag pa na yang gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: khams mtshungs pa'i las cha mtshungs pa dang cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi chud mi za ba de'i tshe 'di la re re las skyes pa dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe de dag thams cad 'gag pa na yang gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur ro
translated: When the nonexpiration of all similar karmic actions of the same type and dissimilar type occurs in this life, then when all of them cease at the time of rebirth, only one is born.

original: // tshe 'di la ni las dang las //
analyzed: // tshe 'di la ni las dang las //
translated: In this life, the nonexpiration

original: rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi //
translated: of all the various karmas

original: de ni tha dad skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni tha dad skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: is born separately,

original: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin //
translated: and even when it ripens, it endures.

original: tshe 'di la ni las dang las so so ba sems pa dang bsams pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi chud mi za ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni las dang las so so ba sems pa dang bsams pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi chud mi za ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this life, the nonexpiration of all the various karmas, which are the two types of karma, that is, intention and that which is intended, and virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, is born separately.

original: rnam par smin na yang gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin na yang gnas pa yin te /
translated: Even when it ripens, it endures.

original: de ni las rnam par smin pa'i rgyus 'gag pa ltar nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni las rnam par smin pa'i rgyus 'gag pa ltar nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not definite that it ceases by the cause of the ripening of karma.

original: las rnam par smin kyang brgya la ji srid du 'khrugs par ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du gnas te /
analyzed: las rnam par smin kyang brgya la ji srid du 'khrugs par ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du gnas te /
translated: Even though karma is ripened, it remains for a long time, for as long as it is not disturbed.

original: 'khrugs par gyur na ni 'gag go de gnas su zin kyang yang 'bras bu skyed par ni mi nus te nges par spyad bzhin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khrugs par gyur na ni 'gag go de gnas su zin kyang yang 'bras bu skyed par ni mi nus te nges par spyad bzhin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no //
translated: But when it is disturbed, it ceases. Even though it remains, it cannot generate a result, like a promissory note that is being used.🔽It ceases when the result has been passed on,

original: de ni 'bras bu 'phos pa dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu 'phos pa dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: or when one dies.

original: de yi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
analyzed: de yi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
translated: Its classification should be understood as uncontaminated🔽and contaminated.

original: las de'i chud mi za ba de'i 'gag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa yin te /
analyzed: las de'i chud mi za ba de'i 'gag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of the indestructibility of that karma is definitely of two types:

original: 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: when the result has been passed on and when one dies.

original: de la 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa ni bsgom pas spang ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa ni bsgom pas spang ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the passing on of the result is taught to be the abandonment of that karma by the path of meditation.

original: shi bar gyur pa ni 'gag pa dag na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa ni 'gag pa dag na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one dies, it ceases, and when one is reborn, only one of those karmas arises.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de'i de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that should be understood as twofold:

original: zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: by the distinction of uncontaminated and contaminated karma.

original: de'i phyir de ltar las rnams skad cig ma nyid yin yang chud mi za ba'i chos kyis yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //🔽'bras bu dang 'brel ba de yang las kyi bye brag las 'gro ba dang rigs dang / rus dang yul dang dus @235b tha dad pa dag tu lus dang dbang po dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang stobs dang blo la sogs pa tha dad rnams kyis yul sna tshogs kyi bde ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar las rnams skad cig ma nyid yin yang chud mi za ba'i chos kyis yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur ro // 'bras bu dang 'brel ba de yang las kyi bye brag las 'gro ba dang rigs dang / rus dang yul dang dus @235b tha dad pa dag tu lus dang dbang po dang kha dog dang dbyibs dang stobs dang blo la sogs pa tha dad rnams kyis yul sna tshogs kyi bde ba dang /
translated: Thus, although karma is momentary, it is connected with its effect because it is maintained by the principle of the indestructibility of karma.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir / stong pa nyid dang chad min dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro // de'i phyir / stong pa nyid dang chad min dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min //
translated: That connection with its effect is due to the diversity of karma, since the experience of the various objects of pleasure and pain occurs through the diversity of bodies, faculties, color, shape, strength, intelligence, and so on, in different realms, species, clans, countries, and times.🔽Therefore:🔽Emptiness, nonannihilation,

original: las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos //
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos //
translated: noneternality, and the indestructibility of karma

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
translated: are taught by the Buddha.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa de yod pa la sogs pa tha dad pas gnas skabs sna tshogs yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa de yod pa la sogs pa tha dad pas gnas skabs sna tshogs yin la /
translated: Thus, because the connection between action and effect exists, there are various states due to the differences of existence, etc.

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs yin yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs yin yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid nges par mi gnas pa dang brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: And, although there are various states, they are not to be described as identical or different. Therefore, since the intrinsic reality does not definitely abide and is not to be described,

original: stong pa nyid kyang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: emptiness is also tenable.

original: stong pa nyid yin yang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin yang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And, although it is emptiness, the error of nihilism does not follow.

original: 'khor ba yang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: And, cyclic existence is also tenable.

original: 'khor ba yod kyang rtag pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yod kyang rtag pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And, although cyclic existence exists, the error of eternalism does not follow.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa mngon sum du gyur pa las rnams kyi chud mi za ba'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa mngon sum du gyur pa las rnams kyi chud mi za ba'i chos bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: And, the teaching of the Blessed Buddha regarding the indestructibility of actions, which is based on the direct perception of the actions and the ripening of sentient beings, is also tenable.

original: de lta bas na rtag pa de nyid 'dir 'thad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa de nyid 'dir 'thad kyi /
translated: Therefore, permanence is tenable here.

original: myu gu'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'grub pa bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par rtogs pa de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: myu gu'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'grub pa bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu 'grub par rtogs pa de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable to understand the effect of karma to be established in the same way that a sprout is established from the cause of a seed.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod dri za'i grong khyer gyi ra ba 'chos pas g-yen spyo 'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod dri za'i grong khyer gyi ra ba 'chos pas g-yen spyo 'am /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you get angry at the construction of a gandharva’s city?

original: khyod las mi 'thad bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu'i phyir rtsod ko //
analyzed: khyod las mi 'thad bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu'i phyir rtsod ko //
translated: You argue for the effect of karma even though karma is untenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te khyed kyis las ngo bo nyid kyis cung zad cig rab tu bsgrubs par gyur na ni des na las yod pa de rgyun 'brel pas sam chud mi za bas 'bras bu dang 'brel par bsam pa yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te khyed kyis las ngo bo nyid kyis cung zad cig rab tu bsgrubs par gyur na ni des na las yod pa de rgyun 'brel pas sam chud mi za bas 'bras bu dang 'brel par bsam pa yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this way, if you established karma even slightly by its intrinsic reality, then it would be logical to think that the effect would be related to the existent karma through the connection of its continuum or through its nonexpiration.

original: gang gi tshe las de nyid ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'thad pa de'i tshe gzhi med pa'i bsam pa 'dis ci zhig bya ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe las de nyid ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'thad pa de'i tshe gzhi med pa'i bsam pa 'dis ci zhig bya ;
translated: But when karma itself is untenable by its intrinsic reality, then what is the point of this thought that lacks a basis?

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / smras pa /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is tenable.

original: las ji ltar mi 'thad /
analyzed: las ji ltar mi 'thad /
translated: Objection: How is karma untenable?

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
translated: Because karma does not arise.

original: gang gi phyir las la skye ba med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las la skye ba med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir mi 'thad de /
translated: Because karma does not arise, therefore it is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes na ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes na ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not arise, how could it be tenable?

original: smras pa / ci'i phyir las skye ba med @236a * //
analyzed: smras pa / ci'i phyir las skye ba med @236a * //
translated: Objection: Why does karma not arise?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang phyir dngos nyid med de'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang phyir dngos nyid med de'i phyir //
translated: Because it does not have intrinsic reality.

original: gang gi phyir las ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir skye ba med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir skye ba med de /
translated: Because karma does not have intrinsic reality, therefore it does not arise.

original: 'di ltar las kyi ngo bo nyid yod na ni las kyi skye ba 'di yin no //🔽zhes skye ba yang 'thad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi ngo bo nyid yod na ni las kyi skye ba 'di yin no // zhes skye ba yang 'thad par 'gyur na /
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality, then the arising of karma would be tenable.

original: las kyi ngo bo nyid med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo nyid med na ci zhig skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If karma does not have intrinsic reality, what arises?

original: ci ste skye na yang ngo bo nyid du ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste skye na yang ngo bo nyid du ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it arises, it would not arise with intrinsic reality.

original: gang ngo bo nyid du skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni las nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid du skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni las nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which does not arise with intrinsic reality is not karma.

original: las kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because karma does not have intrinsic reality.

original: de'i las mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i las mi 'thad do //
translated: Karma is not tenable.

original: smras pa / las ni skye ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / las ni skye ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: Objection: Karma does arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: las rnams chud mi za ba'i phyir te /🔽'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang las rnams chud za ba med do //
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za ba'i phyir te / 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang las rnams chud za ba med do //
translated: Because karma does not expire.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: For the Bhagavān has said, “Karma does not expire.”

original: gal te las la skye ba med na chud mi za ba de gang yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te las la skye ba med na chud mi za ba de gang yin par 'gyur /
translated: If karma does not arise, how could it not expire?

original: de lta bas na las ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na las ni skye ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore karma definitely arises.

original: bshad pa / skye ba yod na chud mi za ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / skye ba yod na chud mi za ba mi 'thad de /
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains: If it arises, it does not expire.

original: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa /
analyzed: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa /
translated: Because it does not arise,

original: de ni chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni chud zar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not expire.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang kho na'i phyir las de ma skyes pa de kho na'i phyir chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang kho na'i phyir las de ma skyes pa de kho na'i phyir chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān has said, “Because that karma does not arise, it does not expire.”

original: gzhan du skye na ji ltar chud mi za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du skye na ji ltar chud mi za bar 'gyur /
translated: If it arises elsewhere, how could it not expire?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni skyes pa yang mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na skyes pa mi 'chi bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni skyes pa yang mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhig na skyes pa mi 'chi bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then what has arisen would not die. But what has arisen does die.

original: de lta bas na las kyang skyes nas chud mi za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na las kyang skyes nas chud mi za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus karma would not be destroyed after it has arisen.

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe kho bos las skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gags kyang chud mi za ba'i chos kyis 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe kho bos las skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gags kyang chud mi za ba'i chos kyis 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: When I say that even though karma ceases because it is momentary, the effect is established by the factor of nonexpiration,

original: zhes smras pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time

original: las skyes na ji ltar chud mi za bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di gang gi lan yin /
analyzed: las skyes na ji ltar chud mi za bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di gang gi lan yin /
translated: what is the response to the question, “If karma arises, how could it be nonexpired?”

original: bshad pa / de ni 'di nyid kyi lan yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / de ni 'di nyid kyi lan yin te /
translated: Response: This is the response:

original: gal te khyod kyis las de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'gags na chud mi za ba de gang gi yin te /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis las de skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'gags na chud mi za ba de gang gi yin te /
translated: If you say that karma ceases because it is momentary, then what is nonexpired?

original: gzhi med na chud mi za bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhi med na chud mi za bar mi 'thad do //
translated: If the basis does not exist, nonexpiration is untenable.

original: 'di ltar las kyi chud mi za ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi chud mi za ba yin na /
translated: In this way, if karma is nonexpired,

original: las de yang 'gags te med na /
analyzed: las de yang 'gags te med na /
translated: then that karma ceases and does not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir chud mi za ba yang med de /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir chud mi za ba yang med de /
translated: Because it does not exist, nonexpiration also does not exist.

original: de lta bas na 'gag pa'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba de ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gag pa'i chud mi za ba zhes bya ba de ni 'gal lo //
translated: Thus the statement “Nonexpiration of cessation” is contradictory.

original: smras pa / las 'gags na yang rnam par smin pa chud mi za bas skyon med do //
analyzed: smras pa / las 'gags na yang rnam par smin pa chud mi za bas skyon med do //
translated: Objection: Even if the action ceases, since its ripening does not expire, there is no error.

original: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That also is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di @236b la las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag byed pa pos 'thob pa ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di @236b la las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag byed pa pos 'thob pa ni rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Here the result of the action, whether it is desirable or undesirable, is obtained by the agent, and that is called the ripening.

original: de yang tshe 'di 'am skyes pa 'am lan grangs gzhan la rkyen gyi bye brag de dag gis myong bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de yang tshe 'di 'am skyes pa 'am lan grangs gzhan la rkyen gyi bye brag de dag gis myong bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, that is experienced in this life, in the next life, or in another lifetime, through the specific conditions.

original: ma skyes pa rkyen la ltos pa rkyen la rag las pa de chud mi za bas ji ltar 'dzin par byed ci ste de skyes pa nyid yin na ni des byed pa po la 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rkyen la ltos pa rkyen la rag las pa de chud mi za bas ji ltar 'dzin par byed ci ste de skyes pa nyid yin na ni des byed pa po la 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar bya dgos te /
translated: If that which has not arisen depends on conditions and is dependent on conditions, how could it be grasped as not expiring? But if it has arisen, then it must cause the agent to experience the results of pleasure and pain.

original: de lta yin na ni de la chud mi za bas yang byar ci yod /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de la chud mi za bas yang byar ci yod /
translated: If that were the case, then what need is there for it to be grasped as not expiring?

original: ci ste skyes kyang re zhig des byed pa po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar mi byed na ni gang gis de skyes so //🔽zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba de'i skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
analyzed: ci ste skyes kyang re zhig des byed pa po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar mi byed na ni gang gis de skyes so // zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ba de'i skyes pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
translated: But if, though arisen, it does not cause the experiencer to experience pleasure and pain, then what is the characteristic of its arising?

original: gal te de skyes kyang byed pa po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar mi byed na ni phyis kyang des de la ci yang byed par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te de skyes kyang byed pa po la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag myong bar mi byed na ni phyis kyang des de la ci yang byed par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If, though arisen, it does not cause the experiencer to experience pleasure and pain, then later on it would not cause anything at all.

original: phyis byed pa po la de 'bul bar 'gyur ba yang su zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis byed pa po la de 'bul bar 'gyur ba yang su zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: And who would be the one who later gives it to the experiencer?

original: de lta bas na de kho na'i don rnam par ma shes nas chud mi za ba'i tshig tsam la dngos por mngon par zhi bar byas nas mang po dang sna tshogs pa dang snying po med pa de snyed cig smras so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de kho na'i don rnam par ma shes nas chud mi za ba'i tshig tsam la dngos por mngon par zhi bar byas nas mang po dang sna tshogs pa dang snying po med pa de snyed cig smras so //
translated: Therefore, not understanding the meaning of reality, you have taken the mere word “inexhaustibility” as a real entity and have said so much that is pointless, varied, and empty.

original: 'di ltar las ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar las ni ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te /
translated: An action is just devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: Because it is essenceless, therefore it is unarisen.

original: gang gi phyir ma skyes pa de'i phyir chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma skyes pa de'i phyir chud za bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is unarisen, therefore it does not perish.

original: de ni de ltar nges par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nges par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be ascertained.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te las la dngos nyid yod //
analyzed: gal te las la dngos nyid yod //
translated: if karma had an intrinsic reality,

original: rtag par 'gyur par the tshom med //
analyzed: rtag par 'gyur par the tshom med //
translated: it would be permanent, there is no doubt.

original: gal te las la ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te las la ngo bo nyid yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality,

original: rtag par 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
analyzed: rtag par 'gyur bar the tshom med de /
translated: it would be permanent, there is no doubt.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Because an essence does not change, it is not tenable that it becomes something else.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
translated: karma would not be produced,

original: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
translated: because the permanent has no activity.

original: las rtag pa nyid min na ma byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las rtag pa nyid min na ma byas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If karma is not permanent, it follows that it is not produced.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the permanent has no activity.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can la ni yang bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can la ni yang bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the permanent, which has the property of not changing, has activity.

original: las ma byas pa rtag pa'i 'bras bur ji ltar rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las ma byas pa rtag pa'i 'bras bur ji ltar rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: How could the result of an action not done ripen?

original: 'di ltar rtag pa la 'gyur ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa la 'gyur ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Because it is untenable that a permanent thing changes.

original: ci ste las rtag pa mi 'gyur ba yin yang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang phrad par @237a * //
analyzed: ci ste las rtag pa mi 'gyur ba yin yang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang phrad par @237a * //
translated: But if you imagine that even though the action is permanent and unchanging, it still comes into contact with the result that arises from its cause,

original: rtog na / de lta na yang /
analyzed: rtog na / de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case as well,

original: ci ste las ni ma byas na //
analyzed: ci ste las ni ma byas na //
translated: If the action is not done,

original: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jigs 'gyur //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jigs 'gyur //
translated: then there is the fear of encountering the result of an action not done.

original: ci ste las ma byas pa yin yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste las ma byas pa yin yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur na /
translated: If an action that is not done still generates a result,

original: de lta na ma byas pa dang phrad pas 'jigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ma byas pa dang phrad pas 'jigs par 'gyur te /
translated: then there is the fear of encountering the result of an action not done.

original: 'di ltar de las mi dge ba ma byas su zin kyang de la yod pa kho na yin pas des na 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'ong bar 'gyur bas de la 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las mi dge ba ma byas su zin kyang de la yod pa kho na yin pas des na 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'ong bar 'gyur bas de la 'jigs pa chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because even though one does not do an unwholesome action, it still exists for that person. Therefore, the result of an unwholesome action that is not wanted will come. Thus, there is the fear of encountering the result of an action not done.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang //
translated: even one who does not abide in pure conduct

original: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would incur the fault of encountering the result of an action not done.

original: las ma byas pa yin na de la skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las ma byas pa yin na de la skyon chen po gzhan 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If karma were not performed, this other great error would ensue:🔽Since noncelibacy would exist even though it is not committed, it would be untenable that anyone abides in celibacy.🔽And since celibacy would exist even though non-celibacy is not practiced, it would be pointless to abide in celibacy.

original: gang gis tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa ma byas kyang yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang tshangs par spyod par spyod pa la gnas par mi 'thad pa dang / gang gis tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa de ma spyad kyang de la tshangs par spyod pa yod pa kho na'i phyir yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin par thal🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa ma byas kyang yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang tshangs par spyod par spyod pa la gnas par mi 'thad pa dang / gang gis tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa de ma spyad kyang de la tshangs par spyod pa yod pa kho na'i phyir yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that no one would abide in celibacy.

original: de bzhin du /🔽tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du / tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
translated: Similarly,🔽all conventions would be undermined.

original: 'gal bar 'gyur bar the tsom med //
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur bar the tsom med //
translated: There is no doubt.

original: de ltar las byas pa ma yin na 'jig rten pa 'bras bu'i don du tha snyad rtsom par byed pa zhing las dang nyo tshong dang phyugs btsal ba dang / rgyal po la brten pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rigs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar las byas pa ma yin na 'jig rten pa 'bras bu'i don du tha snyad rtsom par byed pa zhing las dang nyo tshong dang phyugs btsal ba dang / rgyal po la brten pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rigs pa dang /
translated: If karma were not created in this way, then all the worldly conventions that are created for the sake of results, such as farming, commerce, animal husbandry, and service to the king, and likewise,🔽the cultivation of knowledge,

original: bzo dang / sgyu rtsal goms par byed pa dang / de dag gi lung 'bogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad nyid dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzo dang / sgyu rtsal goms par byed pa dang / de dag gi lung 'bogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad nyid dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arts, and crafts, and the teaching of their scriptures, would all be contradicted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byed pa dang mi byed pa dag la de dag gi 'bras bu 'ong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang / bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
analyzed: byed pa dang mi byed pa dag la de dag gi 'bras bu 'ong bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang / bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
translated: Because it would follow that the results of those who do and those who do not create karma would be the same.🔽Moreover,🔽The distinction between those who create

original: rnam par dbye ba'ang 'thad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'ang 'thad mi 'gyur //
translated: merit and those who create evil would not be tenable.🔽If karma were not created, then the distinction between those who create merit and those who create evil would not be tenable.

original: las ma byas pa yin na 'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
analyzed: las ma byas pa yin na 'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
translated: This is because it would be said: This one creates merit.

original: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba de dag kyang 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba de dag kyang 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This one creates evil.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ma byas pa thams cad kyang yod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu yang 'thob @237b par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las ma byas pa thams cad kyang yod par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu yang 'thob @237b par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that all virtuous and nonvirtuous karma that has not been performed would exist, and it would follow that the effects of those would be obtained.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: de yi rnam smin smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi rnam smin smin par 'gyur //
translated: Its karmic maturation would ripen

original: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur //
translated: Again and again, its karmic maturation would ripen.

original: gal te gang phyir las gnas pa //
analyzed: gal te gang phyir las gnas pa //
translated: If karma endures because of that,

original: de phyir ngo bo nyid yod phyir //
analyzed: de phyir ngo bo nyid yod phyir //
translated: then it would have intrinsic reality.

original: gal te las de ngo bo nyid yod pa yang yin la 'bras bu skyes par 'gyur ba yang yin na /
analyzed: gal te las de ngo bo nyid yod pa yang yin la 'bras bu skyes par 'gyur ba yang yin na /
translated: If that karma has intrinsic reality and also generates an effect,

original: de lta na de'i rnam par smin pa smin zin par gyur kyang yang dang yang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de'i rnam par smin pa smin zin par gyur kyang yang dang yang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though its karmic maturation has already ripened, it would ripen again and again.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir las nges par gnas pa yin na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las nges par gnas pa yin na de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pas /
translated: Because if karma endures, then it would have intrinsic reality.🔽Just as it definitely endures with its intrinsic reality

original: ji ltar de sngon ngo bo nyid nges par gnas pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar de sngon ngo bo nyid nges par gnas pa na /
translated: in the past,

original: 'bras bu bskyed par gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed par gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too it would generate an effect in the present.

original: da ltar yang nges par gnas pas /
analyzed: da ltar yang nges par gnas pas /
translated: Because it definitely endures,

original: de'i phyir des na yang 'di na gzhan du 'bras bu bskyed par bya dgos so //🔽yang na ni nges par gnas par 'dra yang gang gis sngon ni 'bras bu bskyed par gyur pa la de ni yang dang yang du skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir des na yang 'di na gzhan du 'bras bu bskyed par bya dgos so // yang na ni nges par gnas par 'dra yang gang gis sngon ni 'bras bu bskyed par gyur pa la de ni yang dang yang du skyed par mi byed do //
translated: therefore, it must generate an effect in another place.

original: zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan par bya dgos so //
translated: Or, if it is similar in that it definitely endures, then you must state a reason for the distinction, “That which previously generated an effect does not generate it again and again.”

original: smras pa / khyod ni las ngo bo nyid yod pa'i skyon yang dag par rdzogs pa 'ba' zhig byed par zad kyi /🔽'di ltar na las ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod ni las ngo bo nyid yod pa'i skyon yang dag par rdzogs pa 'ba' zhig byed par zad kyi / 'di ltar na las ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Objection: You are only correctly stating the error of the inherent existence of karma.

original: zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang mi ston na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang mi ston na /
translated: You do not teach in the least that “In this way karma does not exist inherently.”

original: de'i phyir gal te gang gis las de ngo bo nyid med do zhes kho bo yid ches par 'gyur ba las ngo bo nyid med du ston pa'i rigs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa lta na de ston cig / bshad pa nyon cig / las 'di nyon mongs bdag
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gang gis las de ngo bo nyid med do zhes kho bo yid ches par 'gyur ba las ngo bo nyid med du ston pa'i rigs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa lta na de ston cig / bshad pa nyon cig / las 'di nyon mongs bdag
translated: Therefore, if you have some reasoning that teaches the absence of inherent existence of karma, by which I might come to believe that karma does not exist inherently, then teach that.🔽Response: Listen! This karma is the self of the afflictions.

original: nyid na // nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyid na // nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
translated: Those afflictions are not real.

original: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
translated: If the afflictions are not real,

original: las ni de yi ji ltar byas //
analyzed: las ni de yi ji ltar byas //
translated: How can karma be real?

original: las zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: This so-called karma arises from the cause of the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed pa ni las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byed pa ni las zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is done by body, speech, and mind that is associated with an afflicted mind is called karma.

original: de lta na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin can nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, since it arises from the cause of the afflictions, it is of the nature of the afflictions, and it is not intrinsically real.

original: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
translated: Those afflictions are not real.

original: zhes bya ba'i las gang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i las gang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Those afflictions that are the nature of that karma are also not real.

original: de'i dngos po @238a * //
analyzed: de'i dngos po @238a * //
translated: Its reality

original: ni yang dag pa ste nyon mongs pa'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ni yang dag pa ste nyon mongs pa'i dngos po nyid du yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: is not real as the reality of the afflictions, and it is not intrinsically real.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'og nas kyang /🔽gang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
analyzed: 'og nas kyang / gang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
translated: And later it says:🔽Those that arise in dependence on

original: phyin ci log la rten 'byung ba //
analyzed: phyin ci log la rten 'byung ba //
translated: the misapprehension of the pleasant and the unpleasant

original: de dag ngo bo nyid las med //🔽de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid las med // de phyir nyon mongs yang dag med //
translated: do not exist through their own intrinsic reality.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the afflictions do not exist in reality.

original: gal te las gang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te las gang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin zhing /
translated: If the afflictions that are the nature of karma do not exist in reality,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin na //
translated: and do not exist through their own intrinsic reality,

original: 'o na da las ci zhig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na da las ci zhig gi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then what is the nature of karma?

original: gang gi phyir las ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin la /
translated: Because karma arises from the cause of the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni phyin ci log gi rgyu las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir las dang nyon mongs zhes smra'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni phyin ci log gi rgyu las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir las dang nyon mongs zhes smra'o //
translated: and the afflictions arise from the cause of misapprehension, therefore karma and the afflictions are said to exist.

original: smras pa / las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: Karma and the afflictions do exist through their own intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their effects exist through their own intrinsic reality.

original: 'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni lus rnams kyi rkyen du bstan la lus rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pas de phyir 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na
analyzed: 'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni lus rnams kyi rkyen du bstan la lus rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pas de phyir 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na
translated: Here karma and affliction are taught to be the conditions of bodies. Since bodies exist due to their own intrinsic reality, therefore karma and affliction exist due to their own intrinsic reality because their effect exists due to its own intrinsic reality.

original: yin no // bshad pa /
analyzed: yin no // bshad pa /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
translated: Karma and affliction

original: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
analyzed: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
translated: Are taught to be the conditions of bodies.

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //
translated: If karma and affliction

original: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
translated: Are empty, how could bodies be described?

original: 'di la khyod kyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni lus rnams kyi rkyen du bstan la /🔽zhes smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyi las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni lus rnams kyi rkyen du bstan la / zhes smras pa /
translated: Here you say, “Karma and affliction are taught to be the conditions of bodies.”

original: 'bras bu grub pas rgyu 'grub par 'dod la rgyu 'grub pa'i rigs pa gzhan ni cung zad kyang mi ston te /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pas rgyu 'grub par 'dod la rgyu 'grub pa'i rigs pa gzhan ni cung zad kyang mi ston te /
translated: You assert that causes are established by the establishment of their effects, but you do not teach any other principle for the establishment of causes.

original: kho bo cig gis lus kyi rgyu las de dang nyon mongs pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kho bo cig gis lus kyi rgyu las de dang nyon mongs pa de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: We have taught that since karma and affliction, which are the causes of bodies, are dependently arisen,

original: ngo bo nyid stong ngo //🔽zhes bstan pas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong ngo //🔽zhes bstan pas /
translated: they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can du 'dod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir gal te lus kyi rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa dag nyid stong zhing de dag stong na lus ngo bo nyid yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can du 'dod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir gal te lus kyi rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa dag nyid stong zhing de dag stong na lus ngo bo nyid yod do //
translated: Since the effect is asserted to be the nature of the qualities of the cause, therefore, if the cause of the body, karma and affliction, are empty, and if they are empty, the body does not exist inherently.

original: zhes bya ba de ji ltar brjod de /🔽lus ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ji ltar brjod de / lus ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid do //
translated: The effect should be asserted to have the nature of the qualities of the cause. Therefore, if the cause of the body, karma and affliction, are empty, and if they are empty, how can you say, “The body exists by its own intrinsic reality”?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni gtsigs pa ma yin pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni gtsigs pa ma yin pa nyid du nges so //
translated: The statement, “The body exists by its own intrinsic reality,” is definitely meaningless.

original: smras pa / @238b las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / @238b las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: Karma surely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it?

original: las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the experiencer of the effect of karma exists.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang de dag tu /
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavān has said in various ways:

original: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag //
translated: Sentient beings obscured by ignorance

original: sred pa'i kun tu sbyor dang ldan //🔽zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: sred pa'i kun tu sbyor dang ldan // zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: are bound by the fetter of craving.

original: gzhan yang ci ste khyod rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci ste khyod rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na /
translated: Moreover, if you yourself commit this sinful karma,

original: khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so //
translated: You yourself will experience its fruition.

original: zhes kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
translated: The person who is obscured by ignorance

original: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
analyzed: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
translated: and is attached is the experiencer.

original: ma rig pas bsgribs pa'i sems can sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang zhes gang gsungs pa dang / khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes gang gsungs pa de ni las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pas bsgribs pa'i sems can sred pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang zhes gang gsungs pa dang / khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes gang gsungs pa de ni las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yin te /
translated: The person who is obscured by ignorance and is attached by the fetter of craving is the experiencer who experiences the result of karma, and you yourself will experience its fruition.

original: de'i phyir re zhig las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po 'thad pas med pa'i 'bras bu yang med la byed pa po med pa'i las kyang mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po 'thad pas med pa'i 'bras bu yang med la byed pa po med pa'i las kyang mi 'thad pas /
translated: Therefore, since the experiencer of the result of karma is tenable, there is no result without a cause, and since karma without an agent is untenable,

original: za ba po yod pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag kyang rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: za ba po yod pa'i phyir byed pa po dang las dag kyang rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: the agent and action are also fully established because the experiencer exists.

original: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
analyzed: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
translated: It is not different from the agent and action.

original: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that itself.

original: da ni las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po de yang las de'i byed pa po las gzhan ma yin te /🔽rang gi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po de yang las de'i byed pa po las gzhan ma yin te / rang gi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the experiencer of the effect of karma is not different from the agent of that karma,

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “One experiences the ripening of karma oneself.”

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that it is not different,

original: nye bar len pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appropriator is different.

original: de lta na 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus samsara is tenable, and the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not follow.

original: bshad pa / ci khyod rtsig rmang ma bres par pu shu 'dogs par byed dam /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod rtsig rmang ma bres par pu shu 'dogs par byed dam /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Do you build the upper story without first laying the foundation?

original: khyod byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dag rab tu ma grub bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po sgrub par byed ko //
analyzed: khyod byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dag rab tu ma grub bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po sgrub par byed ko //
translated: You are establishing the experiencer of the effect of karma while the agent, karma, and effect are not established at all.

original: 'di ltar byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dag nyid mi 'thad na za ba po 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dag nyid mi 'thad na za ba po 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the agent, karma, and effect are not tenable, how could the experiencer be tenable?

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni //
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
translated: This action does not arise from conditions.

original: rkyen min las byung @239a * //🔽yod min pa //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung @239a * // yod min pa //
translated: Nor does it arise from non-conditions.

original: de phyir byed pa po yang med /🔽gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la las 'di zhes bya ba de rkyen las byung ngo zhes bya ba mi srid la /
analyzed: de phyir byed pa po yang med / gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba smra ba rnams la las 'di zhes bya ba de rkyen las byung ngo zhes bya ba mi srid la /
translated: Therefore, an agent also does not exist.🔽For those who propound dependent origination, it is impossible to say, “This action arises from conditions.”

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar smra ba rnams la yang las 'di zhes bya ba de rgyu med pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar smra ba rnams la yang las 'di zhes bya ba de rgyu med pa las byung ngo //
translated: For those who propound that it arises without a cause, it is impossible to say, “This action arises without a cause.”

original: zhes bya ba mi srid pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi srid pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: las ni re zhig rkyen las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: las ni re zhig rkyen las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: an action does not exist that arises from conditions,

original: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa las byung ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: nor does it exist that arises from non-conditions.

original: gang gi phyir las yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir las med pa'i byed pa po yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir las yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir las med pa'i byed pa po yang med do //
translated: Since an action does not exist, an agent of an action also does not exist.

original: gal te las dang byed med na //
analyzed: gal te las dang byed med na //
translated: If action and agent do not exist,

original: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
analyzed: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
translated: how could there be a result arisen from action?

original: ci ste 'bras bu yod min na //
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu yod min na //
translated: If a result does not exist,

original: za ba po lta ga la yod //
analyzed: za ba po lta ga la yod //
translated: How could there be an experiencer?

original: gal te brtags na las kyang med la byed pa po yang med de /
analyzed: gal te brtags na las kyang med la byed pa po yang med de /
translated: If one investigates, there is no karma and no agent.

original: de dag med na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag med na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If they do not exist, how could there be a result that arises from karma?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did, then it would be a result that did not arise from karma and it would be a result that arose without a cause. But that is unacceptable because it would lead to many errors.

original: da ci ste 'bras bu med na za ba po yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ci ste 'bras bu med na za ba po yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: But if a result does not exist, how could an experiencer exist?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i za ba por 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i za ba por 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: In this way, if one were to become an experiencer of a result, that result would be untenable.

original: de med na de gang gi za ba por 'gyur /🔽de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po yod do //
analyzed: de med na de gang gi za ba por 'gyur / de lta bas na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po yod do //
translated: If it does not exist, how could one become an experiencer of it?

original: zhes bya ba de ni slu ba'i tshig tsam du zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni slu ba'i tshig tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The agent, karma, result, and experiencer exist” is just a deceptive lie.

original: byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag mi 'thad na /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag mi 'thad na /
translated: If the agent, karma, result, and experiencer are untenable,🔽then how could the self exist?

original: 'khor ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur //
translated: How could cyclic existence be tenable?

original: smras pa / ci byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dang nyon mongs pa dag med do //🔽zhes bya ba de shin tu nges pa yin nam /🔽bshad pa / gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la yod do zhe 'am /
analyzed: smras pa / ci byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dang nyon mongs pa dag med do // zhes bya ba de shin tu nges pa yin nam / bshad pa / gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la yod do zhe 'am /
translated: Objection: Is it definite that there is no agent, action, effect, experiencer, or afflictions?

original: med do zhes smra par ga la rigs /
analyzed: med do zhes smra par ga la rigs /
translated: Response: How could it be logical to say that dependent origination exists or does not exist?

original: smras pa / de 'dir dngos po yod pa gang yin /
analyzed: smras pa / de 'dir dngos po yod pa gang yin /
translated: Objection: What is the existent thing here?

original: bshad pa / dngos po yod pa ga la yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos po yod pa ga la yin te /
translated: Response: How could it be an existent thing?

original: dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir des zung shig / ji ltar sprul pa snyon byed pa //
analyzed: dngos po yod par 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir des zung shig / ji ltar sprul pa snyon byed pa //
translated: In order to reverse the conception of an existent thing, you should grasp it as an emanation.🔽Just as an emanation conjures another emanation

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //🔽sprul zhing sprul pa'ang @239b gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis // sprul zhing sprul pa'ang @239b gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Through the perfection of magical power,

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
translated: And that emanation conjures another,

original: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas //
analyzed: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas //
translated: So too the agent creates an action.

original: de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
analyzed: de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
translated: And that is like the nature of an emanation.

original: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like an emanation creating another emanation.

original: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: Afflictions, actions, and bodies, the agent and effects, are like a city of gandharvas, a mirage, and a dream.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sprul pa byed pa dang / sprul pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bu'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang lus dang byed pa po dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sprul pa byed pa dang / sprul pa dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bu'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dang lus dang byed pa po dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dag la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the agent, the effect, and the experiencer of the results of actions are like an emanation, a magical creation, a city of gandharvas, an illusion, a mirage, and a dream.

original: yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa yang dag par smras pa yod do //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa yang dag par smras pa yod do //
translated: One who is endowed with thorough analysis can say that they exist.

original: zhe 'am med do zhes ji ltar smra bar nus te /
analyzed: zhe 'am med do zhes ji ltar smra bar nus te /
translated: Or, one can say that they do not exist. How can one say this?

original: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa thams cad ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa thams cad ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because all conceptual thoughts of things and nonthings are connected with the errors of eternalism and nihilism.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba dag las phyi rol du gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba dag las phyi rol du gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Since dependent origination is external to the views of existence and nonexistence,

original: de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon las rnam par grol ba yin no //🔽de lta bas na kho bos dngos po brten nas gdags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa dang chad par lta ba'i skyon las rnam par grol ba yin no // de lta bas na kho bos dngos po brten nas gdags pa yin no //
translated: therefore, it is free from the errors of eternalism and nihilism.

original: zhes shin tu nges par byas pa de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shin tu nges par byas pa de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should accept the statement, “I posit things as dependent designations.”

original: de lta na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dang nyon mongs pa dang lus bstan pa dag kyang 'thad la /
analyzed: de lta na byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang za ba po dang nyon mongs pa dang lus bstan pa dag kyang 'thad la /
translated: Thus, the presentation of the agent, action, effect, experiencer, afflictions, and body is tenable.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur zhing 'khor ba yang 'grub po //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur zhing 'khor ba yang 'grub po //
translated: Eternalism and nihilism do not follow, and cyclic existence is established.

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the examination of action and effect,

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: the seventeenth chapter.

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: Buddhapālita’s Commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: PART SEVEN

original: smras pa / gal te dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de kho na ma yin na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur bas de kho na ma yin na /
translated: Objection: If the view of things and nonthings entails the errors of eternalism and nihilism, then it is not reality.

original: khyod kyi de kho na gang yin pa dang ji ltar de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ba de smros shig / bshad pa /
analyzed: khyod kyi de kho na gang yin pa dang ji ltar de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ba de smros shig / bshad pa /
translated: So tell me, what is your reality and how will you realize reality?

original: dang po brtsams tshun chad nas de kho na rab tu bstan par byas so //
analyzed: dang po brtsams tshun chad nas de kho na rab tu bstan par byas so //
translated: Response: Since the beginning of the treatise, reality has been taught.

original: mdor na phyi dang nang la bdag med pa bdag gi med pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i dam pa yin la /🔽de kho @240a * //
analyzed: mdor na phyi dang nang la bdag med pa bdag gi med pa nyid du lta ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i dam pa yin la / de kho @240a * //
translated: In brief, the view that the internal and external are selfless and devoid of mine is the highest reality.

original: na'i lta ba bsgoms pas ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na'i lta ba bsgoms pas ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating the view of reality, one will realize reality.

original: smras pa / ji ltar phyi dang nang la bdag med pa dang / bdag gi med pa nyid du lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar phyi dang nang la bdag med pa dang / bdag gi med pa nyid du lta bar 'gyur /
translated: Objection: How will one view the internal and external as selfless and devoid of mine?

original: bshad pa / 'di la de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pas 'di ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di la de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pas 'di ltar so sor yang dag par brtag par bya ste /
translated: Response: One who wishes to see reality should contemplate in the following way.

original: bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams nyid dam /
translated: Is the so-called self the aggregates themselves,

original: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig min /
analyzed: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig min /
translated: or is it something other than the aggregates?

original: bdag de ni phung po rnams nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag de ni phung po rnams nyid dam /
translated: The self is either the aggregates themselves,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan zhig tu 'gyur ba de tsam du zad de /
translated: or it is something other than the aggregates.

original: 'dir rnam pa gzhan du smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba kho nar 'dus te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa gzhan du smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid du smra ba kho nar 'dus te /
translated: Whatever is said in other ways is included in the assertion that it is either the same or different.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But neither is tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te phung po rnams nyid bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: First, if the aggregates themselves were the self,

original: de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aggregates have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: de la bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la bdag mang po nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, it follows that there would be many selves.

original: bdag tu smra ba don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba don med pa nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: And the doctrine of the self would be pointless,

original: bdag ces bya ba ni phung po'i rnam grangs tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de lta bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni phung po'i rnam grangs tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro // de lta bas na re zhig phung po rnams nyid bdag yin no //
translated: because the so-called self would be nothing more than a synonym for the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say, “The aggregates themselves are the self.”

original: ci ste yang phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste yang phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: But if the self were different from the aggregates,

original: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: The aggregates have the characteristics of arising and ceasing.

original: de bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the self would be different from the aggregates, it would not have the characteristics of arising and ceasing.

original: de lta bas na rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it would be permanent.

original: bdag rtag pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa yin na rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the self were permanent, all effort would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa ni 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa ni 'gyur ba la ci zhig byar yod /
translated: For what transformation could there be of a permanent thing?

original: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag yod par rtog pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the conception of the self would be pointless.

original: de la cung zad kyang 'jug @240b pa'am ;
analyzed: de la cung zad kyang 'jug @240b pa'am ;
translated: For, nothing at all would be engaged or

original: ldeg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldeg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: disengaged in relation to it.

original: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag phung po rnams las gzhan par yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the self is different from the aggregates.

original: de de ltar blo gros nges nas kyang so so yang dag par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar blo gros nges nas kyang so so yang dag par rtog par byed de /
translated: Having ascertained that in this way, he then correctly contemplates:

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the self does not exist,

original: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could “mine” exist?

original: brtags na gal te bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad na bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: brtags na gal te bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad na bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the self is not tenable in any way when analyzed, how could “mine” exist?

original: 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba'i gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ces bya ba'i gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya na /
translated: In this way, that which is called “self” is called “mine.”

original: bdag de yang med de de med na de'i 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag de yang med de de med na de'i 'di yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If the self does not exist, how could it be tenable to say, “This is mine”?

original: de lta bas na bdag gi yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gi yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, “mine” is also not tenable.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang la bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba de ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang la bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba de ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
translated: One who does not view the internal and external as the self and “mine” sees reality.

original: de de sgom par byed cing brtan par byed do //
analyzed: de de sgom par byed cing brtan par byed do //
translated: He cultivates and makes much of that.

original: de sgom par byed cing brtan par byed pa de'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de sgom par byed cing brtan par byed pa de'i bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur bas /
translated: When he cultivates and makes much of that, his attachment to “I” and “mine” is calmed.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: Because “I” and “mine” are calmed,

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
translated: there is no more grasping “I” and “mine.”

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because attachment to “I” and “mine” is calmed, there is no more grasping “I” and “mine.”

original: smras pa / gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: But if one sees things as they really are, then grasping “I” and grasping “mine” will not occur.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid bdag yin pas de yod pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi yang nges pa kho nar yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bdag yin pas de yod pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gi yang nges pa kho nar yod pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the self, because it exists, “I” and “mine” definitely exist.🔽In response, Aryadeva says:

original: bshad pa / ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: bshad pa / ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
translated: That which is free from grasping “I” and “mine”

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: does not exist.

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
translated: Without grasping at “I” and “mine,”🔽

original: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
translated: One who sees without grasping “I” and “mine” does not see.

original: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang // nga yir 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang // nga yir 'dzin pa med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, “one who does not grasp ‘I’ and ‘mine’” does not exist.

original: de ni nye bar len pa la brten nas gdags pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar len pa la brten nas gdags pa yin par ston te /
translated: This is taught in order to show that it is imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe dang ldan pa 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar len pa ma gtogs par gang zag gi ming dang rus dag med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe dang ldan pa 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar len pa ma gtogs par gang zag gi ming dang rus dag med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One also said, “The name and clan of the venerable one are such and such,” but apart from the appropriated aggregates, there is no name and clan of the person.

original: de lta bas na nye bar len pa'i dbang kho nas brjod par zad kyi /🔽gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir @241a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar len pa'i dbang kho nas brjod par zad kyi / gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir @241a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said only in terms of the power of the appropriated aggregates.

original: 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba gzhan de ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ba gzhan de ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But apart from that, there is no other person who does not grasp “I” and “mine.”

original: ci ste yod na ni de yod na ji ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste yod na ni de yod na ji ltar ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur /
translated: If it does exist, then how could there be no grasping of “I” and no grasping of “mine”?

original: ci ste de dag yod kyang 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i de dag log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur gyi de kho na mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de dag yod kyang 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i de dag log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur gyi de kho na mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: If they exist, then in that case, that person would have only a wrong view, and would not see reality.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
translated: If there is something called “self,”

original: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
translated: it is not correct to say “selfless.”

original: yang na de nyid rtogs pa 'am //
analyzed: yang na de nyid rtogs pa 'am //
translated: Or, if that is realized,

original: mya ngan 'da' ba des brdzun 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' ba des brdzun 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: then nirvāṇa would be a lie.

original: de lta bas na ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par gang gis mthong ba log par lta ba blo gros kyi mig nyams pa des ni de kho na mi mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par gang gis mthong ba log par lta ba blo gros kyi mig nyams pa des ni de kho na mi mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, one who sees without grasping “I” and grasping “mine,” whose eye of intelligence is impaired by wrong views, does not see reality.🔽When “self” and “mine” are extinguished

original: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //🔽bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
