analyzed: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la // bdag dang bdag gi zad gyur na //
translated: in regard to inner and outer,

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: appropriation ceases,

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
translated: and through its extinction, birth is extinguished.

original: de nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na nye bar len par byed pa gang yin pa de med cing nye bar blang bar bya ba gang yin pa de yang med pas /
analyzed: de nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag la log par 'dzin pa zad par gyur na nye bar len par byed pa gang yin pa de med cing nye bar blang bar bya ba gang yin pa de yang med pas /
translated: When the conception of “I” and “mine” in regard to the internal and external ceases, then that which appropriates ceases, and that which is appropriated ceases.

original: nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi yang 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi yang 'gag par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, the four appropriations cease.

original: nye bar len pa 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags pas skye ba zad par 'gyur ba de ni thar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags pas skye ba zad par 'gyur ba de ni thar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When appropriation ceases, craving ceases. When existence ceases, birth ceases. That is called liberation.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba des de kho na rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba des de kho na rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, one who sees reality as it is realizes reality.

original: de kho na rtogs pas thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na rtogs pas thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By realizing reality, one is liberated.

original: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Liberation is through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from mental proliferation. Mental proliferation

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: ceases through emptiness.

original: 'di la las dang nyon mongs bdag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la las dang nyon mongs bdag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa zad pas thar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since karma and the afflictions are the cause of birth, liberation is said to come about through the exhaustion of karma and the afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, karma and the afflictions arise from unreal mental fabrication and not from any intrinsic nature.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: The afflictions arise from improper mental fabrication.

original: ji ltar yul gcig kho na la yang la la ni chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yul gcig kho na la yang la la ni chags par 'gyur /
translated: For example, with regard to a single object, some people feel desire for it,

original: la la ni sdang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: la la ni sdang bar 'gyur /
translated: some feel aversion toward it,

original: la la ni @241b rmongs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: la la ni @241b rmongs par 'gyur bas /
translated: and some feel confusion about it.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par rtog pa las byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the afflictions arise from mental fabrication.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa dag ni las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mngon par 'du byed pa dag ni las zhes bya ste /
translated: The volitions of body, speech, and mind that are associated with an afflicted mind are called “karma.”

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag mi rigs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bsod nams las byung ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba dag kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang zag mi rigs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bsod nams las byung ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba dag kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: “The person who is not reasonable is one who accumulates the formations that arise from merit.

original: zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher bka' stsal to //
translated: Thus it is stated extensively.🔽🔽

original: de lta bas na las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus karma and the afflictions arise from the cause of unreal imagination.

original: de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni spros pa las byung ba yin te 'jig rten pa'i spros pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag ni spros pa las byung ba yin te 'jig rten pa'i spros pa las byung ngo //
translated: That unreal imagination arises from mental proliferation, which is to say, it arises from worldly mental proliferation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i blo can dag de dang de la rnam par rtog par byed pas de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dag ni spros pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i blo can dag de dang de la rnam par rtog par byed pas de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dag ni spros pa las byung ngo //
translated: The mind of those who are attached to the thought that the phenomena of worldly gain, loss, etc. are real, proliferates in various ways. Therefore, mental proliferation is the cause of unreal imagination.

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Mental proliferation ceases through emptiness.

original: de'i rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The worldly elaborations of gain and loss and so on are stopped by emptiness.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs par 'gags te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du rtogs par 'gags te /
translated: The essence of things is stopped by emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs nas 'gag go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs nas 'gag go //
translated: Having realized emptiness, they are stopped.

original: de lta bas na stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin la stong pa nyid bsgoms pa kho nas ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na stong pa nyid ni de kho na yin la stong pa nyid bsgoms pa kho nas ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, emptiness is reality, and by meditating on emptiness alone, reality is realized.

original: de kho na rtogs pa nyid ni thar ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na rtogs pa nyid ni thar ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The realization of reality itself is called liberation.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
analyzed: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
translated: In brief, Dharma is nonviolence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
translated: Nirvāṇa is emptiness.

original: 'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
analyzed: 'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
translated: Here, only these two

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: are taught by the Tathāgatas.

original: smras pa / gal te de ltar bdag dang bdag gi med na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de dang der bdag bstan pa mdzad /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de ltar bdag dang bdag gi med na ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de dang der bdag bstan pa mdzad /
translated: Objection: If the self and being mine do not exist, how did the Buddha, the Bhagavat, teach about the self in various ways?

original: bshad pa / bdag med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / bdag med pa kho na'o //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds:

original: zhes bya ba de yang mi smra ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that it is only nonself.

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later he says:

original: de ltar len las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar len las gzhan ma yin //
translated: Thus it is not different from appropriation.

original: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min //🔽bdag ni nye bar len med min //🔽med pa nyid du 'ang de ma nges //
analyzed: de ni nyer len nyid kyang min // bdag ni nye bar len med min // med pa nyid du 'ang de ma nges //
translated: It is also not the appropriated itself.🔽The self does not exist without appropriation.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //🔽'on kyang sangs @242a * //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // 'on kyang sangs @242a * //
translated: But it is not ascertained to be nonexistent.

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis gdul bya rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir /🔽bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis gdul bya rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir / bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
translated: Nevertheless, the buddhas, the bhagavats, who are skilled in knowing the thoughts and dispositions of sentient beings, have taught:🔽The self is imputed,

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur //
translated: and selflessness is also taught.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The buddhas have taught that the self

original: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //🔽de la gdul bya gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan // de la gdul bya gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: is neither existent nor nonexistent.🔽With regard to that, for those disciples who are attached to the existence of the world, the buddhas have taught, “This world exists.”

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: For those disciples who are attached to the nonexistence of the world, the buddhas have taught, “This world does not exist.”

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa /
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa /
translated: “There is no sentient being that is born supernaturally.”

original: log par 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas sems rmongs pa /
analyzed: log par 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas sems rmongs pa /
translated: They are confused in their minds because they are attached to wrong views.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la mi ltos pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la mi ltos pa /
translated: They do not consider the next world.

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul las 'da' bas mi 'dzem pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul las 'da' bas mi 'dzem pa /
translated: They are not ashamed to transgress the norms of the world.🔽They are headed for the great abyss of the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i g-yang sa chen po la mngon par phyogs pa de dag gi bdag med par lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag go zhes kyang btags so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i g-yang sa chen po la mngon par phyogs pa de dag gi bdag med par lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag go zhes kyang btags so //
translated: In order to turn them away from the view of selflessness, we say “self.”

original: gdul bya gang dag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi byed pa po dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag za ba gang yin pa dang / gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa dag ston par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ba de ni 'ga' zhig yod do //
analyzed: gdul bya gang dag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi byed pa po dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag za ba gang yin pa dang / gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa dag ston par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ba de ni 'ga' zhig yod do //
translated: There are disciples who believe that there is a self that is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, that experiences their desirable and undesirable results, and that is bound and liberated.

original: gzhan du na bdag med na de dag thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag med na de dag thams cad don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa /
translated: Otherwise, if there were no self, all of that would be pointless.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por ltung ba /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por ltung ba /
translated: They have fallen into the great ocean of cyclic existence.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khris zin pa /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khris zin pa /
translated: They are seized by the crocodile of the view of the transitory collection, which is the grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: lta ba'i chu bos sems g-yengs pa /🔽srid pa'i bde ba la chags pa de dag gi bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag med do //
analyzed: lta ba'i chu bos sems g-yengs pa / srid pa'i bde ba la chags pa de dag gi bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag med do //
translated: Their minds are disturbed by the river of views.🔽They are attached to the pleasures of existence.

original: zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: In order to stop their view of self, the Buddha taught, “There is no self.”

original: gdul ba bzang po gang dag dge ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: gdul ba bzang po gang dag dge ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa /
translated: Those who are good disciples, whose accumulations of virtue are ripe,

original: srid pa'i chu bo las brgal bar nus pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo las brgal bar nus pa /
translated: who are able to cross the river of existence,

original: don dam pa'i gtam gyi snod du gyur pa de dag la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i gtam gyi snod du gyur pa de dag la /
translated: who are vessels for the teachings of ultimate reality,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don dam pa'i de kho na ston pa rnam par 'dren pa chen po rnams kyis sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das don dam pa'i de kho na ston pa rnam par 'dren pa chen po rnams kyis sgyu ma 'di ni byis pa 'drid pa ste /
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One, the great guide who teaches ultimate reality, taught them, “This illusion deceives the childish.

original: 'di la bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no self or non-self at all in this.”

original: zhes ston te /
analyzed: zhes ston te /
translated: This is taught.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Master Āryadeva also says:

original: med dang yod dang gnyi ga @242b dang // gnyi ga min pa'ang ston mdzad de //🔽nad kyi dbang gis nges par ni //
analyzed: med dang yod dang gnyi ga @242b dang // gnyi ga min pa'ang ston mdzad de // nad kyi dbang gis nges par ni //
translated: He taught nonexistence, existence, both, and also neither.🔽Just as medicine is prescribed

original: sman ni 'phrod par 'gyur ba bzhin //
analyzed: sman ni 'phrod par 'gyur ba bzhin //
translated: in accordance with the illness,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: so is the teaching.

original: yang na 'di ni gzhan te de kho na mthong ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni gzhan te de kho na mthong ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: Or, this is another: those who turn their back on seeing reality,

original: thams cad shes pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ma yin par thams cad mkhyen par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can /
translated: who are not omniscient but have the pride of being so,

original: rang gi rtog ge'i rjes su 'brang ba bdag med na 'di dag thams cad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang gi rtog ge'i rjes su 'brang ba bdag med na 'di dag thams cad mi 'thad do //
translated: who follow their own sophistry, are afraid that if there is no self, all this is not tenable.

original: zhes skrag pa kha cig gis bdag go zhes kyang btags so //
analyzed: zhes skrag pa kha cig gis bdag go zhes kyang btags so //
translated: Some imagine that there is a self.

original: de bzhin du blo gros rnam par rmongs pa med pa dag gis 'jig rten na phung por byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo gros rnam par rmongs pa med pa dag gis 'jig rten na phung por byed pa /
translated: In the same way, those who are not confused think that in the world, the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: las dang 'gro ba lkog tu gyur pa gzhan dag gis bdag med do zhes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: las dang 'gro ba lkog tu gyur pa gzhan dag gis bdag med do zhes kyang bstan to //
translated: Others, who are hidden by karma and rebirth, teach that there is no self.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa rnams kyis ni /🔽'gro ba la phan gdags par bzhed pas de gnyi ga yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa rnams kyis ni / 'gro ba la phan gdags par bzhed pas de gnyi ga yang med do //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas, who have attained the knowledge of unobstructed liberation, who are omniscient and all-seeing,

original: zhes nges par gsal te /
analyzed: zhes nges par gsal te /
translated: have clearly taught that both of these do not exist, because they wish to benefit migrating beings.

original: dbu ma'i lam bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin pa 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam bdag dang bdag med pa ma yin pa 'di yod pas 'di 'byung la /
translated: Thus, he has taught that “this arises due to the existence of this middle way that is neither a self nor selflessness.

original: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di med na 'di mi 'byung ngo // zhes bya ba nyid bstan to //
translated: If this does not exist, that does not arise.”

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: zhes gang smras pa de la rigs pa gang yin /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la rigs pa gang yin /
translated: “You said, ‘Elaboration ceases due to emptiness.’ What is the logic here?”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, the reply is this:

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste /
translated: The object of expression is stopped.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong par mthong na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong par mthong na /
translated: Because when things are seen to be empty,

original: brjod par bya ba nyid ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid ldog par 'gyur ba de'i phyir spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: the object of expression is stopped, therefore elaboration ceases due to emptiness.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba yod na de la brten nas spros pa yod par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba yod na de la brten nas spros pa yod par 'gyur gyi //
translated: Thus, if there were something to be expressed, then on the basis of that, conceptual elaboration would exist.

original: brjod par bya ba med na gzhi med pa'i spros pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba med na gzhi med pa'i spros pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: But if there is nothing to be expressed, how could conceptual elaboration exist without a basis?

original: smras pa / de'i brjod par bya ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / de'i brjod par bya ba ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Objection: How could its expression be stopped?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: By stopping the mind’s objects.

original: sems kyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
analyzed: sems kyi yul ni gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams te /
translated: The objects of the mind are forms and so on.

original: gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag log par gyur pa de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag log par gyur pa de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the mind’s objects, such as forms, are stopped, therefore expression is stopped.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag yin na de lta na ni ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dag yin na de lta na ni ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: For if the objects of expression are forms and so on, then what is there to express?

original: smras pa / @243a * //
analyzed: smras pa / @243a * //
translated: Objection:

original: de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: How could the mind’s objects, such as forms, be stopped?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: The nature of reality is like nirvāṇa.

original: gang gi phyir des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pa de'i phyir de'i sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he sees reality just as it is, he knows that the reality of phenomena, which is unborn and unceasing, is the same as nirvana. Therefore, the domain of his mind is reversed.

original: de lta bas na spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, conceptual elaboration is stopped by emptiness.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence.

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul lo //
translated: Objects are its domain.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the selflessness of objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The seed of existence is stopped.

original: smras pa / gang 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: smras pa / gang 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: Objection: What is the difference between the view that this world does not exist,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //🔽sems can rdzus te skye ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do // sems can rdzus te skye ba med do //
translated: that the next world does not exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba de dang / gang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya bar lta ba de gnyis la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs par lta ba de dang / gang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya bar lta ba de gnyis la khyad par ci yod /
translated: that there are no sentient beings born supernaturally, and so on, and the view that all things are unarisen and unceasing?

original: bshad pa / de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che na /
analyzed: bshad pa / de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che na /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: There is a great difference between those two.

original: khyod ni stong pa nyid kyi don rnam par mi shes nas de gnyis 'dra'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: khyod ni stong pa nyid kyi don rnam par mi shes nas de gnyis 'dra'o snyam du sems so //
translated: You think those two are similar, but you do not understand the meaning of emptiness.

original: 'di la so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa dang / so sor brtags nas btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa de gnyis btang snyoms byed par ni 'dra mod kyi so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa ni ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan par bstan la /
analyzed: 'di la so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa dang / so sor brtags nas btang snyoms byed pa gang yin pa de gnyis btang snyoms byed par ni 'dra mod kyi so sor ma brtags par btang snyoms byed pa ni ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang ldan par bstan la /
translated: In this regard, there is indeed a similarity between the equanimity that is not investigated and the equanimity that is investigated, for both are equanimity. However, the equanimity that is not investigated is taught to be associated with the fetter of ignorance.

original: btang snyoms byed pa cig shos ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kun tu bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: btang snyoms byed pa cig shos ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kun tu bstan pa yin pas /
translated: The other kind of equanimity is taught by the transcendent buddhas.

original: de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che ba de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, there is a great difference between those two.

original: 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar mthong ba ni ma rig pas kun tu rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar mthong ba ni ma rig pas kun tu rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the thought “This world does not exist” and so on is a thought that is confused by ignorance.

original: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ba cig shos ni shes pa sngon du btang ba yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mthong ba cig shos ni shes pa sngon du btang ba yin pas /
translated: Because all things are empty of intrinsic reality, one sees that they are not produced and do not cease. The other is preceded by knowledge.

original: de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la khyad par shin tu che'o //
translated: There is a great difference between these two.

original: gzhan yang med pa de nyid ma mthong ba bzhin du 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa de nyid ma mthong ba bzhin du 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: Moreover, just as one does not see that which does not exist, so too this world does not exist.

original: @243b zhes tshig 'ba' zhig brjod pa de la ni /
analyzed: @243b zhes tshig 'ba' zhig brjod pa de la ni /
translated: One who merely utters the words,🔽“This world does not exist,”

original: dper na dmus long phyogs 'di la bde'o //
analyzed: dper na dmus long phyogs 'di la bde'o //
translated: is like a blind person who says, “I am happy in this direction,”🔽but does not see because he does not have eyes. He will be confused and will be harmed.

original: zhes brjod kyang mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas der 'khrul pa dang / brdeg 'cha' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes brjod kyang mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas der 'khrul pa dang / brdeg 'cha' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: de yang 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: one who says, “This world does not exist,”

original: zhes brjod kyang shes pa'i mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas /
analyzed: zhes brjod kyang shes pa'i mig med pa'i phyir mi mthong bas /
translated: but does not see because he does not have the eyes of knowledge,

original: skyon de dag gis gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon de dag gis gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be tainted by those faults.

original: gzhan yang dper na kha cig rtsod pa na don bden par 'gyur ba kho na la che bzhi gnyis ston par gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na kha cig rtsod pa na don bden par 'gyur ba kho na la che bzhi gnyis ston par gyur la /
translated: Moreover, it is like when someone in a dispute shows two horns to someone who has a true point.

original: de na gcig ni don de mngon sum du mthong ba yin la gnyis pa ni don de mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa ma yin zhing nor ngo'am mdza' ngos gnyer ba zhig yin te /
analyzed: de na gcig ni don de mngon sum du mthong ba yin la gnyis pa ni don de mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa ma yin zhing nor ngo'am mdza' ngos gnyer ba zhig yin te /
translated: One of them directly perceives the object, while the other does not directly perceive the object, but is seeking wealth or a friend.

original: de gnyi ga yang don de la smrar bcug pa na /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang don de la smrar bcug pa na /
translated: When both of them are asked about the object,

original: de la gcig gis don de ji ltar bden pa de ltar smras su zin kyang don de mngon sum du yang ma gyur pa'i phyir brdzun du yang 'gyur la chos ma yin pa dang mi snyan pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gcig gis don de ji ltar bden pa de ltar smras su zin kyang don de mngon sum du yang ma gyur pa'i phyir brdzun du yang 'gyur la chos ma yin pa dang mi snyan pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: even though one of them speaks about the object as it truly is, because he does not directly perceive the object, he is a liar and is not endowed with Dharma and what is pleasant.

original: cig shos kyis ni don de smras pa na don de mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir bden par smra ba yang yin la chos dang snyan pa dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni don de smras pa na don de mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir bden par smra ba yang yin la chos dang snyan pa dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: But when the other speaks about the object, because he directly perceives the object, he is a speaker of the truth and is endowed with Dharma and what is pleasant.

original: dngos po thams cad stong pa yin zhing stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa de yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong pa yin zhing stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa de yin du zin kyang /
translated: In the same way, although all things are empty and because of being empty are unarisen and unceasing,

original: de gang la mngon sum gyi shes pa yod pa de nyid legs pa dang ldan cing bsngags pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de gang la mngon sum gyi shes pa yod pa de nyid legs pa dang ldan cing bsngags pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the one who has direct knowledge of that is good and praiseworthy.

original: cig shos ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir lta ba'i skyon gyis kyang go sa la mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par yang 'gyur bas /
analyzed: cig shos ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir lta ba'i skyon gyis kyang go sa la mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par yang 'gyur bas /
translated: The other, because of not having direct knowledge of emptiness, is also criticized by the wise for having the fault of view.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni khyad par shin tu che ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni khyad par shin tu che ste /
translated: Therefore, there is a great difference between the two.

original: slob dpon sgra gcan zin bzang pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon sgra gcan zin bzang pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in his Praise of the Perfection of Wisdom, Master Rāhulabhadra says:

original: khyod nyid mthong na 'ching 'gyur te //
analyzed: khyod nyid mthong na 'ching 'gyur te //
translated: If you are seen, you are bound;

original: ma mthong na yang 'ching bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma mthong na yang 'ching bar 'gyur //
translated: If you are not seen, you are bound.

original: khyod nyid mthong na grol 'gyur te //🔽ma mthong na yang grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod nyid mthong na grol 'gyur te // ma mthong na yang grol bar 'gyur //
translated: If you are seen, you are liberated;

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you are not seen, you are liberated.

original: de lta na 'di ni de kho na nyid shes pa'i blo gros kyi mig dri ma med pa dang ldan pa'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'di ni de kho na nyid shes pa'i blo gros kyi mig dri ma med pa dang ldan pa'i yul yin gyi /
translated: Thus this is the domain of the stainless eye of intelligence that knows suchness.

original: 'di ma rig pa'i mun pa chen pos blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa dang ldan pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ma rig pa'i mun pa chen pos blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa dang ldan pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the domain of those whose eyes of intelligence are obscured by the great darkness of ignorance.

original: gzhan yang khyod mkhas par rlom pa nyid @244a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod mkhas par rlom pa nyid @244a * //
translated: Moreover, you who are conceited with the thought that you are learned

original: kyi blo sngon du btang ste lta ba sems par mtshungs shing kho bo la rgol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: kyi blo sngon du btang ste lta ba sems par mtshungs shing kho bo la rgol bar byed kyi /
translated: have a biased view and are biased in your thinking, and you argue with us,🔽but you do not do so with those who propound existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni mi byed pa de la yang khyad par yod par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni mi byed pa de la yang khyad par yod par bshad par bya ste /
translated: We will now explain the difference between you and us.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod pa ni lta ba'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod pa ni lta ba'i dbang gis te /
translated: The expression “existence” and “nonexistence” is due to the power of view.🔽We see that things are like the horns of a rabbit—they do not exist.

original: kho bo ni dngos po rnams ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid du mthong la tshig gi skyon rnams yongs su spang ba'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang ma yin la med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes mi smra'i /
analyzed: kho bo ni dngos po rnams ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid du mthong la tshig gi skyon rnams yongs su spang ba'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang ma yin la med pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say “They are not nonexistent and they are not existent” in order to avoid the error of verbal expression.

original: 'di ltar de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid dag gzugs brnyan dag bzhin du mthong ba de ltar smra bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid dag gzugs brnyan dag bzhin du mthong ba de ltar smra bas /
translated: Thus, because they are dependently arisen, they are seen to be both existent and nonexistent, like a reflection.

original: khyod ni nor bu do zan aan da rnyil gyi rin thang du 'tshong ba na /
analyzed: khyod ni nor bu do zan aan da rnyil gyi rin thang du 'tshong ba na /
translated: You, however, are like a person who sells a priceless sapphire for the price of a glass trinket.

original: yid la bsams pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mtho ba la rang gi blo yang bar yang bstan pa bzhin du gyur to //
analyzed: yid la bsams pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mtho ba la rang gi blo yang bar yang bstan pa bzhin du gyur to //
translated: You have taught that the result is not in accordance with your thoughts, and your own mind is also low.

original: smras pa / gal te de ltar dngos po thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa yin na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de ltar dngos po thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa yin na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir rtsom pa thams cad don med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Objection: If all things are the same as nirvana, then since there would be no difference between Dharma and non-Dharma, would not all endeavor be pointless?

original: bshad pa / ci khyod yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la yang rtsom pa yod par lta 'am /
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la yang rtsom pa yod par lta 'am /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Do you think that there is endeavor even in seeing things as they really are?

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: When

original: sngar brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
analyzed: sngar brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste //
translated: The object of refutation is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Because the domain of mind is stopped.

original: zhes bstan zin pas /
analyzed: zhes bstan zin pas /
translated: This has been explained.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa la rtsom pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa la rtsom pa yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, for one who has a mind that is confused, there is activity.

original: de kho na mthong ba la ni bya ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba la ni bya ba ci yang med do //
translated: But for one who sees reality, there is no activity whatsoever.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du bya ba byas so //
analyzed: ji skad du bya ba byas so //
translated: “The task is done,🔽there is no more for this world.”🔽And similarly:

original: 'di las gzhan med do zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gang zag ma rig pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bsod nams las byung ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba dag kyang mngon par 'du byed do //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan med do zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gang zag ma rig pa dang ldan pa 'di ni bsod nams las byung ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba dag kyang mngon par 'du byed do // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “This person, who is endowed with ignorance, engages in activity that arises from merit.🔽”

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: The master Āryadeva also says:

original: kun med ci zhig byar yod ces //
analyzed: kun med ci zhig byar yod ces //
translated: “If all do not exist, what is there to do?

original: khyod ni 'jigs pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod ni 'jigs pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: You will be born in fear.

original: gal te bya ba yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te bya ba yod na ni //
translated: If there is activity,

original: chos 'di ldog pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'di ldog pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: this Dharma will not stop.”

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: “Reality is like nirvāṇa.”

original: zhes pa 'di ni don dam pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ni don dam pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the ultimate perspective.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi phyir /
translated: For the sake of worldly convention,🔽the Lord has said that things are both real and unreal,

original: thams cad yang dag yang dag min @244b yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag yang dag min @244b yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: and also neither real nor unreal.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang 'jig rten la yod par grags pa de nga yang yod par smra'o //🔽gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa de nga yang med par smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang 'jig rten la yod par grags pa de nga yang yod par smra'o // gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa de nga yang med par smra'o //
translated: Thus, the Lord has said, “Whatever exists in the world as real, I also say exists.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Whatever does not exist in the world as real, I also say does not exist.”

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bya ba de'i tshe na gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe 'jig rten gyi tha snyad bya ba de'i tshe na gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa /
translated: Therefore, when one is engaged in worldly convention, whatever is known in the world as real,

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the Lord has said is real.

original: gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid ma yin par grags pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is known in the world as unreal, the Lord has said is unreal.

original: gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du grags pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid du grags pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Whatever is known in the world as real or unreal, the Lord has also said is real or unreal.🔽

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One also said that what is known in the world as real or unreal is real or unreal.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: grong mi gnyis zhig bya ba 'ga' zhig la grong khyer du dong ba na ltad mo'i phyir lha khang du zhugs nas ri mo lta bar brtsams pa dang de na gcig gis smras pa /
analyzed: grong mi gnyis zhig bya ba 'ga' zhig la grong khyer du dong ba na ltad mo'i phyir lha khang du zhugs nas ri mo lta bar brtsams pa dang de na gcig gis smras pa /
translated: two country people went to the city on some business. In order to see the sights, they entered a temple and began looking at the paintings. One of them said,

original: lag na mdung rtse gsum pa thogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni sred med kyi bu'o //
analyzed: lag na mdung rtse gsum pa thogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni sred med kyi bu'o //
translated: “The one holding a trident is Nārāyaṇa.”

original: lag na 'khor lo thogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: lag na 'khor lo thogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: “The one holding a discus is Maheśvara.”

original: cig shos kyis smras pa khyod kyis log par bzung ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa khyod kyis log par bzung ste /
translated: The other said, “You have it backwards.

original: lag na mdung rtse gsum pa thogs pa ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: lag na mdung rtse gsum pa thogs pa ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: The one holding a trident is Maheśvara.

original: lag na 'khor lo thogs pa ni sred med kyi bu'o //
analyzed: lag na 'khor lo thogs pa ni sred med kyi bu'o //
translated: The one holding a discus is Nārāyaṇa.”

original: zhes de gnyis rtsod pa na nye 'khor na kun tu rgyu zhig 'dug pa'i gan du dong ste phyag 'tshal nas de la rang rang gi bsam pa smras pa dang / des gcig la ni khyod zer ba bden no //
analyzed: zhes de gnyis rtsod pa na nye 'khor na kun tu rgyu zhig 'dug pa'i gan du dong ste phyag 'tshal nas de la rang rang gi bsam pa smras pa dang / des gcig la ni khyod zer ba bden no //
translated: He said to one, “What you say is true.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / cig shos la ni mi bden no //
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / cig shos la ni mi bden no //
translated: And to the other, “What you say is not true.”

original: zhes gang smras na /
analyzed: zhes gang smras na /
translated: How did he say that?

original: de la kun tu rgyu des ji ltar 'di na dbang phyug chen po yang 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: de la kun tu rgyu des ji ltar 'di na dbang phyug chen po yang 'ga' yang med la /
translated: The wandering mendicant thought, “Here there is no Maheśvara at all,

original: sred med kyi bu yang med de /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu yang med de /
translated: and there is no Nārāyaṇa.

original: 'di dag ni rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo bris pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rtsig pa la brten pa'i ri mo bris pa'o //
translated: These are just pictures painted on a wall.”

original: zhes bya ba de ltar shes mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar shes mod kyi /
translated: He knew that to be the case.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni mi bden no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni mi bden no //
translated: But he said, “In terms of worldly convention, this is not true.

original: 'di ni mi bden no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bden no //
translated: This is not true.”🔽In saying that, he did not incur the fault of speaking falsely.

original: zhes smras pa la brdzun gyi tshig gi skyon can du ma gyur pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong par gzigs kyang /
analyzed: zhes smras pa la brdzun gyi tshig gi skyon can du ma gyur pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong par gzigs kyang /
translated: In the same way, the Bhagavān sees that things are empty of essence,

original: @245a * // 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: @245a * // 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis 'di ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: By the power of worldly convention, it is said: This is real.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This is not real.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid dang // yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa nyid dang // yang dag pa nyid ma yin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is real and not real.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: But in the ultimate sense,

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: it is neither real nor not real.

original: de ni sangs rgyas rjes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rjes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag cha lta bu dag la ji ltar yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag cha lta bu dag la ji ltar yang dag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa nyid ma yin par brjod do //
translated: How can things that are empty of intrinsic reality, like illusions, dreams, mirages, reflections, and echoes, be said to be real or not real?

original: de'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa yod pa dang / med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa yod pa dang / med pa nyid kyi skyon dang bral ba ;
translated: Therefore, this is the teaching of the Blessed Buddhas, free from the faults of existence and nonexistence,

original: mu stegs byed thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa don dam pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa don dam pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and it illuminates the ultimate truth, which is not shared in common with the tīrthikas.

original: yang na 'di ni don gzhan te kha cig na re thams cad yod pa nyid las skye'o //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni don gzhan te kha cig na re thams cad yod pa nyid las skye'o // zhes zer ro //
translated: Or else, this is another interpretation: some say that things are produced from existence alone.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa dag las skye'o //🔽zhes zer ro //🔽kha cig na re yod pa dang med pa las skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu la 'bras bu snga na med pa dag las skye'o // zhes zer ro // kha cig na re yod pa dang med pa las skye'o //
translated: Others say that things are produced from a cause that does not exist previously.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that things are produced from both existence and nonexistence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa ni dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las gdags par zad kyi yod pa dang med pa ni ma yin no //🔽de ltar yang k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bstan pa ni dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las gdags par zad kyi yod pa dang med pa ni ma yin no // de ltar yang k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
translated: But the doctrine of the Blessed Buddhas is that things are designated in dependence on causes and conditions, and not in dependence on existence or nonexistence.

original: phal cher yod pa nyid la gnas pa dang / med pa nyid la gnas so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phal cher yod pa nyid la gnas pa dang / med pa nyid la gnas so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Kātyāyanāvavāda Sūtra says, “This world is based on duality, for the most part adhering to existence and nonexistence.”

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis kyang de dang de dag gsungs pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis kyang de dang de dag gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed Buddhas have said that things are produced in dependence on causes and conditions, in conformity with worldly convention.

original: de'i phyir de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs pa dag la mngon par ma zhen par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs pa dag la mngon par ma zhen par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, those who wish to see reality should not cling to the statements made by the power of worldly convention.

original: de kho na gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na gang yin pa de nyid gzung bar bya'o //
translated: That which is reality should be grasped.

original: smras pa / de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang yin /🔽bshad pa / gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: smras pa / de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang yin / bshad pa / gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: Objection: What is the definition of reality?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:🔽Not known from elsewhere, peaceful,🔽not fabricated by mental fabrication,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: nonconceptual, not differentiated,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: that is the definition of reality.

original: gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not known from elsewhere.

original: 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste /🔽lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste / lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is not known from elsewhere.🔽It is not known from scripture, but it is known by oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “one’s own perception.”

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Peaceful means empty of essence.

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: Not fabricated by mental fabrication.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi @245b chos rnams dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi @245b chos rnams dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “free from worldly dharmas. ”

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes bya ba dang 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di zhes bya ba dang 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
translated: “Non-conceptual” means not conceptualizing “this” and “that. ”

original: don tha dad pa ma yin /🔽zhes bya ba ni 'di yang yin la /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin / zhes bya ba ni 'di yang yin la /
translated: “Not a different meaning”🔽means “this is it”

original: 'di yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang yin no //
translated: and “that is it. ”

original: zhes don dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes don dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The meaning is indivisible.

original: de la gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
translated: In this regard, because it is non-conceptual, it is not elaborated by elaborations.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: Because it is not elaborated by worldly dharmas, it is peace.

original: gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir don tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir don tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because it is peace, it is not a different meaning.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rang bzhin shes pa rang rig pa gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i rang bzhin shes pa rang rig pa gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the characteristic of reality is that self-awareness, which has such a nature, is not known from another.

original: 'di yang de kho na'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang de kho na'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another characteristic of reality.

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: is not that,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: and it is not different.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, whatever arises in dependence on something is not that.

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te /🔽gal te de de las gzhan yin par gyur na de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te / gal te de de las gzhan yin par gyur na de med par yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: mi 'byung bas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'byung bas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: If it were different from that, it would be reasonable that it would arise even if that did not exist, but it does not arise. Therefore, it is not different from that.

original: dper na sa bon la brten te myu gu byung ba ni sa bon gang kho na yin pa de myu gu kho na ma yin la sa bon las gzhan pa myu gu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa bzhin
analyzed: dper na sa bon la brten te myu gu byung ba ni sa bon gang kho na yin pa de myu gu kho na ma yin la sa bon las gzhan pa myu gu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir sa bon las myu gu gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa bzhin
translated: For example, a sprout that arises in dependence on a seed is not the seed itself, and the sprout is not different from the seed because the sprout does not exist apart from the seed.

original: te / de ltar gang gi phyir gang la brten te gang byung ba de de nyid kyang ma yin la de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa de'i phyir chad pa yang ma yin la rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: te / de ltar gang gi phyir gang la brten te gang byung ba de de nyid kyang ma yin la de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin pa de'i phyir chad pa yang ma yin la rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because that which arises in dependence on something is neither identical to it nor different from it, therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'di ltar sa bon nyid myu gu yin par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon nyid myu gu yin par gyur na /
translated: If the seed itself were the sprout,

original: sa bon rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: the seed would be eternal.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon nyid myu gu ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon nyid myu gu ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the seed itself is not the sprout, therefore the seed is not eternal.

original: gal te sa bon yang gzhan nyid la myu gu yang gzhan yin par gyur na de lta na sa bon rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad pas chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa bon yang gzhan nyid la myu gu yang gzhan yin par gyur na de lta na sa bon rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad pas chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seed were one thing and the sprout were another, then the seed would be completely severed from the sprout, and thus annihilated.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon la myu gu gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon la myu gu gzhan ma yin pa de'i phyir sa bon chad pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the sprout is not another thing from the seed, therefore the seed is not annihilated.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things are engaged,

original: des na chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore they are not annihilated.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things are disengaged,

original: @246a * // des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @246a * // des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not eternal.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: since it is not to be expressed as identical or different,

original: rtag pa yang ma yin la chad pa yang ma yin pas de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin la chad pa yang ma yin pas de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: it is not eternal and not annihilated. Thus it is the characteristic of reality.

original: don gcig min don tha dad min //
analyzed: don gcig min don tha dad min //
translated: It is not one meaning, not different meanings,

original: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa //🔽de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa // de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
translated: not annihilated, not eternal.🔽That is the nectar taught

original: mgon pos bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
analyzed: mgon pos bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
translated: by the Buddha, the protector of the world.

original: de ltar mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rnam par 'byed pa don gcig pa nyid ma yin na don tha dad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de ltar mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rnam par 'byed pa don gcig pa nyid ma yin na don tha dad pa ma yin pa /
translated: Thus, the distinction of the path to heaven and liberation is not one meaning, not different meanings,

original: chad pa ma yin pa rtag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa rtag pa ma yin pa /
translated: not annihilated, not eternal.

original: gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang chad pa dang rtag pa'i skyon las phyi rol du gyur pa /
analyzed: gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang chad pa dang rtag pa'i skyon las phyi rol du gyur pa /
translated: It is beyond the faults of identity, difference, annihilation, and eternity.

original: mchog tu zab pa /
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa /
translated: It is supremely profound.

original: don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the light of ultimate reality, and it is the means for attaining the mundane and supramundane happiness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: That which illuminates the ultimate reality is the nectar taught by all the Bhagavat Buddhas, who are omniscient, all-seeing,

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the power of the ten powers,

original: rgyu med par byams pa rnams kyis bstan pa bdud rtsi yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med par byams pa rnams kyis bstan pa bdud rtsi yin te /
translated: and loving without any reason.

original: de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: That should be accomplished.

original: 'di ltar der zhugs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du gyur pa 'phral kho na la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar der zhugs pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du gyur pa 'phral kho na la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for those who have entered that, their own direct perception will be accomplished immediately.

original: gang dag tshogs ma byas pa nyid kyis 'phral la ma grub pa de dag la yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la nges par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag tshogs ma byas pa nyid kyis 'phral la ma grub pa de dag la yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la nges par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: For those who have not accomplished the accumulations, it will not be accomplished immediately, but it will definitely be accomplished in other lives.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: de nyid shes pas 'di la ni //
analyzed: de nyid shes pas 'di la ni //
translated: By knowing reality,

original: 'dod chags bral ba ma thob kyang //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ma thob kyang //
translated: even though one does not attain freedom from attachment in this life,

original: tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
translated: it will definitely be attained in other lives without effort,

original: nges par thob de las bzhin no //
analyzed: nges par thob de las bzhin no //
translated: just like the result of a deed.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: Even if the perfect Buddhas do not appear

original: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
translated: and the śrāvakas have disappeared,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: the wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas

original: bsten pa med las rab tu skye //🔽ci ste yang 'di la cung zad goms par byas pa rnams la brgyal rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
analyzed: bsten pa med las rab tu skye // ci ste yang 'di la cung zad goms par byas pa rnams la brgyal rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
translated: arises from conditions, even without a teacher.🔽Even if the perfect Buddhas do not appear and the śrāvakas have disappeared,

original: nyan thos rnams zad par gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams zad par gyur te /
translated: if they have some slight familiarity with this,

original: rkyen dang mi ldan par gyur du zin na yang /
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan par gyur du zin na yang /
translated: then even if they are not endowed with conditions,

original: de dag gi sngon goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa bsten pa med pa tsam gyis rkyen @246b las rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sngon goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa bsten pa med pa tsam gyis rkyen @246b las rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas arises from conditions, from the cause of their previous familiarity, without depending on another teacher.🔽Thus, since this nectar-like teaching is fruitful,

original: de'i de ltar bstan pa bdud rtsi 'di bsgrub pa la 'bras bu yod par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i de ltar bstan pa bdud rtsi 'di bsgrub pa la 'bras bu yod par 'gyur bas /
translated: those who are inclined should

original: de lta bas na yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa spong bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na yongs su rtog pa dang ldan pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa spong bar 'dod pa /
translated: abandon the wilderness of saṃsāra.

original: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di nyid 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di nyid 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Those who desire to attain the state of nectar should strive to accomplish this.

original: 'di kho na las don dam pa nges par 'grub po //
analyzed: 'di kho na las don dam pa nges par 'grub po //
translated: Only from this is the ultimate truth definitely accomplished.

original: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
analyzed: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'o / // / smras pa /
translated: This is the eighteenth chapter, called the Critique of Self and Phenomena.

original: 'di la khyod kyis byed pa po las brtag pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa de ga'i rigs pa rdzes su bstan pas kho bo'i yid kyis dag la dngos po yod pa dang med par lta ba'i shing brtan po chen po yun ring po nas rab tu gnas pa'i rtsa🔽ba yang legs par 'gul gyi /
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis byed pa po las brtag pa'i zhar la 'ongs pa de ga'i rigs pa rdzes su bstan pas kho bo'i yid kyis dag la dngos po yod pa dang med par lta ba'i shing brtan po chen po yun ring po nas rab tu gnas pa'i rtsa ba yang legs par 'gul gyi /
translated: Objection: In this regard, you have taught the reasoning of the critique of the agent and action as a digression. Therefore, the great, firm tree of the view that things exist or do not exist has been shaken well by the wind of your reasoning.

original: de'i phyir de yang kho bo la phan gdags par 'dod pas dus brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang kho bo la phan gdags par 'dod pas dus brtag par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since you desire to benefit me, it is fitting that you now teach the critique of time.

original: bshad pa legs so //
analyzed: bshad pa legs so //
translated: Response: Excellent!

original: smras pa / 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der dus gsum bstan pa mdzad de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der dus gsum bstan pa mdzad de /
translated: Objection: In this regard, the Bhagavān taught the three times in various contexts.

original: med na ni bstan par mi rigs pas dus gsum ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: med na ni bstan par mi rigs pas dus gsum ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it does not exist, it is illogical to teach it. Therefore the three times definitely exist.

original: bshad pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis dus gsum bstan pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis dus gsum bstan pa mdzad kyi /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The Bhagavān taught the three times in terms of the power of worldly convention.

original: de kho nar ni dus gsum mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de kho nar ni dus gsum mi 'thad do //
translated: In reality, the three times are untenable.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /🔽'di la re zhig gal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gyur nas rim gyis da ltar du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na / 'di la re zhig gal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gyur nas rim gyis da ltar du 'gyur zhing /
translated: How so?

original: da ltar du gyur nas kyang rim gyis 'das par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: da ltar du gyur nas kyang rim gyis 'das par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Here, if the future becomes the present and the present becomes the past,

original: de lta na dus gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na dus gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case the three times would be one.

original: dper na tsee tra grong du phyin na yang tsee tra nyid yin la grong nas thal na yang tsee tra nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na tsee tra grong du phyin na yang tsee tra nyid yin la grong nas thal na yang tsee tra nyid yin te /
translated: For example, if one goes to the town of Ceti, it is Ceti; if one leaves the town of Ceti, it is Ceti.

original: de la ma phyin pa dang / phyin pa dang thal ba gsum nyid du dbyer med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la ma phyin pa dang / phyin pa dang thal ba gsum nyid du dbyer med pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the three—not having gone, having gone, and the act of going—are undifferentiated.

original: ci ste yang ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan nyid la da ltar yang gzhan 'das pa yang gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste yang ma 'ongs pa yang gzhan nyid la da ltar yang gzhan 'das pa yang gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
translated: But if the future is one thing, the present is another, and the past is another,

original: de lta na yang gsum car yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta na yang gsum car yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: But in that case, all three times would be permanent.

original: / rtag pa nyid yin na dus su brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rtag pa nyid yin na dus su brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are permanent, then it is meaningless to investigate them in terms of time, because they would have no purpose.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /🔽de rang las sam /
analyzed: 'di la gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na / de rang las sam /
translated: if time were to exist as a thing,🔽it would be established either from itself

original: ltos nas rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ltos nas rab tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or in dependence on something else.

original: de la re zhig gal te dus @247a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te dus @247a * //
translated: In that regard, if you think that

original: gsum du ltos nas rab tu 'grub par sems na /
analyzed: gsum du ltos nas rab tu 'grub par sems na /
translated: the three times are established in dependence on each other,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: depended on the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: the present and future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist in the past.

original: de ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
translated: If the present and future times existed in dependence on the past time,

original: de lta na da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: in that case the present and future times would exist in the past.

original: 'das pa na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa na yod par gyur na de gnyis kyang 'das pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed in the past, then those two would be past.

original: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be only one time.

original: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: dus gcig kho na yin na ltos pa mi 'thad de 'di ltar de nyid de nyid la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
translated: If there were only one time, then reliance would be untenable. In that case, how could that very thing rely on itself?

original: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dus kyang mi 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since reliance is untenable, time is untenable.

original: ci ste 'das pa'i dus zhig cing 'gags te med pa kho na yin na ni /
analyzed: ci ste 'das pa'i dus zhig cing 'gags te med pa kho na yin na ni /
translated: But if the past time is nonexistent, having ceased and been destroyed,

original: de na 'di gnyis ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de na 'di gnyis ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: how could these two exist in it?

original: ci ste 'das pa yang yod pa kho na yin par sems na ni yod pa'i phyir da ltar yin par 'gyur gyi 'das pa ma yin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste 'das pa yang yod pa kho na yin par sems na ni yod pa'i phyir da ltar yin par 'gyur gyi 'das pa ma yin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But if you think that the past exists, then because it exists, it would be present, and not past. But that is unacceptable.

original: smras pa / gang gi tshe da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ltos nas 'grub po zhes smras pa de'i tshe ji ltar de gnyis 'das pa na yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi tshe da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ltos nas 'grub po zhes smras pa de'i tshe ji ltar de gnyis 'das pa na yod par 'gyur /
translated: Objection: When you say that the present and future are established in reliance on the past, then how could those two exist in the past?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir de la ltos nas 'grub po zhes smras pa de kho na'i phyir de gnyis de na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir de la ltos nas 'grub po zhes smras pa de kho na'i phyir de gnyis de na yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it was said that they are established in reliance on that, therefore it follows that those two exist in the present.

original: gzhan du na /🔽da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: gzhan du na / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: Otherwise,🔽if the present and future

original: gal te de na med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de na med gyur na //
translated: did not exist in the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //🔽ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa // ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: then the present and future🔽would not rely on the past.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur na /
translated: If the present and future times did not exist in the past,

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur te /
translated: then how could the present and future that do not exist in the past rely on the past?

original: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na ltos par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum char yang tshogs par gyur na ltos par 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable that all three would be assembled.

original: ci ste yang de na yod par gyur na ni de gnyis yod pa la yang ltos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ci ste yang de na yod par gyur na ni de gnyis yod pa la yang ltos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: But if they existed in the past, then what purpose would it serve for those two to rely on the past?

original: de lta bas na re zhig da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ltos nas rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ltos nas rab tu 'grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, first, it is untenable that the present and future are established in reliance on the past.
