original: de la 'di snyam du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi 'das pa la ma ltos pa kho nar 'grub par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi 'das pa la ma ltos pa kho nar 'grub par sems na /
translated: But if you think that the present and future are established without relying on the past,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'das @247b pa la ni ma ltos par //
analyzed: 'das @247b pa la ni ma ltos par //
translated: Without relying on the past,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Those two are not established.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma ltos par yang de ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma ltos par yang de ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without relying on the past, those two, the present and future, are not established from themselves.🔽Therefore the present and future

original: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ongs dus kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ongs dus kyang yod ma yin //
translated: Times also do not exist.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas ltos par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas ltos par mi 'thad la /
translated: Thus because the present and future do not exist in the past, it is untenable that they rely on the past.

original: 'das pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And without relying on the past, the other two times are not established. Therefore the present and future times do not exist.

original: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis //
analyzed: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis //
translated: By this very method of reasoning,🔽the other two times should be understood as inverted,

original: lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // mchog dang tha ma 'bring la sogs //
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // mchog dang tha ma 'bring la sogs //
translated: as well as the best, the worst, the middling,

original: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
translated: and the one, etc.

original: rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis dus lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang / mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring dang gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //🔽da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag gal te ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na de gnyis kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis dus lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang / mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring dang gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o // da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag gal te ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na de gnyis kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very method of reasoning, the other two times should be understood as inverted, as well as the best, the worst, the middling, and the one, etc.🔽If the present and the past exist in reliance on the future, then in that case, those two would exist.

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag kyang ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur te de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag kyang ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur te de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the present and the past would be the future, because they exist in that.

original: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de la ltos par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de la ltos par mi 'thad do //
translated: But if that were so, they would exist at the same time, and it is not tenable that they are dependent on each other.

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang med do //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang med do //
translated: And because they are not dependent on each other, they do not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba med pa kho na gang yin pa de la yang de gnyis ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma byung ba med pa kho na gang yin pa de la yang de gnyis ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: And how could these two exist in the future, which is non-arisen and does not yet exist?

original: ci ste ma 'ongs pa yang yod pa kho na yin na ni yod pa'i phyir da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur gyi ma 'ongs pa ma yin pas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste ma 'ongs pa yang yod pa kho na yin na ni yod pa'i phyir da ltar nyid yin par 'gyur gyi ma 'ongs pa ma yin pas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But if the future exists, then because it exists, it would be present, and not future. But that is unacceptable.

original: ci ste de gnyis de na med par gyur na ni de la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste de gnyis de na med par gyur na ni de la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /
translated: But if these two do not exist in the future, how could they be dependent on it?

original: 'on kyang ltos par gyur na ni de lta na yod pa'i phyir ltos par brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ltos par gyur na ni de lta na yod pa'i phyir ltos par brtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they were dependent on it, then it would be pointless to imagine that they are dependent because they exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And they are not established without being dependent on the future.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te da ltar la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na de gnyis kyang de na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te da ltar la ltos nas yod par gyur na de lta na de gnyis kyang de na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, if the past and future exist in dependence on the present, then they would exist in the present.

original: de lta na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang da ltar yin par 'gyur te de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang da ltar yin par 'gyur te de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then the past and future would be the present, because they would exist in the present.

original: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de la de ltos pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na dus gcig kho nar 'gyur bas de la de ltos pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If that is so, then there would be only one time, and it would be untenable to depend on it.

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang med do //🔽'das pa dang @248a * //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir de dag kyang med do // 'das pa dang @248a * //
translated: Because they do not depend on it, they do not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa zhig pa'i phyir dang ma byung ba'i phyir med pa kho na gang dag yin pa de dag kyang da ltar gyi dus na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa zhig pa'i phyir dang ma byung ba'i phyir med pa kho na gang dag yin pa de dag kyang da ltar gyi dus na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: What do not exist are the past and future, because they have ceased and have not yet arisen, respectively. How could they exist in the present?

original: ci ste yang yod pa yin na ni grub pa'i phyir de gnyis la yang ltos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ci ste yang yod pa yin na ni grub pa'i phyir de gnyis la yang ltos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: But if they do exist, then since they are established, what use is it to depend on the present?

original: ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not established without depending on the present.

original: de lta bas na 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin la ma 'ongs pa la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'das pa yang yod pa ma yin la ma 'ongs pa la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the past does not exist, nor does the future exist.

original: da ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does the present exist.

original: mchog dang tha ma dag kyang gal te 'bring la ltos nas ni 'grub na /
analyzed: mchog dang tha ma dag kyang gal te 'bring la ltos nas ni 'grub na /
translated: If the best and the worst are established in dependence on the middling,

original: de lta na mchog dang tha ma dag kyang 'bring yod na yod par 'gyur gyi rang las ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na mchog dang tha ma dag kyang 'bring yod na yod par 'gyur gyi rang las ma yin no //
translated: then the best and the worst would exist if the middling exists, but not by themselves.

original: ci ste 'bring med na ni ji ltar de la ltos nas mchog dang tha ma dag yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste 'bring med na ni ji ltar de la ltos nas mchog dang tha ma dag yod par 'gyur /
translated: But if the middling does not exist, how could the best and the worst exist in dependence on it?

original: 'bring la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bring la ma ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that they are established without depending on the middling.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'bring yod na mchog dang / tha ma de dag yod par sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bring yod na mchog dang / tha ma de dag yod par sems na de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that the best and the worst exist if the middling exists, then we shall explain this.

original: gsum char yang yod par gyur na yang ltos ci dgos /
analyzed: gsum char yang yod par gyur na yang ltos ci dgos /
translated: If all three exist, then what is the point of dependence?

original: ltos pa med par yang de dag las gang yang rung ba rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa med par yang de dag las gang yang rung ba rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And without dependence, it is not the case that any of them is established from itself.

original: de lta bas na mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring dag ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring dag ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the best, the middling, and the worst do not exist inherently.

original: de bzhin du mchog dang 'bring dag la gal te tha ma la ltos nas yod par gyur tam /
analyzed: de bzhin du mchog dang 'bring dag la gal te tha ma la ltos nas yod par gyur tam /
translated: Similarly, if the best and the middling exist in reliance on the worst,

original: 'bring dang tha ma dag gal te mchog la ltos nas yod par gyur tam /🔽thog ma dang tha ma dag gal te dbus la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: 'bring dang tha ma dag gal te mchog la ltos nas yod par gyur tam / thog ma dang tha ma dag gal te dbus la ltos nas sam /
translated: or if the middling and the worst exist in reliance on the best,🔽or if the first and the last exist in reliance on the middle,

original: thog ma dang dbus dag gal te mtha' la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dag gal te mtha' la ltos nas sam /
translated: or if the first and the middle exist in reliance on the last,

original: mtha' dang dbus dag gal te thog ma la ltos nas sam /🔽thag nye ba gal te thag ring ba la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: mtha' dang dbus dag gal te thog ma la ltos nas sam / thag nye ba gal te thag ring ba la ltos nas sam /
translated: or if the last and the middle exist in reliance on the first,🔽or if the near exists in reliance on the far,

original: thag ring ba gal te thag nye ba la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: thag ring ba gal te thag nye ba la ltos nas sam /
translated: or if the far exists in reliance on the near,

original: de bzhin du sngon dang phyi ma dang gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid dang / de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / thung du dang / ring po dang / chung du nyid dang / chen po nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon dang phyi ma dang gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid dang / de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / thung du dang / ring po dang / chung du nyid dang / chen po nyid dang /
translated: or if the prior and the posterior, sameness and discreteness, identity and difference, effect and cause, short and long, small and large,

original: bdag dang bdag med pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / gcig dang gnyis dag gal te mang po la ltos nas sam /🔽gcig dang mang po dag gal te gnyis la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / gcig dang gnyis dag gal te mang po la ltos nas sam / gcig dang mang po dag gal te gnyis la ltos nas sam /
translated: Self and nonself, the conditioned and the unconditioned, one and two, many,🔽if one depends on two, or many,

original: gnyis dang mang po dag gal te gcig la ltos nas /
analyzed: gnyis dang mang po dag gal te gcig la ltos nas /
translated: if two and many depend on one,

original: de dag la sogs pa gang @248b cung zad ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gang @248b cung zad ltos nas 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: whatever is established in dependence on those and so forth,

original: brjod pa de dag thams cad de dag la yod par 'gyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod pa de dag thams cad de dag la yod par 'gyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: all those expressions will exist in dependence on those,

original: med na ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that they exist without depending on those.

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang de kho nar rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyang de kho nar rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all of those are not established from themselves in reality.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: But they should be expressed in terms of worldly convention.

original: smras pa / ma ltos par yang de dag 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: smras pa / ma ltos par yang de dag 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa /
translated: Objection: But it was said that “they are not established without depending on those.”

original: de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: 'di na dus ni skad cig dang thad cig dang yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang dus tshigs dang nu rab dang lo la sogs pa dag gi tshad dang ldan par rab tu grub pas de la ltos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'di na dus ni skad cig dang thad cig dang yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang dus tshigs dang nu rab dang lo la sogs pa dag gi tshad dang ldan par rab tu grub pas de la ltos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: But time is established as having a measure in terms of seconds, minutes, hours, nights, days, half months, months, seasons, years, and so on. What use is it to rely on it?

original: bshad pa / mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: bshad pa / mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Nonenduring time is not apprehended.

original: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
translated: What time is there to be apprehended?

original: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: Since enduring does not exist,

original: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
translated: how could nonapprehended time be imputed?

original: 'di la dngos po des par gnas pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po des par gnas pa rnams ni /
translated: Here, things that definitely endure

original: tshad las gzung du rung ste /
analyzed: tshad las gzung du rung ste /
translated: can be apprehended by means of a measure.

original: dper na shing 'di ni mtho ba /🔽'di ni chu ring ngo //
analyzed: dper na shing 'di ni mtho ba / 'di ni chu ring ngo //
translated: For example, this tree is tall.

original: 'di ni thung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni thung ngo //
translated: This one is short.

original: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: This elephant is big.

original: dus la ni gang gi tshad las gzung bar bya ba ril po nges par gnas pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus la ni gang gi tshad las gzung bar bya ba ril po nges par gnas pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But time does not have any measure that can be apprehended as a whole that definitely endures.

original: 'di ltar yud tsam yang cung zad 'das pa'am cung zad ma 'ongs pa la yud tsam zhes gdags pa yin gyi yud tsam zhes bya ba ril por nges par gnas pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yud tsam yang cung zad 'das pa'am cung zad ma 'ongs pa la yud tsam zhes gdags pa yin gyi yud tsam zhes bya ba ril por nges par gnas pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: In this way, a moment is imputed to the slightest passing or the slightest non-arrival of the future.

original: nyin mo la sogs pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: nyin mo la sogs pa dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: But since a moment that is definitely abiding does not exist at all, what need is there to mention days and so on?

original: de la 'di snyam du 'di na skad cig nges par gnas pa yod par sems pa na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'di na skad cig nges par gnas pa yod par sems pa na /
translated: If you think that a moment definitely abides here,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: skad cig nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig nges par gnas pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yang ma yin ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is called a moment definitely abiding is neither past nor future.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it definitely abides.

original: nges par mi gnas pa kho na'i phyir de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par mi gnas pa kho na'i phyir de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But because it definitely does not abide, it is not like that.

original: 'jug pa'i phyir de ltar zhes brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyir de ltar zhes brjod pa yin na /
translated: If it is said that it is like that because it engages,

original: gal te de nges par gnas pa yin na de grub pa yin gyi 'jug pa ma yin pas 'jug pa ma yin pa ji ltar da ltar yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de nges par gnas pa yin na de grub pa yin gyi 'jug pa ma yin pas 'jug pa ma yin pa ji ltar da ltar yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it definitely endures, then it is already established and not yet ceased, so how could it be present if it is not yet ceased?

original: de lta bas na dus nges par gnas pa yod ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dus nges par gnas pa yod ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that time definitely endures.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar gzung bar bya /🔽gang @249a * //
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ji ltar gzung bar bya / gang @249a * //
translated: How could that which does not exist be apprehended?

original: gzung du med pa de dag skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam la sogs pa dag tu ji ltar gdags /
analyzed: gzung du med pa de dag skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam la sogs pa dag tu ji ltar gdags /
translated: How could that which cannot be apprehended be designated as a moment, a second, a day, and so on?

original: de lta bas na dus zhes bya ba la dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dus zhes bya ba la dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, time is not tenable as a real entity.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Time definitely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rtags yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtags yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is a reason.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dang cig car dang cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang myur ba zhes bya ba dag ni dus kyi rtags yin pas de ltar rtags yod pa'i phyir dus yod do //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dang cig car dang cig car ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang myur ba zhes bya ba dag ni dus kyi rtags yin pas de ltar rtags yod pa'i phyir dus yod do //
translated: Since the reasons for time are the past, the future, simultaneity, non-simultaneity, a long period, and a short period, time exists because there is a reason.

original: bshad pa / gal te dus ni sngon brten na //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te dus ni sngon brten na //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If time is dependent on the prior,

original: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa de dag dus kyi rtags yin na /
analyzed: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa de dag dus kyi rtags yin na /
translated: If the prior, the later, and so on are the signs of time,

original: de ltan dus ni dngos po kho na la brten nas gdags pa yin gyi rang las rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltan dus ni dngos po kho na la brten nas gdags pa yin gyi rang las rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
translated: then time is imputed in dependence on things alone. It is not established from itself.

original: smras pa / ma yin te dus ni rang kho na las rab tu grub po //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te dus ni rang kho na las rab tu grub po //
translated: Objection: Time is established from itself alone.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa dag ni rgyu yin te /
translated: Time is the cause of the prior, the later, and so on.

original: gang las de dag tu 'gyur ba de ni dus yin no //
analyzed: gang las de dag tu 'gyur ba de ni dus yin no //
translated: That which becomes those is time.

original: bshad pa / dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: How can time exist without a thing?

original: dngos po ma gtogs par khyod kyi dus rang las rab tu grub cing nges par gnas pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma gtogs par khyod kyi dus rang las rab tu grub cing nges par gnas pa 'thad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could your time be established from itself alone and definitely persist without a thing?

original: rgyu dus mi 'gyur brtag pa nges par gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dus mi 'gyur brtag pa nges par gnas pa yin na /
translated: If the cause is time that does not change and definitely persists,

original: 'bras bu tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could the effect be different?

original: gal te tsee tra snga mar gyur pa dang / gub ta phyi mar gyur pa dag la de rang bzhin tha mi dad par gnas na de gnyis tha dad pa dag des ji ltar byas bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te tsee tra snga mar gyur pa dang / gub ta phyi mar gyur pa dag la de rang bzhin tha mi dad par gnas na de gnyis tha dad pa dag des ji ltar byas bar 'gyur /
translated: If Cetan and Gupta, who are not different in nature, existed in the past and future, how could they be different?

original: tsee tra dang gub ta gnyis rang gis snga ma dang phyi mar tha dad pa ma yin pa las dus snga phyi las snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du gyur la /
analyzed: tsee tra dang gub ta gnyis rang gis snga ma dang phyi mar tha dad pa ma yin pa las dus snga phyi las snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du gyur la /
translated: Cetan and Gupta are not different in the past and future by virtue of their own nature, but they are past and future due to temporal priority and posteriority.

original: dus de nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin na de gnyis tha dad pa dus kyis ji ltar byas par 'gyur /
analyzed: dus de nyid ni tha dad pa ma yin na de gnyis tha dad pa dus kyis ji ltar byas par 'gyur /
translated: If those times are not different, how could they be different by virtue of time?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: 'bras bu rgyu ni tha dad pas //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu ni tha dad pas //
translated: Because the effect is not different from the cause,

original: des na brtag pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: des na brtag pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the analysis does not exist.

original: yang na gang na rgyu yod pa //
analyzed: yang na gang na rgyu yod pa //
translated: Or, if the cause exists,

original: de na 'bras bu yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de na 'bras bu yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The effect does not exist.

original: ci ste de gnyis tha mi dad kyang dus kyi tha dad pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: ci ste de gnyis tha mi dad kyang dus kyi tha dad pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If those two are not different but are not different in time,

original: de lta na tha dad pa'i tshig med pa'i phyir thams cad tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de lta na tha dad pa'i tshig med pa'i phyir thams cad tha dad pa'am /
translated: then because the word “different” does not exist, everything is different.

original: thams cad tha dad pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad tha dad pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: everything would be undifferentiated.

original: de lta bas na dngos po kho na la brten nas dus gdags par 'thad kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po kho na la brten nas dus gdags par 'thad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is tenable to designate time in dependence on things.

original: dngos po ma gtogs par dus nges par gnas te gzhan yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po ma gtogs par dus nges par gnas te gzhan yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: Apart from things, time does not exist as a real entity.

original: smras pa / dus ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na @249b yin te /🔽yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: smras pa / dus ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na @249b yin te / yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
translated: Objection: Time is only designated in dependence on things.🔽For example, it is said, “It remained for a moment,”

original: nyin gcig 'dug go //
analyzed: nyin gcig 'dug go //
translated: “It remained for a day,”

original: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: and “It remained for a month.” Therefore time definitely exists.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gal te dngos po nyid yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te dngos po nyid yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If things existed,

original: dus dngos po la brten par yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dus dngos po la brten par yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: time would exist in dependence on things.

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
translated: But since no thing exists,

original: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could time exist?

original: dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Since no thing is tenable,

original: zhes bya ba de nyid sngar rab tu bsgrubs zin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid sngar rab tu bsgrubs zin pas /
translated: as was previously proven,

original: de'i phyir gal te dus dngos po la brten nas rab tu 'grub par sems na dngos po de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas khyod kyi dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te dus dngos po la brten nas rab tu 'grub par sems na dngos po de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas khyod kyi dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if you think time is fully established in dependence on things, since those things do not exist in any way, how could your time exist?

original: smras pa / gal te dus yod pa ma yin na de lta na khyad par med pa'i phyir byas par gyur to //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dus yod pa ma yin na de lta na khyad par med pa'i phyir byas par gyur to //
translated: Objection: If time does not exist, then since there would be no distinction, the past would become the present and the future.

original: byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dag la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag mi 'thad pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na 'thad pa yang yod pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de dag la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag mi 'thad pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na 'thad pa yang yod pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The expressions “it was made,” “it is being made,” “it will be made,” and so on would be untenable, but since they are tenable, time certainly exists.

original: bshad pa / gang gi tshe sngar /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi tshe sngar /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: When previously it was said:

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: Because the object of expression is stopped.

original: zhes bstan pa de'i tshe /🔽de dag la sogs pa brjod pa dag mi 'thad do zhes bya ba de ni khyod kyis cung zad cig smras su zad kyi /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de'i tshe / de dag la sogs pa brjod pa dag mi 'thad do zhes bya ba de ni khyod kyis cung zad cig smras su zad kyi /
translated: At that time,🔽you have said a little bit about how expressions such as those are untenable.

original: de dag la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de brjod pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de brjod pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: But not only are those expressions untenable, all expressions are untenable.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni de dag thams cad kyang 'thad de /🔽der yang / thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis ni de dag thams cad kyang 'thad de / der yang / thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
translated: All of these are tenable from the perspective of worldly convention.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, it is taught:🔽All is real and unreal.

original: de lta bas na dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang med par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should understand that what is called “time” is not an entity at all.

original: brten nas brtags par ni 'grub po //🔽dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: brten nas brtags par ni 'grub po // dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: It is established as a dependent imputation.

original: // / smras pa /
analyzed: // / smras pa /
translated: This is the nineteenth chapter, called “The Examination of Time.”

original: dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Objection: Time definitely exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dus dang tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus dang tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because effects are established from the assembly of time.

original: 'di na sa dang sa bon dang chu dag yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di na sa dang sa bon dang chu dag yod du zin kyang /
translated: Here, even though earth, seeds, and water exist,

original: myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: a sprout does not arise.

original: gang gi tshe de dag dus tshogs dang tshogs pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe na myu gu 'byung par 'gyur pas de ltar gang gi phyir dus dang tshogs pa nyid med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la yod na 'byung ba de'i phyir dus ni yod🔽pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag dus tshogs dang tshogs pa nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe na myu gu 'byung par 'gyur pas de ltar gang gi phyir dus dang tshogs pa nyid med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la yod na 'byung ba de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: When they assemble and come together, then the sprout arises. Thus, since the sprout does not arise when the assembly and coming together do not exist, and it does arise when they exist, therefore time definitely exists.

original: bshad pa / gal te 'bras bu skye ba nyid 'thad par 'gyur na ni 'bras bu skye bas dus kyang yod par 'gyur grang na /🔽'bras bu skye ba @250a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'bras bu skye ba nyid 'thad par 'gyur na ni 'bras bu skye bas dus kyang yod par 'gyur grang na / 'bras bu skye ba @250a * //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If the arising of an effect were tenable, then time would exist due to the arising of an effect.

original: nyid mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi dus yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: nyid mi 'thad pas 'bras bu'i rgyu can gyi dus yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: But since the arising of an effect is untenable, how could time that possesses an effect exist?

original: 'di ltar gal te tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur na /🔽'bras bu'i de tshogs pa nyid de la yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur na / 'bras bu'i de tshogs pa nyid de la yod pa'am /
translated: In this way, if an effect were to arise from the assembly,

original: med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: then it would arise from the assembly either having or not having the effect.

original: gnyi ga las kyang de'i skye ba mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: gnyi ga las kyang de'i skye ba mi 'thad do ;
translated: But its arising from either is untenable.

original: / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: If the effect arises from causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly itself,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: How could it arise from the assembly itself?

original: tshogs pa'i dngos po ni tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dngos po ni tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: The entity of the assembly is the assembly itself.

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar gyur na /
translated: If the effect arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin na ni 'bras bu yod pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid de la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin na ni 'bras bu yod pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: if the effect exists in the assembly itself, how could the existent effect arise from the assembly itself?

original: ci ste de yod kyang yang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i skye bar rtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de yod kyang yang skye bar 'gyur na ni de lta na de'i skye bar rtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it arises again even though it exists, then its arising would be pointless and eternal.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya /🔽thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la yang skye bas ci bya / thug pa med par thal bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: For what use is there in the arising of what already exists?🔽And it would follow that there is no end to arising.

original: 'di ltar nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it would never not arise.

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med de rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med pa skye bar 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med de rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med pa skye bar 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, but arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If it arises from the assembly

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye gyur na //
translated: Of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: How could it arise from the assembly?

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the effect arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa nyid de las 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin na ni 'bras bu med pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid de las 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin na ni 'bras bu med pa de ji ltar tshogs pa nyid de las skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: but the effect does not exist in that assembly, then how could the nonexistent effect arise from that assembly?

original: ci ste med kyang skye bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: ci ste med kyang skye bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if it arises even though it does not exist,

original: de lta na re skyes na yang med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na re skyes na yang med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then even if it has arisen, it would be nonexistent.

original: skye ba na med pa skyes na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba na med pa skyes na ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: If the nonexistent arises, how could it be existent?

original: 'di ltar ba lang skye ba ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang skye ba ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be like the arising of a cow.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: Moreover,🔽If the effect exists in the assemblage

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: Of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
analyzed: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
translated: It should be apprehended in that assemblage.

original: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med //
translated: But it is not apprehended in the assemblage.

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin par gyur na tshogs pa nyid de las nges par gnas pa de shing la bya bzhin du gzung du yod pa'i rigs na de la de yang yod kyang gzung du med
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de yod pa nyid yin par gyur na tshogs pa nyid de las nges par gnas pa de shing la bya bzhin du gzung du yod pa'i rigs na de la de yang yod kyang gzung du med
translated: If the effect existed in the assemblage of causes and conditions, then like a bird in a tree, it should be apprehended in that assemblage. But it is not apprehended in that assemblage.

original: de / gzung du med pa de ji ltar yod ces @250b bya ;
analyzed: de / gzung du med pa de ji ltar yod ces @250b bya ;
translated: How could that which is not apprehended exist?

original: de lta bas na tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par mi 'thad do //🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par mi 'thad do // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the effect exists in the assemblage.

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assemblage🔽Of causes and conditions,

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
translated: Then causes and conditions

original: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: Would be equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions.

original: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu de med pa nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: rgyu rnams dang rkyen dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang rkyen dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par 'gyur /
translated: then causes and conditions would be the same as noncauses and nonconditions.

original: de lta na thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: If that were so, then everything would arise from everything, but that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na tshogs pa la 'bras bu med pa'i skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshogs pa la 'bras bu med pa'i skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the arising of an effect that does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions is untenable.

original: smra ba / ma yin te rgyu dang rkyen des pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba / ma yin te rgyu dang rkyen des pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Objection: That is not so, because of the determination of causes and conditions.

original: gal te thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If everything were the cause and condition of everything,

original: de lta na thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smra bar rigs pa zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smra bar rigs pa zhig na /
translated: then it would be reasonable to say that everything would arise from everything.

original: thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag ma yin te /
translated: But everything is not the cause and condition of everything.

original: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dag mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dag mthong ste /
translated: Thus, the determination of causes and conditions is seen.

original: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon las kyang nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i /
translated: From a barley seed, only a barley sprout arises.

original: 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye la /
analyzed: 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye la /
translated: A rice sprout does not arise from a barley seed.

original: rgyu spun dag las kyang snam bu nyid 'byung gi / bum pa mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: rgyu spun dag las kyang snam bu nyid 'byung gi / bum pa mi 'byung bas /
translated: And cloth arises from cotton seeds, not from a vase.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen nges pa de'i phyir thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen nges pa de'i phyir thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because causes and conditions are definite, everything does not arise from everything.

original: bshad pa / mi rung ste nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / mi rung ste nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is not tenable because you have not presented a reason for their definiteness.

original: khyod kyis 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag nges so zhes bya bar nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma bstan to //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag nges so zhes bya bar nges pa'i gtan tshigs ma bstan to //
translated: You have not presented a reason for their definiteness, saying, “In this way, causes and conditions are definite.”

original: gal te med na ni de nges par gnas pa'i gtan tshigs med pa ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te med na ni de nges par gnas pa'i gtan tshigs med pa ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: If you have not, then how could it be tenable that they are definite without a reason for their definiteness?

original: de lta bas na nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pas rgyu dang rkyen dag rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pas rgyu dang rkyen dag rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because you have not presented a reason for their definiteness, it follows that causes and conditions are equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions.

original: de ltar thams cad las thams cad 'byung na /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad las thams cad 'byung na /
translated: If everything arose from everything,

original: nas kyi sa bon la yang nas kyi myu gu yang med la 'bras kyi sa bon la yang 'bras kyi myu gu med de /🔽de la gnyi ga yang med na nas kyi sa bon ni nas kyi myu gu kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon la yang nas kyi myu gu yang med la 'bras kyi sa bon la yang 'bras kyi myu gu med de / de la gnyi ga yang med na nas kyi sa bon ni nas kyi myu gu kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Also, a barley sprout does not exist in a barley seed, and also a rice sprout does not exist in a rice seed.🔽If neither exists, then how could it be ascertained that a barley seed is the cause of a barley sprout alone,

original: 'bras kyi myu gu'i rgyu ma yin no zhes nges par gyur pa 'di ci las gyur /
analyzed: 'bras kyi myu gu'i rgyu ma yin no zhes nges par gyur pa 'di ci las gyur /
translated: but is not the cause of a rice sprout?

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod na ni 'bras bu yod pas nges par gyur bar yang 'thad na de yang med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod na ni 'bras bu yod pas nges par gyur bar yang 'thad na de yang med de /
translated: If an effect existed in causes and conditions, then it would be tenable to ascertain it because it exists. But that does not exist.

original: de med na nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pa de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pa de ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then how could it be tenable that there is no reason for ascertaining it?

original: de lta bas na @251a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na @251a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pas rgyu dang rkyen dag rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do /
analyzed: nges pa'i gtan tshigs med pas rgyu dang rkyen dag rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa rnams dang mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do /
translated: because there is no reason for ascertaining it, it follows that causes and conditions would be equivalent to noncauses and nonconditions.

original: smras pa / mngon sum la gtan tshigs kyi tshig gi don med de /
analyzed: smras pa / mngon sum la gtan tshigs kyi tshig gi don med de /
translated: Objection: The words of a reason do not apply to direct perception.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid du nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs gzhan btsal ci dgos /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum nyid du nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu nyid skye'i 'bras kyi myu gu mi skye ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs gzhan btsal ci dgos /
translated: But when barley sprouts arise from barley seeds and rice sprouts arise from rice seeds, what need is there to search for another reason?

original: bshad pa / gang nges par snang ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod na 'thad kyi med na mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang nges par snang ba de yang rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'bras bu yod na 'thad kyi med na mi 'thad pas /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Even if something is definitely seen, if the effect exists in the causes and conditions, it is tenable. If it does not exist, it is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir med pa mi skye'o zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa mi skye'o zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we say that what does not exist does not arise.

original: de lta bas na med pa skye ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'ga' zhig bstan par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa skye ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan 'ga' zhig bstan par bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, you must teach another reason why what does not exist arises.

original: des na gtan tshigs gzhan des med pa skye bar rab tu grub na des par mthong bas thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs gzhan des med pa skye bar rab tu grub na des par mthong bas thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that reason establishes that what does not exist arises, then it is definitely seen that not everything arises from everything.

original: med pa skye ba'i gtan tshigs med pas gzhan yang mi ston pas /
analyzed: med pa skye ba'i gtan tshigs med pas gzhan yang mi ston pas /
translated: But since there is no reason for the arising of what does not exist, you cannot teach another reason.

original: de'i phyir nges par mthong ba ni tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par mthong ba ni tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod pa ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is definitely seen is the teaching that the effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: smras pa / 'di la rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gags pas de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur zhing rkyen rnams ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gags pas de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur zhing rkyen rnams ni de la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Objection: In this regard, since the cause ceases after giving its causal power to the effect, therefore the cause establishes the effect and the conditions assist it.

original: de la tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod dam med ces bsam pa des ci bya /🔽bshad pa / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod dam med ces bsam pa des ci bya / bshad pa / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: What is the point of thinking about whether or not the effect exists in the assembly?🔽Nāgārjuna responds:🔽If the cause ceases

original: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //🔽gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu byin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na // gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa'i //
translated: after giving its causal power to the effect,🔽then the identity of the cause

original: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: would be twofold: that which is given and that which ceases.

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: If the cause ceases after giving its causal power to the effect,

original: de lta na gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa des rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gang byin pa dang gang 'gags pa des rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: then the identity of the cause would be twofold: that which is given and that which ceases.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su ni mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is untenable that the identity of the cause is twofold.

original: 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa gang yin pa de ni bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has ceased is not generated.

original: rgyu byin pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyu byin pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that the cause gives its causal power.

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la rgyu sbyin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa la rgyu sbyin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a cause gives rise to an existent or nonexistent effect.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu yod pa la ni yang rgyu byin pas ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu yod pa la ni yang rgyu byin pas ci bya /
translated: In that case, if the effect exists, what use is it for the cause to give rise to it?

original: med pa la ni su la sbyin par bya /
analyzed: med pa la ni su la sbyin par bya /
translated: If it does not exist, to what does the cause give rise?

original: smras pa / rgyus 'bras bu rgyu byin nas 'gag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyus 'bras bu rgyu byin nas 'gag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Objection: The cause does not cease having given rise to the effect.

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'gags ma thag tu 'bras bu skye'o //🔽bshad pa / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'gags ma thag tu 'bras bu skye'o // bshad pa / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: In this way, the effect arises immediately after the cause ceases.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽If the cause ceases

original: rgyu ma byin par 'gags gyur na //🔽rgyu 'gags nas ni skyes pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu ma byin par 'gags gyur na // rgyu 'gags nas ni skyes pa yi //
translated: Without giving rise to the effect,🔽Then the effect that arises

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: From the ceased cause would be causeless.

original: gal te rgyus 'bras @251b bu la rgyu ma byin par 'gags par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras @251b bu la rgyu ma byin par 'gags par gyur na /
translated: If the cause ceases without giving rise to the effect,

original: rgyu 'gags shing zhig nas skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las byung bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags shing zhig nas skyes pa'i 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las byung bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: then wouldn’t the effect that arises from the ceased and disintegrated cause arise causelessly?

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar ni mi 'dod de skyon du mar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is unacceptable that it arises causelessly because many errors would ensue.

original: smras pa / 'bras bu ni rgyu dang tshogs pa dag dang lhan cig skye ste mar me dang 'od bzhin pa /
analyzed: smras pa / 'bras bu ni rgyu dang tshogs pa dag dang lhan cig skye ste mar me dang 'od bzhin pa /
translated: Objection: The effect arises simultaneously with the assemblage and its cause, like the flame and its light.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa dang 'bras bu dus gcig kho nar 'byung zhing mar me dang 'od bzhin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa dang 'bras bu dus gcig kho nar 'byung zhing mar me dang 'od bzhin pas /
translated: Therefore, the assemblage and the effect occur at the same time, like the flame and its light.

original: de la ci tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod dam /
analyzed: de la ci tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod dam /
translated: In that case, is the effect present in the assemblage or not?

original: med ces bsam pa de mi 'thad do //🔽bshad pa / gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: med ces bsam pa de mi 'thad do // bshad pa / gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: This is untenable.🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
translated: If the effect arises simultaneously with the assemblage,

original: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
analyzed: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
translated: then the produced and the producer

original: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would occur at the same time.

original: gal te tshogs pa dang 'bras bu lhan cig kho nar skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa dang 'bras bu lhan cig kho nar skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the effect were to arise simultaneously with the assemblage,

analyzed: de lta na skyed pa rgyu gang yin pa dang bskyed pa don gang yin pa de dag dus gcig tu 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /

analyzed: 'di ltar pha dang bu dag dus gcig tu ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /

analyzed: smras pa / 'bras bu ni tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol nyid na yang de de na phyis tshogs pa nyid skyes pas gsal bar byed de /

analyzed: mar mes bum pa bzhin no //

analyzed: bshad pa / gal te tshogs pa'i snga rol na //

analyzed: 'bras bu skyes par gyur na ni // rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa yi //
translated: If the effect were to arise🔽prior to the assembly,🔽then the effect would arise

original: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: gal te 'bras bu snga na yod pa nyid yin la tshogs pa byis 'byung bar 'gyur na /

analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa dang rgyu dang rkyen rnams ma gtogs pa'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, an effect that does not exist due to causes and conditions, and that is not included among causes and conditions, would arise without a cause.

analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa la yang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la yang skye bar brtags pas ci bya /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i don du rgyu dang rkyen tshogs par 'dod na /
translated: In this way, if you assert that a collection of causes and conditions is for the sake of an effect,

analyzed: 'bras bu de yang skyes zin pa nyid do //

original: de lta bas na de yang gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang gyi na'o //

analyzed: smras pa / rgyu yongs su 'gyur ba las 'bras bur 'grub ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs snga ma 'gag pa las rgyu 'gags na 'bras bur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de lta na rgyu ma 'gags par @252a * // yang 'bras bur mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: 'bras bu de rgyu med pa las byung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bshad pa / gal te rgyu 'gags 'bras bu na //
translated: If the effect arises from the cessation of the cause,

original: rgyu ni kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur //
translated: the cause would completely transform into the effect.

original: sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni //
analyzed: sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni //
translated: And the cause of what has already arisen

analyzed: yang skye bar ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would arise again.

original: gal te rgyu'i dngos po sngar 'gags pa na gnas skabs gzhan thob pa 'bras bu zhes bya na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i dngos po sngar 'gags pa na gnas skabs gzhan thob pa 'bras bu zhes bya na /
translated: If the state of having been a cause in the past, having ceased, is called the

original: de lta na rgyu kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur gyi skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur gyi skye ba ma yin te /
translated: “effect,” then the cause would be transferred, but not arisen.🔽For example, it is like the dancer who has cast aside one costume and

analyzed: dper na bro gar mkhan gyis cha lugs gzhan bor nas cha lugs gzhan du zhugs pa skye ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: taken up another, but has not arisen.

analyzed: ci ste yang gnas skabs gzhan du kun tu 'pho ba nyid skye ba yin na ni /
translated: But if the very transition to another state is arising, then in that case, it

analyzed: de lta na yang sngon skyes pa'i rgyu nyid kyang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: follows that the cause of what has already arisen would arise.🔽And in that case, things that have the property of changing would never

analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir nam yang mi skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: not arise, because they would not endure.

original: smras pa gang gi tshe rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur ba dang yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod /
analyzed: smras pa gang gi tshe rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir kun tu 'pho bar 'gyur ba dang yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod /

analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod lam du zhugs bzhin du lam 'dri'am /
translated: Response: Are you asking about the path while you are on the path?

analyzed: khyod dngos po yongs su 'gyur ba 'bras bu zhes bya'o zhes zer bzhin du rang gi tshig gi don khong du ma chud do //
translated: You say, “A thing that transforms is called the effect,” but you do not understand the meaning of your own words.

original: de'i phyir khyod tshogs che bas chog gi 'dug shig dang / da kho bo nyid kyis khyod kyis bstan pa'i lta brgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par rtog pa dag tu bstan par byas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod tshogs che bas chog gi 'dug shig dang / da kho bo nyid kyis khyod kyis bstan pa'i lta brgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel par rnam par rtog pa dag tu bstan par byas /
translated: Therefore, you have had enough of your great assembly, so sit down and now I myself will teach your theory of the relation between cause and effect.

analyzed: khyod yid bsdus la de dag nyon cig /'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par gyur na 'gags pas sam gnas pas skyed par byed grang ;
translated: Listen with a focused mind as I teach this. If a cause generates an effect, does it generate it having ceased or not having ceased?

analyzed: 'bras bu yang skyed pa nyid dam ma skyes pa skyed par byed grang na /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyang mi 'thad do //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: 'gags pa nub par gyur pa yis // 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //

analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel ba'i rgyu //
translated: How could an effect that has not arisen🔽be generated by a cause that has not ceased?

original: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
translated: How could an effect that has arisen🔽be generated by a cause that has ceased?🔽How could an effect that has not arisen🔽be generated by a cause that has ceased?

original: gal te re zhig rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed par rtog na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig rgyu rnam pa thams cad du 'gags pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that an effect that has arisen is generated by a cause that has ceased and passed away,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'gags pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa yod pa nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'gags pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa yod pa nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /

original: rgyu med pa gang gis skyed par byed par brtag pa de yang gang yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa gang gis skyed par byed par brtag pa de yang gang yin /
translated: What is that which you imagine generates it, which is causeless?

original: @252b skyes pa nyid yang ci zhig bskyed par bya dgos /
analyzed: @252b skyes pa nyid yang ci zhig bskyed par bya dgos /
translated: What is that which has arisen that needs to be generated?

original: ci ste yang 'di snyam du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ldan pa gnas pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed par byed par sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di snyam du 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rgyu 'bras bu dang ldan pa gnas pa nyid kyis 'bras bu skyed par byed par sems na /
translated: But if you think that a cause related to an effect generates an effect because the cause exists in dependence on the effect,

analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /

analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gnas pas 'bras bu yod pa nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
translated: In that case, how could a cause that exists generate an existent effect?

analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe 'bras bu skyes pa nyid dang rgyur 'brel pa yin gyi ma skyes pa dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when an effect is generated, it is related to a cause, but not when it is not generated.

original: skyes pa la ni yang skyes pa'i rgyus ci bya /
analyzed: skyes pa la ni yang skyes pa'i rgyus ci bya /
translated: What use is a cause that generates an already arisen effect?

original: de lta bas na de'ang mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'ang mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that also is untenable.

original: ci ste rgyu 'bras mi 'brel na //
analyzed: ci ste rgyu 'bras mi 'brel na //
translated: If a cause is not related to an effect,

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
translated: What effect does it generate?

analyzed: ci ste rgyu de 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba 'bras bu dang mi ldan pas 'bras bur skyed par byed par sems na /
translated: But if you think that a cause that is not related to an effect, that is not endowed with an effect, generates an effect,

original: khyod kyi 'bras bu gang zhig rgyus skyed par byed pa de smros shig / gang gi tshe 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa la 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid kyang med pa de'i tshe rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar🔽'thad bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyod kyi 'bras bu gang zhig rgyus skyed par byed pa de smros shig / gang gi tshe 'bras bu ma skyes pa'i phyir med pa la 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid kyang med pa de'i tshe rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de ji ltar 'thad bar 'gyur /

translated: If, though nonexistent, it had the power to generate it, then there is no doubt that it would also generate the horn of a donkey.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
translated: Moreover:🔽An effect is not generated

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: by a cause that is seen or unseen.

analyzed: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu bskyed par gyur na mthong nas sam ma mthong bar skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If a cause generated an effect, it would generate it either having seen it or without seeing it.

analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //

analyzed: gal te re zhig mthong bas skyed par 'gyur na /

analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa ni mthong bar mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: ci ste yang rgyus ma mthong bar 'bras bu skyed par byed par rtog na /

analyzed: de lta na yang rgyus gang dang gang ma mthong ba de dang de skyed par 'gyur ba zhig na skyed par yang mi byed de /

analyzed: de lta bas na rgyus ma mthong bar yang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //

analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu bskyed par gyur na /

translated: How is that?🔽An arisen effect does not come into contact with a cause that has ceased,

analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa rgyu 'das dang // ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //

analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa ni rgyu @253a * //

translated: Because the effect and cause of the past and future do not exist.

analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni ;

analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu skyes pa dang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar dang rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du yang mi 'thad na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar dang rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du yang mi 'thad na /
translated: Thus, if the effect of the past, future, and present and the cause of the past, future, and present do not make contact in any way,

original: rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur na /
translated: how could it be tenable to state, “A cause generates an effect”?

original: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
translated: Even if contact does exist,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed ;
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed ;
translated: how could a cause generate an effect?

original: / ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par rtog na /
analyzed: / ci ste mi 'thad bzhin du yang rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that a cause generates an effect even though it is untenable that they make contact,

original: de lta na yang rgyu yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu de ji ltar skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu yod pa nyid kyis 'bras bu de ji ltar skyed par 'gyur /
translated: then how could a cause that exists generate an effect?

original: 'di ltar yod pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de rgyu'i bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de rgyu'i bya ba yang med do //
translated: In this case, that which exists does not need to be generated again, and a cause would not perform its function.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyus //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyus //
translated: If a cause is empty of the effect,

original: ji ltar @253b 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar @253b 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: how could it generate an effect?

original: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na /🔽de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na / de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa 'am /
translated: In response to this, if a cause generates an effect,🔽does it generate an effect that is empty of the effect’s own intrinsic reality?

original: mi stong pas 'bras bu de skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: mi stong pas 'bras bu de skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Or does it generate an effect that is not empty of the effect’s own intrinsic reality?

original: de la re zhig gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed par rtog na de ni de ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed par rtog na de ni de ji ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: First, if you imagine that a cause that is empty of the effect’s own intrinsic reality generates an effect, that is untenable in any way.

original: ci ste 'thad na ni bye mas kyang til mar dang / chus kyang mar skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste 'thad na ni bye mas kyang til mar dang / chus kyang mar skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were tenable, then sand could generate oil and water could generate butter.

original: yang na bye ma dang til dag la yang til mar med la /
analyzed: yang na bye ma dang til dag la yang til mar med la /
translated: Moreover, if sand and sesame seeds are similar in that they do not have oil,

original: chu dang zho dag la yang mar med par 'dra na /🔽til nyid las til mar 'byung la /🔽bye ma las mi 'byung ba dang / zho nyid las mar 'byung la /
analyzed: chu dang zho dag la yang mar med par 'dra na / til nyid las til mar 'byung la / bye ma las mi 'byung ba dang / zho nyid las mar 'byung la /
translated: and water and milk are similar in that they do not have butter,🔽what is the difference between sesame seeds and sand in that oil comes from sesame seeds but not from sand,

original: chu las mi 'byung ba la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: chu las mi 'byung ba la khyad par ci yod /
translated: and between milk and water in that butter comes from milk but not from water?

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is untenable to state, “A cause that is empty of the effect generates the effect.”

original: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i 'bras bu skyed par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i 'bras bu skyed par sems na /
translated: But if you think that a cause that is not empty of the effect generates the effect,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te 'bras bu mi stong rgyus //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu mi stong rgyus //
translated: If the effect is not empty,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: how could the cause generate the effect?

original: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: If the cause itself is not empty of the effect,

original: des ji ltar 'bras bu de skyed par 'thad /
analyzed: des ji ltar 'bras bu de skyed par 'thad /
translated: how could it be tenable that it generates the effect?

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na de ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin na de ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ma yin pa /
translated: When the effect exists, it is not empty of an intrinsic reality.

original: skyes zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de /
analyzed: skyes zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba med de /
translated: And that which has already arisen does not need to arise again.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang skye bo ngo bzlog mi phod pas gzung bar bya ba yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de yang skye bo ngo bzlog mi phod pas gzung bar bya ba yin no /
translated: Therefore, since it is not possible to refute the person, it is to be accepted that a cause that is not empty of the effect generates the effect.

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa bud dha p'a li ta /
translated: Buddhapalita's commentary on Nagarjuna's Mulamadhyamaka-karika

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Buddhapalita’s Commentary on the Fundamental Treatise,🔽called “Wisdom”

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'di la rgyus 'bras bu skyed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: 'di la rgyus 'bras bu skyed do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang /
translated: in this regard, that which is called “the cause generates the effect”

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong pa'am stong pa zhig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong pa'am stong pa zhig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur grang na /
translated: would arise and cease either as not empty of an intrinsic reality or as empty.

original: de la kho bos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la kho bos bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, we will explain this:

original: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not empty would not cease.🔽That which is not empty would be unceased

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and also unarisen.

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong ba rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: An effect that is not empty of an intrinsic reality, which definitely endures by its own intrinsic state, would not arise and would not cease.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it definitely endures by its own intrinsic state.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin la ni 'gyur ba mi 'thad @254a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin la ni 'gyur ba mi 'thad @254a * //
translated: In this way, it is untenable that an intrinsic reality transforms.

original: pas ; de'i phyir 'bras bu de mi stong par yongs su rtog na /
analyzed: pas ; de'i phyir 'bras bu de mi stong par yongs su rtog na /
translated: Therefore, if you imagine that effect to be non-empty,

analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir khyod kyi de ni ma 'gags pa dang ma skyes par yang 'gyur ro //

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu mi stong pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu mi stong pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'bras bu stong pa skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that an empty effect arises and ceases,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could an empty thing arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes pa yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes pa yang thal bar 'gyur //

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa bdag nyid kyis rab tu ma grub pa gang yin pa des ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa bdag nyid kyis rab tu ma grub pa gang yin pa des ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: How could an effect that is empty of essential existence, that is not established by itself, arise?

original: ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur /

original: ci ste 'bras bu de ngo bo nyid med kyang skye ba dang 'gag par rnam par rtog na de la smra bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu de ngo bo nyid med kyang skye ba dang 'gag par rnam par rtog na de la smra bar bya dgos te /
