original: ci ste 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu'i ngo bo ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ram /

original: ci ste 'bras bu'i dngos po ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni des /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu'i dngos po ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur na ni des /

original: 'bras bu la cir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la cir 'gyur te /

original: 'di ltar 'bras bur yin pa skye ba 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bur yin pa skye ba 'bras bur mi 'gyur /
translated: In that case, that which is the effect would not arise as the effect.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu de stong par yongs su rtogs na yang med pa'i phyir ma 'gags pa dang ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu de stong par yongs su rtogs na yang med pa'i phyir ma 'gags pa dang ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur bas /

original: de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu stong pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur zhing 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu stong pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur zhing 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, an empty effect does not arise and does not cease.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur na /
translated: If causes and effects were to exist,

original: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /

original: de yang yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: de yang yongs su brtags na /
translated: Moreover, if you examine this,🔽it is never tenable

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
translated: that cause and effect are identical.

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //🔽nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du // nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //

original: skyed dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed dang bskyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //

analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //

analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid yin par gyur na /

analyzed: de lta na skyed pa dang bskyed pa don dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur bas de yang mi 'thad de /

analyzed: 'di ltar pha dang bu dag ji ltar gcig pa nyid du 'gyur /

original: sa bon dang myu gu dag kyang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag kyang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

translated: palm tree.🔽Thus, it is untenable that a cause generates an existent or nonexistent

translated: If something is called a “generating cause,” but does not generate,🔽then it would not be a noncause in any way. Therefore, everything would

analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu de gang gi yin par 'gyur /

original: 'di ltar rgyu'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod na de yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod na de yang med de /
translated: In this way, if it is asserted that it is the effect of a cause, that also does not exist.

original: de med na 'bras bu zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de med na 'bras bu zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: If that does not exist, it is untenable to say “effect.”

original: ci ste 'thad na ni pha med par yang bu yod par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do ;
analyzed: ci ste 'thad na ni pha med par yang bu yod par 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do ;
translated: But if it were tenable, then a son would exist even without a father. But that also is unacceptable.

original: / de lta bas na /
analyzed: / de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyu yod pa ma yin na 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa ma yin na 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: if the cause does not exist, the effect also does not exist.

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
translated: The collection of causes and conditions🔽Does not produce itself.

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
translated: If it does not produce itself,

original: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: How could it produce an effect?

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar brtag pa gang yin pa des re zhig bdag gis bdag nyid skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa 'bras bu skyed par byed pa zhes bya bar brtag pa gang yin pa des re zhig bdag gis bdag nyid skyed par mi byed de /
translated: But first, it does not generate itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: tshogs pa ni du ma yin par shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni du ma yin par shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is known to be a plurality.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te //
translated: The collection is not a single thing.

original: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
translated: So too, there is no such thing as a single entity.

original: gal te de yang de las gzhan //🔽de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod //
analyzed: gal te de yang de las gzhan // de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod //
translated: If it is different from that,

original: ces gsungs so //🔽da tshogs pa gang yin pa bdag nyid ma skyes pa bdag nyid rab tu ma grub pa des 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par brtag / ci ste tshogs pa bdag nyid ma skyes pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par byed na ni ma ma skyes pas kyang bu skyed
analyzed: ces gsungs so // da tshogs pa gang yin pa bdag nyid ma skyes pa bdag nyid rab tu ma grub pa des 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par brtag / ci ste tshogs pa bdag nyid ma skyes pas kyang 'bras bu skyed par byed na ni ma ma skyes pas kyang bu skyed
translated: then it is a single thing that exists.🔽Now, how could an unarisen collection, which has not itself come into existence, be imagined to generate an effect?

original: par mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the collection generates an effect even though it is unarisen, then it would follow that an unarisen mother would give birth to a child.

original: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
analyzed: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
translated: And the effect produced by a nonassembly do not exist.

original: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the effect does not exist,

original: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
translated: How could there be an assembly of conditions?

original: de ltar gang gi phyir tshogs pa de bdag nyid ma skyes shing rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir tshogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir tshogs pa de bdag nyid ma skyes shing rab tu ma grub pa de'i phyir tshogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu med do //
translated: Thus, because the assembly itself is not arisen and is not established, therefore the effect produced by an assembly does not exist.

original: de la 'di snyam du tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu yod par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu yod par sems na /
translated: But if you think that the effect produced by a nonassembly exists,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
analyzed: tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
translated: The effect produced by a nonassembly does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe tshogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid mi 'thad pa de'i tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshogs pas byas pa'i 'bras bu nyid mi 'thad pa de'i tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu rgyu med pa las byung ba ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: When the effect produced by an assembly is not tenable, then how could the effect produced by a nonassembly, which arises without a cause, be tenable?

original: ci ste 'gyur na ni pha dang ma dag med par yang bu skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na ni pha dang ma dag med par yang bu skye bar 'gyur ba zhig na skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were, then a son would arise even without a father and mother, but he does not arise.

original: de lta bas na tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshogs pa ma yin pas byas pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
translated: Thus an effect that is produced by an assembly that does not exist is also not possible.

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba shin tu mang po zhig bshad pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba shin tu mang po zhig bshad pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: Objection: What is the use of explaining so many contradictions with the world?

original: yod na re zhig rgyu dang @255b rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod de de yod pas 'bras bu yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na re zhig rgyu dang @255b rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod de de yod pas 'bras bu yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, then first the assembly of causes and conditions exists, and because it exists, the effect also exists.🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / ci khyod grong stong du mkhar ldan 'bebs sam /🔽khyod 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na tshogs pa yod par 'dod ko /'bras bu skyed pa nyid tshogs pa zhes bya na 'bras bu de nyid kyang gang gi tshe ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na rkyen gyi tshogs pa
analyzed: bshad pa / ci khyod grong stong du mkhar ldan 'bebs sam / khyod 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na tshogs pa yod par 'dod ko /'bras bu skyed pa nyid tshogs pa zhes bya na 'bras bu de nyid kyang gang gi tshe ji ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na rkyen gyi tshogs pa
translated: Do you bring down rain on an empty town?🔽If the effect does not exist, you assert that the assembly exists.🔽If the generation of the effect is called the “assembly,” then when the effect itself is not tenable in any way, at that time if the effect does not exist, how could the assembly of conditions

original: yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: exist?

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lhas kyang /
translated: Ācārya Āryadeva also says:

original: gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
analyzed: gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
translated: Because all things in the world

original: tshogs pa nyid la snang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la snang 'gyur ba //
translated: appear in the assembly,

original: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
translated: Therefore things do not exist.

original: dngos med tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos med tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: An assembly of non-entities also does not exist.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshogs pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Thus, because an effect does not exist, an assembly also does not exist.

original: de la dus dang tshogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: de la dus dang tshogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes gang smras pa /
translated: Therefore, since an effect is established in dependence on time and an assembly, time definitely exists.

original: de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de mi 'thad do //
translated: This is untenable.

original: smras pa / gal te dus kyang med rgyu dang 'bras bu dang tshogs pa yang med na gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dus kyang med rgyu dang 'bras bu dang tshogs pa yang med na gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: Objection: If time does not exist, and causes, effects, and assemblies also do not exist, then what else exists?

original: de lta bas na de ni med par smra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni med par smra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore this is the doctrine of nihilism.

original: bshad pa / ma yin te ji ltar khyod dus la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid las yod par yongs su rtog par byed pa de ltar mi 'thad par zad kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / ma yin te ji ltar khyod dus la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid las yod par yongs su rtog par byed pa de ltar mi 'thad par zad kyi /
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains: It is not so. It is just untenable that time and so on exist due to their intrinsic reality as you conceive.

original: de dag brten nas gdags par ni 'grub bo //
analyzed: de dag brten nas gdags par ni 'grub bo //
translated: However, they are established as dependently imputed.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'o /🔽// / smras pa /
translated: This is the twentieth chapter, called the Critique of Cause and Effect.

original: dus la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Time and so on definitely exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi tshe gang na 'ga' zhig 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang na 'ga' zhig 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sometimes, somewhere, something arises and is destroyed.

original: 'di ltar gal te dus la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur na /🔽'o na de lta na khyad par med pas dus thams cad du thams cad nas thams cad kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dus la sogs pa dag med par 'gyur na / 'o na de lta na khyad par med pas dus thams cad du thams cad nas thams cad kyang /
translated: In that case, if time and so on do not exist,🔽then since there would be no distinction, everything would always arise and be destroyed everywhere.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang mi 'gyur bas /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir dus la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus la sogs pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore time and so on definitely exist.

original: bshad pa / gal te 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag nyid yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag nyid yod par gyur na ni /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If arising and destruction exist for something,

original: dus la sogs pa dag kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa dag kyang yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then time and so on would also exist.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: But when

original: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram //
translated: Destruction does not exist without arising,

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor do they exist simultaneously.

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ram //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ram //
translated: Arising does not exist without destruction,

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor do they exist simultaneously.

original: de'i tshe gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
translated: At that time, if emergence and destruction existed,

original: phan tshun med par ram lhan cig tu 'gyur grang @256a * //
analyzed: phan tshun med par ram lhan cig tu 'gyur grang @256a * //
translated: they would exist without mutual dependence or they would exist in mutual dependence.

original: na ; gang gi tshe gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe de dag gi rgyu can gyi dus la sogs pa dag ji ltar yod par gyur /
analyzed: na ; gang gi tshe gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad pa de'i tshe de dag gi rgyu can gyi dus la sogs pa dag ji ltar yod par gyur /
translated: But since both of these are untenable, how could time and so on, which are based on them, exist?

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /🔽'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir te / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
translated: Because it is untenable.🔽How could destruction exist

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //🔽'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur // 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
translated: Without emergence?🔽Just as death does not exist without birth,

original: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med //
translated: So destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, how could destruction exist without emergence?

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig byung na 'jig par 'gyur gyi gzhi med par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig byung na 'jig par 'gyur gyi gzhi med par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When something emerges, it is destroyed, but without a basis, it is not destroyed.

original: dper na skye ba yod na 'chi bar 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa la 'chi ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na skye ba yod na 'chi bar 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa la 'chi ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if there is birth, then death occurs, but without birth, there is no death.

original: 'byung ba yod na 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba yod na 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In the same way, if there is emergence, then destruction occurs, but without emergence,

original: 'byung ba med par 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba med par 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Destruction does not occur without emergence.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang lhan cig yod pa nyid yin gyi 'byung ba med par ni ma yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang lhan cig yod pa nyid yin gyi 'byung ba med par ni ma yin par sems na /
translated: But if you think that destruction exists together with emergence, not without emergence,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / 'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:🔽How could destruction

analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // 'chi ba skye dang dus gcig tu //
translated: exist together with emergence?🔽Just as death does not exist

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin bzhin //
translated: simultaneously with birth.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, how could destruction exist together with emergence?

original: gang gi tshe na de ni de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin pa de'i tshe de gnyis gcig la lhan cig yod par mi 'thad de /🔽dper na 'chi ba ni skye ba dang phan tshun mi mthun pa de'i phyir dus gcig na yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na de ni de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin pa de'i tshe de gnyis gcig la lhan cig yod par mi 'thad de / dper na 'chi ba ni skye ba dang phan tshun mi mthun pa de'i phyir dus gcig na yod pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: When those two are mutually incompatible, it is untenable that those two exist together in one place.🔽For example, just as death does not exist simultaneously with birth because those two are mutually incompatible,

original: 'jig pa yang 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa yang 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, because destruction is incompatible with emergence, they do not exist simultaneously.

original: smras pa / gal te 'jig pa byung ba med par yang mi 'thad la lhan cig tu yang mi 'thad pas 'jig pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te 'jig pa byung ba med par yang mi 'thad la lhan cig tu yang mi 'thad pas 'jig pa med du zin kyang /
translated: Objection: If destruction is not tenable without an arising, and also not tenable simultaneously, then although destruction does not exist,

original: re zhig 'byung ba ni yod de /
analyzed: re zhig 'byung ba ni yod de /
translated: arising exists.

original: de yod pa'i phyir dus la sogs pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir dus la sogs pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: Since it exists, time and so on also exist.

original: bshad pa / 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽dngos po rnams la mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // dngos po rnams la mi rtag nyid //
translated: How could arising exist🔽without destruction?🔽Impermanence

original: nam yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: never does not exist for things.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, how could arising exist without destruction?

original: dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pas /
translated: Impermanence never does not exist for things.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: In this way, how could arising exist without destruction?

original: gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i tshe dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i tshe dngos po rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: When all things are related to impermanence, then impermanence never does not exist for things.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po skad cig tsam zhig mi rtag pa @256b nyid dang bral bar 'gyur na ni de ltar na yun ring du bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po skad cig tsam zhig mi rtag pa @256b nyid dang bral bar 'gyur na ni de ltar na yun ring du bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: As such, if a thing were to be devoid of impermanence for even a moment, then it would be devoid of impermanence for a long time.

analyzed: de ltar na yang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it would follow that it is permanent.

analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ni rtag tu mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pas /
translated: Therefore, things are always associated with impermanence.

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, emergence does not exist without destruction.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'byung ba ni 'jig pa dang lhan cig yod pa nyid yin gyi 'jig pa med par ni ma yin par sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'byung ba ni 'jig pa dang lhan cig yod pa nyid yin gyi 'jig pa med par ni ma yin par sems na /
translated: But if you think that emergence exists together with destruction, not without destruction,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /🔽'byung ba 'jig dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste / 'byung ba 'jig dang lhan cig tu //
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:🔽How could emergence exist

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽skye ba 'chi cang dus gcig tu //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // skye ba 'chi cang dus gcig tu //
translated: Together with destruction?🔽Just as it is illogical for birth

original: yod pa nyid du mi rigs bzhin //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du mi rigs bzhin //
translated: To exist together with death.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang lhan cig ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dang lhan cig ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: As such, how could emergence exist together with destruction?

original: gang gi tshe don de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin pa de'i tshe de gnyis gcig la lhan cig yod pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don de gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pa dag yin pa de'i tshe de gnyis gcig la lhan cig yod pa mi 'thad de /
translated: When those two objects are mutually incompatible, it is untenable that they exist together in one place.

original: dper na skye ba ni 'chi ba dang phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir dus gcig na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na skye ba ni 'chi ba dang phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir dus gcig na yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as birth and death do not exist at the same time because they are mutually incompatible,

original: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir lhan cig yod pa ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag phan tshun med par ram /
analyzed: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir lhan cig yod pa ma yin no // de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag phan tshun med par ram /
translated: so too arising and destruction do not exist together because they are incompatible.

original: phan tshun lhan cig tu 'grub par mi 'thad pas /🔽gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam //🔽phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig tu 'grub par mi 'thad pas / gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam // phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par //
translated: Therefore, when thoroughly investigated in this way, it is untenable that becoming and destruction are established without each other🔽or that they are established together with each other.🔽Those that are not established

original: grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: either together or not together,

original: de dag 'grub pa ji ltar yod ;
analyzed: de dag 'grub pa ji ltar yod ;
translated: how could they exist?

original: /'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam /
analyzed: /'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam /
translated: Those that are not established either together or not together, how could they exist?🔽Those that are not established either together or not together, how could they exist?

original: phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de dag dang rnam pa gzhan gang gis 'grub pa yod par sems /
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de dag dang rnam pa gzhan gang gis 'grub pa yod par sems /
translated: But they are not established as existing in mutual dependence, so how could they be established by any other means?

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore emergence and destruction do not exist.

original: de dag med na dus la sogs pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag med na dus la sogs pa dag yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If they do not exist, how could time and so on exist?

original: smras pa / gnas pa yod pas skyon med de /
analyzed: smras pa / gnas pa yod pas skyon med de /
translated: Objection: There is no error because endurance exists.

original: 'di la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gi bar na gnas pa yod de /
analyzed: 'di la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gi bar na gnas pa yod de /
translated: Here, endurance exists between emergence and destruction.

original: gnas pa yod pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa yod pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because endurance exists, emergence and destruction do not exist without something to which they refer.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dus gcig tu yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag dus gcig tu yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Also, emergence and destruction do not occur at the same time. Therefore there is no error.

original: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bshad pa / de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Response: That also is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dngos po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / rjes su 'brel pa yin pas dngos po 'ga' yang rang gi gnas na skad cig tsam yang mi sdod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / rjes su 'brel pa yin pas dngos po 'ga' yang rang gi gnas na skad cig tsam yang mi sdod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things are related to impermanence, no thing remains in its own state even for a moment.

original: de'i phyir / zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir / zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin /
translated: There is no emergence of that which is exhausted.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams mi @257a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams mi @257a * //
translated: Because things are never

original: rtag pa nyid dang nam yang ma 'brel te rtag tu mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i phyir dngos po zad par 'gyur ba la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dang nam yang ma 'brel te rtag tu mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i phyir dngos po zad par 'gyur ba la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: unrelated to impermanence, they are always related to impermanence. Therefore, the emergence of things that are exhausted does not exist.

original: 'byung ba med na gnas pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'byung ba med na gnas pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If emergence does not exist, how could endurance exist?

original: smras pa / 'byung ba'i dus na zad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba yod do ;
analyzed: smras pa / 'byung ba'i dus na zad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'byung ba yod do ;
translated: Objection: Since that which is emerging is not exhausted, therefore emergence exists.

original: /'byung ba gnas par 'gyur zhing gnas pa phyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'byung ba gnas par 'gyur zhing gnas pa phyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Emergence would endure and endurance would later be destroyed.

original: bshad pa / ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med //
translated: In response Nāgārjuna explains:🔽There is no emergence of that which is not exhausted.

original: gang zad pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba de la yang 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: gang zad pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba de la yang 'byung ba med de /
translated: That which is devoid of the characteristic of exhaustion also does not emerge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a thing.

original: 'di ltar dngos po ni zad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas de'i phyir gang zad pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba de dngos po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ni zad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas de'i phyir gang zad pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba de dngos po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since a thing has the characteristic of exhaustion, therefore that which is devoid of the characteristic of exhaustion is not a thing.

original: gang dngos po ma yin pa de la ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dngos po ma yin pa de la ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that which is not a thing arise?

original: de la de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad nyid kyang med pas /
analyzed: de la de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha snyad nyid kyang med pas /
translated: Since the convention “it arises in this way” does not exist,

original: de'i phyir ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med do //🔽zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med do // zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: therefore arising does not exist for that which is not exhausted.🔽Destruction does not exist for that which is exhausted.

original: ma zad pa la 'ang 'jig pa med //🔽de ltar gang gi phyir zad pa la 'byung ba mi 'thad la 'byung ba med na gnas pa nyid kyang med pa de'i phyir ma byung ba dang mi gnas pa 'di zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ma zad pa la 'ang 'jig pa med // de ltar gang gi phyir zad pa la 'byung ba mi 'thad la 'byung ba med na gnas pa nyid kyang med pa de'i phyir ma byung ba dang mi gnas pa 'di zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Destruction also does not exist for that which is not exhausted.

original: ma zad pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma zad pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because arising is untenable for that which is exhausted, and because endurance does not exist if arising does not exist, therefore destruction does not exist for that which is exhausted and not arisen, and it also does not exist for that which is not exhausted.
